job_title: DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) – Innovation and Technology Services
job_description:
Take your next career step at B&R – a member of the ABB Group – with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations.

Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Join the automation team at B&R- a member of the ABB Group.

Are you a motivated and collaborative DevOps engineer who is fascinated by technology trends and has a quality-focused and strategic approach to problem-solving? Do you possess excellent interpersonal skills and have experience in CI/CD pipeline creation, containerization, or cloud deployments? If yes, we would like to hear from you!

Your responsibilities
Designing, developing, and maintaining software build, release, and deploy processes, infrastructure, and associated tools.
Creating and managing CI/CD pipelines.
Troubleshooting and resolving production issues.
Collaborating with testing architects and engineers to integrate test cases into the automation toolchains.
Working with multiple product teams across the organization for deploying state-of-the-art development infrastructure and tools.
Contributing to the continuous improvement of the DevOps practices.
Your background
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a DevOps team or a role with a strong focus on continuous automation in application development and operations of digital services.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Passion for learning and keeping up to date with the latest trends and technologies in DevOps.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
More about us

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, you can expect an exciting and challenging job with an individually tailored introductory training. You will work in agile teams where you have the opportunity to actively contribute and drive ideas forward. Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life balance.

Our unique B&R spirit is characterized by appreciation, communication at eye level and an informal work culture. We offer you customized training and development programs as well as exciting development opportunities within the company. Numerous other B&R benefits (Parental Leave Program, Employee Assistance Program and many more) round off our offer.

In order to comply with legal regulations, we refer to the minimum salary of the collective agreement of the electrical and electronics industry of € 3.409,59 gross/month. There is a clear willingness to overpay, depending on qualifications and experience.

ABB's Machine Automation Division, also known to our customers as B&R, is an innovative automation company headquartered in Austria with additional offices around the world. B&R became part of ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division in 2017 and, together with the ABB Robotics division, employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries.

As a leading global provider of automation solutions, B&R develops, produces and sells industrial electronics, software solutions and mechatronic solutions as well as technologies for machine and factory automation. Since 2020, B&R's automation portfolio has also included Codian brand delta robots. With its innovative solutions, B&R sets new standards and consistently exceeds its customers' expectations.

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Wir wachsen! Deshalb suchen wir für unser Büro am Wiener Hauptbahnhof KollegInnen, die sich in unserem Produktionsteam persönlich und fachlich weiterentwickeln wollen. Wir liefern Berichtswesen auf Knopfdruck. Somit gehört die Erstellung von maßgeschneiderten Berichten für unsere Kunden zu Deinen Hauptaufgaben. Die Konfiguration des Moduls gestaltet sich für jeden Kunden neu und lebt vor allem von Deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe sowie Deinem lösungs- und prozessorientierten Denken.

Bist Du ein Ass im Umgang mit SQL und hast Du Interesse an verschiedenen BI-Tools wie z.B. MS Reporting Services oder Power-BI? Bist Du an Herausforderungen interessiert, die individuelle Lösungsansätze benötigen? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams!

Tools und Techniken zur kreativen Lösung unterschiedlichster Problemstellungen

Du hast eine abgeschlossene, technische Ausbildung oder einen Studienabschluss im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.Ä.
Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Du besitzt fortgeschrittene SQL-Kenntnisse (MS SQL Server) und bewegst dich routiniert durch relationale Datenbanken
Jemanden mit sehr gutem Verständnis für komplexe Datenstrukturen und Prozessabläufe
Du hast Erfahrung im Umgang mit Webapplikationen, Kenntnissen in Skriptsprachen (z.B. JavaScript, Powershell, …) und speziellen Datenformaten (JSON, XML)
Jemanden, der bereits mit Azure Cloud Anwendungen und der Infrastruktur gearbeitet hat - oder Interesse am Umgang und der Erlernung hat
Du bringst ausgezeichnete Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse mit
Eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, lösungsorientiertes Denken sowie eigenständiges und strukturiertes Arbeiten mit hoher Selbstorganisation gehören zu Deinen Eigenschaften

job_title: Lead Data Scientist/Lead Machine Learning Engineer (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
job_description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity

We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.

As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.

In This Role, You’ll Get to

Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness
Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation
Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality
Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference

What You’ll Need To Succeed

4+ years hands-on data science experience
Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks
Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala
Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment

It’s Great if You Have

PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields
Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems
Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop
Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

#sanfrancisco #newyork #seattle #boston #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #paris #london #tokyo #dhaka #vienna #edinburgh #manchester #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #singapore #ENG #IT #4

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Direct message the job poster from VIPASO – Vienna Payment Solutions
Alex Marksfeld
Lead Software Engineer at Vipaso
Salary range - 65k€ - 88k€. 
This is a hybrid role with being at least 1 day/week in the Vienna office.

Vipaso is fostering financial inclusion to boost prosperity globally. 
 We are currently working on:  
Design and implementation of whitelabeled apps and SDK’s. 
Developing features such as offline payments through Bluetooth. 
How do we work: 
Everyone from the leadership team was a software engineer at some point of their careers, so there is an understanding for what tech debt is and how important it is to repay it. 
We are a team of 7 engineers. 
DevOps is culture for us. We own things end-to-end (product design, system design, coding, testing, production release). 
We deploy our code to production frequently via CI/CD, measure lead time and release frequency.  
Having lunch & learn sessions where we share knowledge. 
Every engineer shapes the roadmap and product. 
Track work in Jira, document it in Confluence. 
A great software engineer should have:  
Experience as mobile engineer on technically challenging projects.  
Strong intuition for problem solving and process improvement.  
Ability to clearly and concisely communicate your thought process.  
Deep understanding of approaches to testing.  
Very good knowledge of English.  
Our tech stack: 
Swift and Kotlin.  
Bluetooth Low Energy protocol. 
Gitlab CI. 
Perks:  
Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths.  
Possibility to work on backend. Our backend colleagues will make it easier for you to learn backend development if you want. Btw, it’s in Kotlin. 
Our hiring process: 
Introduction call with hiring manager (45mins). 
Live coding interview (60mins). 
Call with our CEO (30mins). 
Offer.  
We are fast in the hiring process – usually it takes 5 business days to get an offer after having a first call.

Direct message the job poster from Tricentis
Ralitza Tabakova
Ralitza Tabakova
R&D Recruitment Partner EMEA at Tricentis
Tricentis is looking for an experienced, highly motivated Senior DevOps Engineer, to support our product delivery and deployment initiatives.

You will be part of the Tricentis Engineering organization and work closely with all functional teams involved with producing our software products.

Responsibilities

Evolve CI/CD pipelines to an enterprise level
Apply CD methodology to a mixed environment (Cloud/on premise)
Handle our virtual and database infrastructure
Understand continuous testing as an indispensable part of the pipeline
Enable a growing number of global agile teams to deliver continuously
Collaborate cross-functionally with different functional teams
Overall, you will help us improve and mature our delivery processes and the underlying tooling helping drive higher levels of efficiencies, cost savings and joy throughout our product development and delivery processes.

Minimum Qualifications

Technical education and a profound technical background (e.g., BS in Computer Science or an equivalent degree)
Hands-on experience with CI Infrastructure (e.g., Jenkins, Team City)
Proficiency with code revision tools (subversion, git)
Experience working with modern cloud technologies from AWS, Azure and GCP.
Experience deploying modern container-based applications and their associated tooling including Docker, K8’s, Helm.
Working knowledge of CI/CD based product development and delivery pipelines
Aptitude for problem-solving, quality consciousness and achieving innovative results
Experience with Terraform or Pulumi and ARM or Bicep

Preferred Qualifications

Working knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle
Knowledge of traditional agile methodologies, including Scrum and Kanban
Good understanding of application infrastructure, system architecture, and operating systems
Developer background preferred
Experience with Azure DevOps
Experience with MSI, WIX
NET / Java / PowerShell skills
Configuration management (ansible/chef/puppet)
Outstanding problem-solving and analytics skills

Tricentis Core Values

Knowing what we need to achieve and how to achieve it is important. Tricentis core values define our ways of working and the behaviors we model that create an enjoyable and successful Tricentis life.

Demonstrate Self-Awareness: Own your strengths and limitations.
Finish What We Start: Do what we say we are going to do.
Move Fast: Create momentum and efficiency.
Run Towards Change: Challenge the status quo.
Serve Our Customers & Communities: Create a positive experience with each interaction.
Solve Problems Together: We win or lose as one team.
Think Big & Believe: Set extraordinary goals and believe you can achieve them.

We Offer

What You Can Look Forward To

Full-time permanent job (open-ended contract)
Informal and open start-up culture
A team of passionate professionals who are experts in their fields.
Hybrid work environment (no core hours) and home-office allowance
25 days of holidays
4 days of paid Volunteering Leave per year to get involved in your local community or in a cause that matters to you.
Employee Engagement/Wellbeing – recognition of excellence across all functions and levels; regular opportunities to celebrate and socialize (parties, sport events, BBQs) and much more.
We follow a hybrid model of working as it gives our employees a perfect blend of flexibility and space for creative collaboration.

A minimum annual package from 63 897 EUR is planned for this position.

This is a rare and highly sought-after opportunity to be part of a highly talented technical support team within Tricentis. If you are interested in the opportunity to become a member of Tricentis where your ideas count, apply now for immediate consideration.

About Tricentis

Tricentis is a software company officially founded in 2007, with primary focus on software quality assurance. Whether exploratory or automated, functional or performance, API or UI, as well as mainframes or custom applications or packaged applications, or cloud-native applications - our comprehensive suite of specialized Continuous Testing tools makes DevOps real by giving our clients the confidence to release on demand.

Tricentis has more than 1500 employees working in across over 20 global offices in US, EMEA, APAC serving over 2100 customers, and currently expanding our R&D centers to two new locations in the Czech Republic – Prague and Brno - Hybrid office environment.

In this role you will be all-in on tactics, managing, maintaining, monitoring, and supporting the day-to-day operations and anticipating our future infrastructure needs while designing and implementing elegant solutions that meet them.

Job Description

Administer and manage SaaS applications.
Leverage the Dynatrace platform to analyze infrastructure issues, identify root causes, and implement best practices to prevent recurrence.
Use your insights into production to translate manual tasks into automated processes.
Work with software architects and developers to design and implement cloud solutions.
Maintain appropriate controls and documentation to support compliance initiatives.
Drive innovation through the ongoing evaluation, design, and implementation of new technology.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
Hands-on experience in SRE practices, building, managing, and operating distributed systems
2+ years of experience with at least one Hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
A deep understanding of CI/CD technologies such as Jenkins
Good understanding of security principles and design
In-depth knowledge of containerization using Kubernetes & Docker

„Versicherungen sind langweilig, altmodisch und kompliziert.“ Kommt dir das bekannt vor? Bei uns ist es definitiv anders! Wir sind mitreißend, unkompliziert und treffsicher – einfach mutiger. So gehören wir zu den Top Ten der heimischen Versicherungen.

*** SENIOR BACKEND/ DEVOPS ENGINEER (m/f/x – FULL TIME) ***

CarCutter is the global #1 visual AI editing and optimisation solution for the automotive industry and is used by customers from all around the world. Due to our steady growth we are now expanding our passionate & motivated CarCutter team (about 25 people) in Graz Austria, who is part of Meero: the world expert in image quality, providing the best end-to-end visual content solutions for online sellers. We are looking for a new talent as Senior Backend / DevOps Engineer (m/f/x) working from our office in Graz or fully-remote.

Multiple APIs feed our backend (both in Python), triggering image workflows and calls to our computer vision services, using SQL databases and message queues for image management, and delivering results to customer systems. Essential for us is a smooth flow of images, the continuous operation of our container-based services under Linux, as well as the monitoring and improvement of our scalable cloud infrastructure (AWS). Our team works with industry-standard practices of source code management, test pipelines, and CI/CD.

Your Mission @CarCutter:
Backend software development
Improvement and operation of our cloud computing environment
Improve automated testing (unit testing, end-2-end testing)
Design and implement flexible solutions according to customer requirements
Focus on DevOps to make our engineers' computer vision solutions available to all customers
Working as part of a young, dynamic team in a start-up environment

Your Profile:
Minimum of 5 years experience in (backend) software development
Excellent Python skills, and hands-on knowledge of Linux (system, networking)
Experience with SQL databases and queue-based processing
Good understanding of industry practices: architectures, protocols, containers, security
Experience with developing, operating, and monitoring cloud solutions (AWS)
Practical knowledge on proper source code management, documentation, test pipelines, and CI/CD
Team player with proactive approach and high sensibility for quality
English skills on a working proficiency level


Your benefits @CarCutter:
Freedom culture: enjoy full freedom by taking responsibility for your own projects and enjoy a flexible work schedule with home office options
Cordial atmosphere: good, friendly communication and cordiality are on the daily agenda here at CarCutter
The minimum salary for this position is EUR 60.000,-- per year with possibility of higher pay depending on qualifications and work experience

We are excited to get know you better and are looking forward to receiving your application to jobs@car-cutter.com

This is a role for a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer responsible for developing and maintaining Prism Lab’s Prism API platform hosted on AWS and other cloud services. Warum Sie sich für Novartis entscheiden sollten?

766 Millionen - so viele Menschen haben wir mit unseren Produkten im Jahr 2021 erreicht. Darauf sind wir stolz. In einer Welt des digitalen und technologischen Wandels stellen wir uns die Frage: Wie können wir noch mehr Menschenleben verbessern und verlängern?

Wir sind überzeugt: neugierige und ambitionierte Menschen wie wir finden gemeinsam in einem inspirierenden Umfeld neue Antworten und treffen mutige Entscheidungen.

Wir bieten Ihnen ein marktgerechtes Grundgehalt auf Basis Ihrer Qualifikation, Berufserfahrung sowie individueller Kompetenzen. Darüber hinaus bieten wir ein attraktives Bonus/Incentive Programm, moderne Firmenpension, Kinderbetreuungseinrichtungen, Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und weltweite Karrieremöglichkeiten innerhalb der Novartis Gruppe. Das Grundgehalt besteht aus dem kollektivvertraglichen Entgelt (mindestens € 54.788,30/Jahr auf Vollzeitbasis) sowie einer allfälligen marktangepassten Überzahlung.

Stellen Sie sich vor, was Sie bei Novartis tun könnten!

Novartis setzt sich für Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion ein. Wir sind bestrebt, vielfältige Teams zusammenzustellen, die für die Patienten und Gemeinschaften repräsentativ sind, denen wir dienen. Wir bemühen uns um die Schaffung eines inklusiven Arbeitsplatzes, der durch Zusammenarbeit mutige Innovationen fördert und unsere Mitarbeiter in die Lage versetzt, ihr volles Potenzial zu entfalten.

Einstellungsentscheidungen basieren alleine auf der Qualifikation für die Position, unabhängig von Geschlecht, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion, sexueller Orientierung, Alter oder Behinderung.

Unterstützungen für BewerberInnen mit Behinderungen:

Wenn Sie aufgrund einer Erkrankung, einer körperlichen Behinderung oder eines neurodiversen Zustandes eine Unterstützung bei unterschiedlichen Teilen des Rekrutierungsprozesses benötigen, wenden Sie sich bitte an disabilities.austria@novartis.com und teilen Sie uns die Art Ihrer Anfrage sowie Ihre Kontaktinformationen mit. Unsere Unterstützung umfasst die Beratung zu geeigneten Positionen sowie die Begleitung bei allen Phasen des Bewerbungsprozesses. Das österreichische Gesetz sieht die Möglichkeit vor, die örtliche Behindertenvertrauensperson (BVP) in das Bewerbungsverfahren einzubeziehen. Wenn Sie dies wünschen, teilen Sie uns dies bitte vorab als Vermerk in Ihrem Lebenslauf mit.

Treten Sie unserem Novartis Netzwerk bei: wenn diese Position nicht zu Ihrer Erfahrung oder Ihren Karrierezielen passt, Sie aber dennoch mit uns in Kontakt bleiben möchten, um mehr über Novartis und unsere Karrieremöglichkeiten zu erfahren, dann treten Sie hier dem Novartis Netzwerk bei: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

For our R&D Team in Graz or in St. Valentin (near Linz), we are looking for a Mechatronics Engineer, Chassis Systems (m/f/d).

In this exciting and challenging position, you are responsible for leading the development of concepts, prototyping, validation and launching them into production. You work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, agile R&D engineering development environment where you are able to exercise freedom to innovate and explore new methods and solutions.

Your Tasks

Develop chassis systems like controllable suspensions and by-wire-systems incl model building
Function development and integration in vehicle motion control.
Support the ideation process while identifying gaps in the current product or manufacturing technology to guide and provide future R&D efforts.
Evaluate technologies and product designs with compliance to needed principle and standards.
Working cross domain with e.g. ADAS, complete vehicle,… and in alignment with internal and external partners.
Prepare and present project progress reports.
Validate your developments on (virtual) bench environment as well as in test vehicle

Your Profile

Basic understanding about automotive technology in general and chassis (mechatronics) systems and functional integration
Basic understanding of Software/function development
Understanding of engineering principles and simulation including vehicle dynamics
Advantageous, basic knowledge and/or ability to learn: Mathworks Suite, Python, GiT, CAD, automotive data & application tools (e.g. Vector, ETAS), vehicle simulation (e.g. CarSim, CarMaker)

We Offer

Unique chance to apply science on automotive industry
Possibilities for creativity and room for own ideas
Corporate culture defined by innovation, involvement, and teamwork
Long-term perspectives in an international company
Attractive framework conditions for further training
Profit participation in the company's success
Home office options and flexible working hours
Employee and Family Assistance Program (childcare, health promotion, leisure and sports activities, benefits in everyday life)

job_title: Data Engineer - DWH, BI & Analytics (mensch*) - Vollzeit (TZ ab 32h)
job_description:
Du brennst für Daten und bringst großes Interesse an neuen Technologien mit? In dieser Rolle bekomst du die Gelegenheit, uns bei der Modernisierung und Umstellung auf Azure Databricks zu unterstützen.

Zur Verstärkung der IT-Abteilung „Data Platform & SAP“ suchen wir eine/n engagierte/n Mitarbeiter/in für folgende Aufgaben :


Design, Modellierung und Weiterentwicklung der zentralen Data-Warehouse-Lösung mit Schwerpunkt ETL
Transformation und Migration der bestehenden Legacy-DWH-Prozesse (auf Basis von IBM DB2 und Infosphere Warehouse) in Richtung Azure Databricks
Einhaltung der Architektur- bzw. Entwicklungsvorgaben und deren Qualität
Automatisierung und Optimierung von DWH Workflows (End-to-End)
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Fachbereich bei der Analyse und Entwicklung neuer Themenfelder
Erstellung der User Stories in Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachbereichen und Stakeholdern
Qualitätssicherung und technische Dokumentation der Beladeprozesse

Was zeichnet dich aus?


Der Blick auf Details und über die einzelnen Applikationen hinweg macht Ihnen Freude
Verständnis und Neugierde für komplexe IT-Landschaften
Hohe Zahlenaffinität sowie genauer und strukturierter Arbeitsstil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse von BI/DWH/ETL Werkzeugen insbesondere im Bereich der Azure Plattform (Databricks, Data Factory, Storage...)
Ausgeprägte Kenntnisse relationaler Datenbanktechnologien bzw. Spark-SQL
Guten Programmierkenntnisse (Scala, Python)
Kenntnisse der agilen Entwicklungsmethodik und Tools wie Confluence und ADO
Berufs- und Projekterfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Warum ist es großartig bei Zurich zu arbeiten?


Büro mit Wohlfühl-Ambiente - für jede Tätigkeit das richtige Umfeld
Home-Office und flexibles Arbeiten – Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit
Perspektive für eigene Entwicklung – Zurich Academy, LinkedIn Learning
Angebote für Ihre Gesundheit – Fitnesscenter, Events, Kantine mit Vital-Menü
Attraktive Konditionen für Versicherungsprodukte
Gelebte Diversity und soziales Engagement – PrideZ-Initiative, Eltern-Buddy-Netzwerk, Sozialprojekte
Mitgestalten unserer Zukunft – digital, innovativ und nachhaltig
…und das ist nicht alles!

Das Bruttogehalt für diese Funktion beträgt mindestens EUR 44.340,24 pro Jahr (38,5 Stunden/Woche). Abhängig von deiner Erfahrung und Ausbildung machen wir dir ein passendes Angebot. Dabei orientieren wir uns an aktuellen Marktgehältern.

Was macht Zurich besonders?

„Versicherungen sind langweilig, altmodisch und kompliziert.“ Kommt dir das bekannt vor? Bei uns ist es definitiv anders! Wir sind mitreißend, unkompliziert und treffsicher – einfach mutiger. Unsere 1.300 Kolleginnen und Kollegen arbeiten gemeinsam und nachhaltig am besten Kundenerlebnis. Mit Erfolg, denn unsere Produkte und Services sind mehrfach ausgezeichnet. So gehören wir zu den Top Ten der heimischen Versicherungen

Du findest dich in unseren Werten wieder und die Rolle wäre ein passender Karriereschritt? Wir freuen uns auf deine Online-Bewerbung über den Button Jetzt bewerben .

Bei Fragen stehen wir gerne zur Verfügung:

Zürich Versicherungs-Aktiengesellschaft

Human Resources

Mag. Daniela Stockinger

Leopold-Ungar-Platz 2

1190 Wien

Tel.: (01) 501 25 – 1305

https://www.zurich.at/ueber-uns/karriere


) Wir ermutigen alle Menschen sich zu bewerben, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Hautfarbe, sexueller Orientierung, Beeinträchtigung oder Herkunft und anderen gesetzlich geschützten Gründen.

WARUM WIR?
Möchtest Du Teil eines innovativen und führenden Unternehmens sein, das wirklich etwas bewirkt? Axon Ivy hat die Lösung für eines der größten Probleme in Unternehmen: ineffiziente Geschäftsprozesse.

Als DevOps Engineer (m/w/d) bist Du Teil des Professional Services Teams. Du unterstützt unser Team beim Aufbau und Betrieb der technischen Infrastruktur von Kundenprojekten in einem agilen Umfeld. Dabei führst Du die Entwicklung und den IT-Betrieb über den gesamten Lifecycle zusammen.
Es erwarten Dich abwechslungsreiche und eigenverantwortliche Aufgaben mit international eingespielten Entwicklungsteams!

DAS ERWARTET DICH
Du bist für die Verwaltung und das Management moderner und stabiler Infrastrukturen für unsere Entwicklungsteams verantwortlich.
Außerdem unterstützt Du bei der Konzeption und Administration von Container Plattformen (Kubernetes, Docker,…).
Du setzt Deployment Prozesse (CI/CD) um und entwickelst diese weiter.
Du berätst und unterstützt die Entwicklungsteams rund um das Thema DevOps.

DAS BRINGST DU MIT
Du bringst mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Konzeption und Administration von IT Infrastrukturen mit.
Windows Administration, Linux Administration und Active Directory sind keine Fremdwörter für Dich.
Außerdem verfügst Du über praktische Kenntnisse sowohl von CI/CD Tools/Pipelines als auch im Bereich Datenbank Administration.
Idealerweise kennst Du Dich mit Scriptsprachen aus, hast Erfahrungen in Cloud Technologien (z.B. MS Azure Cloud, AWS, Google Cloud) und in Container Technologien (Docker, Kubernetes).
Du hast Deine IT-Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen. Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und fühlst Dich auch in englischer Sprache wohl.

DARAUF KANNST DU DICH FREUEN
Dich erwarteten ein internationales Unternehmen, große Verantwortungs- und Gestaltungsspielräume, flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege. Du wirst von Experten eingearbeitet und in ein empathisches und aufgeschlossenes Team integriert. Der Arbeitsplatz ist technisch modern ausgestattet. Wir bieten ein Mindestgehalt ab 50.000,00 Euro brutto pro Jahr, eine marktkonforme Überzahlung ist abhängig von Deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung. Zudem teilst Du Dir Deinen Arbeitstag so auf, wie es für Dich und Deine KollegInnen optimal ist. Du kannst mobil oder in unserem Office im Herzen von Wien arbeiten.

Lisa Schirmer
Specialist Recruiting & Employer Branding

Direct message the job poster from CLC Digital
Irina Aleksic
Irina Aleksic
🚀 HR Consultant @ CLC Digital, Vienna
Join Our Client - An IT Company for Intelligent Software Development in Vienna!

In a world characterized by innovation-driven development, our client stands as a trailblazer in the realm of software creation.
This company consists mostly of developers - some of the best developers you‘ll find in Austria.

Our client is at the forefront of cutting-edge gaming technology, harnessing open-source technologies to drive their mission. Their Microservice operations framework streamlines everything from code development to cloud hardware provisioning, enabling developers to achieve faster and more frequent results. They have cultivated an environment that is truly the ultimate space for creating exceptional software.

For them, we are hiring an exceptional Java Software Architect!


Your Role

Being a part of their team, you'll dedicate at least 80% of your time to developing new features, with minimal meetings, bug fixes, and documentation work. Programming at its best and cloud hosting are the norm because speed and high-quality delivery are paramount. You'll be entrusted with building stuff end-to-end, from understanding requirements to production release. The release process is in your hands, done at your discretion.

Quality takes precedence over quantity, and their tech stack includes: Java, Kubernetes, AWS, NoSQL, MongoDB Atlas, Cloud Hosting, Microservices, and Open Source technologies.

Working with open-source technologies and microservices is the essence of this company. It's the ideal environment if you seek more freedom and autonomy in your development work. Trust is placed in your hands to discover and implement the best solutions. You'll collaborate with top-tier professionals who support one another.


Your Qualifications

To thrive in this unique environment, you should bring:
A solid foundation in Java development (5+ years)
A deep understanding of Kubernetes and/or AWS
A passion for technology in general, with a particular interest in cloud hosting and NoSQL databases
A genuine desire to code, without aspirations for a management career
An independent and self-driven mindset, as there are no Scrum Masters, Tech Leaders, Testing Engineers, or Sys Admins directing your work. It's your decision!
If you're comfortable with the idea of working in the real-money gaming industry (gambling) and crave autonomy, you've found your ideal match!


Your Benefits

Joining our client's team comes with a range of advantages, including:
Unparalleled autonomy - minimal managerial oversight and a flat hierarchy
Your choice of equipment - select the tools you work best with (typically the latest MacBooks)
End-to-end work, rather than dealing with a small portion of a massive system, where your contributions and ideas will be highly valued
Utilizing the most modern technologies and tools, within a culture of automation without legacy constraints
Frequent table soccer sessions
A hybrid work setting, offering two days of remote work per week
With them, you'll be part of a team characterized by an easy-going culture and flexible work hours

Location: Vienna, Austria
Salary compensation package: annual gross income of 90.000 EUR

We believe that automation is the key enabler for engineering teams to move fast successfully. With your expertise and passion, you will be part of a platform engineering team. Kubernetes I Cloud Native I Autonomous Cloud I Continuous Delivery I Release Automation | GitOps | Platform Engineering

Taking ownership of product components, implementing new features, maintaining them, and keeping your team’s technical debt small

Ensuring that delivering and releasing software on our Cloud-based Kubernetes platform works like a charm for development teams by following GitOps principles

Experience with hyperscalers (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP,etc.)
Experience with Terraform, Crossplane, ArgoCD, or Istio
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, Go, or Java)

Wir sind ein internationales Cleantech Unternehmen mit Ursprung in Österreich. Wir arbeiten unermüdlich an den Megatrends erneuerbare Energie, Digitalisierung und E-Mobilität. Speziell im Bereich der nachhaltigen Energietechnik geben wir den Ton an und setzen neue Maßstäbe. Das gelingt uns mit einem großartigen Team, das täglich über den Tellerrand blickt und innovative Ideen zum Zusammenspiel von Hard- und Software umsetzt. So ermöglichen wir für alle den Wechsel vom zentralen, fossilen Energiesystem zu einem erneuerbaren, dezentralen Energiesystem. Das ist der Weg zur Energiewende und die ist notwendiger denn je.
Wir bauen dezentrale Energiesysteme, die jedem Menschen auf diesem Planeten das Recht auf saubere, elektrische Energie sichern und gleichzeitig die Abkehr von fossilen Energieträgern ermöglichen. Dazu braucht es innovatives Denken, dem wir den Raum zur Entfaltung und Umsetzung geben. Weil wir gemeinsam an den großen Lösungen für die brennenden Themen unserer Zeit arbeiten müssen.

Unser junges und schnell wachsendes Cleantech sucht einem Senior Mobile Developer mit weitreichender React Native Erfahrung. Du arbeitest gemeinsam mit dem unserem Team an unserer Internet of Energy Plattform. Diese IoE Plattform steht für intuitive, dezentrale und vorausschauende Energie-Automation. Sie ermöglicht beliebig viele Geräte, Standorte und User zu vernetzten – unabhängig von Hersteller oder Location. Zahlreiche und namhafte Unternehmen (IKEA, BMW, usw.) setzen bereits auf unsere Plattform und sind somit Teil der Energiewende. Interesse geweckt? Wenn ja, dann bewirb dich gleich heute noch – wir freuen uns.
DEINE AUFGABEN
Als Senior Mobile Developer bist du maßgeblich an der Weiterentwicklung unserer neoom App und dem brandneuen UI involviert, um neue Features und Charts im Bereich unserer Internet of Energy Platform zu bauen
Du vereinst deine Kreativität und dein Gespür für gutes UI/UX Design mit deinen technischen Fähigkeiten, um Anwendungen zu bauen, die unsere Anwender lieben werden
Du arbeitest in einem motivierten, cross-functional Scrum Team, welches sich aus Spezialisten aus unterschiedlichen technologischen Bereichen zusammensetzt
Selbstständige Analyse von Problemfeldern, Konzeption von Lösungen und gemeinsame Umsetzung innerhalb deines Teams

DEIN PROFIL - MUST HAVES
3+ Jahre Erfahrung als Frontend- oder Fullstackdeveloper
2+ Jahre Erfahrung mit React Native, Typescript/Javascript, HTML5 and CSS3
Ausgeprägtes Verständnis des mobile application development lifecycles
Erfahrung mit nativen build tools (Xcode, Android Studio)
Interesse an kontinuierlicher persönlicher und beruflicher Weiterentwicklung
Hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und ein hohes Maß für Eigenverantwortung
Gute Deutsch- und/oder Englischkenntnisse
Deine lokale Zeitzone ist maximal 2 Stunden von CET entfernt
DEIN PROFIL - NICE TO HAVE
Erfahrung mit GraphQL
Erfahrung mit Native Module Entwicklung (Android/iOS)
Erfahrung mit Visualisierung von Energiedaten
Erfahrung mit Node.js (backend-for-frontend layer)

DAS ERWARTET DICH
Ein motiviertes, dynamisches und stark wachsendes Team mit Leidenschaft für unsere Mission, inklusive einer familiären „Du-Kultur“ ab unserem ersten Kennenlernen.
Möglichkeit der aktiven Mitgestaltung und Umsetzung eigener Ideen in einem Unternehmen mit internationaler Expansion und Top Kunden.
Förderung der laufenden beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung im Unternehmen.
Diverse Benefits wie z.B. Mitarbeiterrabatte, Firmenfahrräder und eine vergünstigte Fitnesscentermitgliedschaft erwarten dich bei uns.
Innovative Büros in unserem Headquarter „Free City” in Freistadt & im Wiener Office im ICON Tower am Hauptbahnhof.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice sowie eine Kantine im neuen Headquarter in Freistadt.
Du, deine Erfahrung und dein Mehrwert für neoom sind einmalig. Laut Gesetz ist eine Gehaltsangabe notwendig (€ 3.600- brutto pro Monat für 38,5 Wochenstunden). Es ist selbstverständlich, dass wir über deine individuelle Bezahlung persönlich – als Teil einer guten, beruflichen Partnerschaft - sprechen.

job_title: Senior System Engineer (m/f/d) - Home Office possible
job_description:
Do you want a job with a purpose?

And do you want to make healthcare safer, better and more reliable?

Join our Team!

We want to invest. In your future.

We are Dedalus HealthCare, a major player in healthcare software solutions, located in Vienna. We are looking for passionate and highly motivated individuals that desire to be part of something big. With us, each individual employee assumes responsibility and actively contributes to the success and growth of our company.

We strongly believe that the more we promote and challenge our employees, the more we achieve as a company. We accompany and develop you individually so that you can reach your full potential.

Does that sound interesting? - Then we are looking for you for our R&D as a

Senior System Engineer (m/f/d) - Home office possible

Role and Responsibilities:

As a Senior System Engineer you will come into contact with a very wide range of systems and tasks.

You will join the team responsible for the maintenance, monitoring, and performance of the entire IT infrastructure.

You monitor the implementation of our standards, and you also support our internal users in case of problems.

Due to the exponential growth, you and the team will further expand the infrastructure worldwide.

This includes, for example, thinking about new technologies together with the team and helping to realize them.

Constantly improving and optimizing our existing and new infrastructure
Designing and supporting cloud infrastructure
Configuration and monitoring of backup and recovery
Designing and deploying new applications and making improvements to existing applications
You closely monitor the daily management of the server park
You will research new technologies and advise them when they contribute to an improvement of an existing or new platform




Qualifications and Education Requirements:

IT graduate
10 years in similar or same position
English: good (oral & written)
Great problem-solving ability
Independent & sense of initiative
Progressive & eager to learn
Entrepreneurial & strong self-motivation
Communicative, stress resistant, flexibility




Preferred Skills:

Good knowledge of Windows Operating Systems
Good knowledge of Server software (eg. Microsoft IIS, backup software, antivirus)
Good knowledge of Virtualization (Hyper-V)
Good knowledge of Networking (TCP/IP, DNS, load balancers, firewalls, …)
Good knowledge of Databases (MSSQL, Postgres),
Knowledge of server hardware
Knowledge of storage systems
Broad knowledge of security
You are open to new technologies and are prepared to regularly train yourself in this

  

We offer you: 

All the advantages of an established, international company
You are part of a first-class, creative and innovative team
You have creative leeway and a high degree of influence on your work
Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home
The option to attend conferences, trainings and technology certifications
You can actively shape the visions and goals of the product

The minimum salary for this position is EUR 65.000,-- p.a. An overpayment depending upon qualification/experience is a matter of course.

Be part of our innovative power and shape the future with us!

#teamdedalus #together4success #dedalusgroup

We are looking forward receiving your online application!

Dedalus HealthCare Ges.m.b.H.

Human Resources

Quartier Belvedere Central
Gertrude-Fröhlich-Sandner-Straße 1 
A - 1100 Wien 

https://www.dedalusgroup.de/hospital-it/careers/

Dedalus produces, distributes, implements and maintains complex, technologically advanced and innovative IT solutions for hospitals, rehabilitation clinics, psychiatric clinics and diagnostic facilities such as radiology and cardiology.

These IT solutions support all essential processes of administration, documentation, workflow control and audit-proof archiving of data and documents in health care companies. Founded in Florence in 1982, the Dedalus Group is the leading provider of healthcare and diagnostic software in Europe and one of the largest in the world.

Direct message the job poster from Sentry (sentry.io)
Brandon Baca
Brandon Baca
{head hunter searching for developers to join the fight against bad software} 👾
About Sentry
Bad software is everywhere, and we’re tired of it. Sentry is on a mission to help developers write better software faster, so we can get back to enjoying technology.
With more than $217 million in funding and 85,000 organizations that believe we’re on to something, we're building performance and error monitoring tools that help companies like Disney, Microsoft, and Atlassian spend less time fixing bugs and more time building products. If you like to selfishly build things that make your digital life better, come help us build the next generation of software monitoring tools.

About the role
As a Senior Software Engineer in the Processing team at Sentry, you will play a pivotal role in a cross-functional team dedicated to ensuring the smooth operation of Sentry's client-facing systems. Your primary responsibility will be designing, enhancing, and maintaining our event processing pipeline.

In this role, you'll have the exciting opportunity to influence the design and improvement of both our external and internal services, while also contributing to the creation of essential software that drives Sentry's mission.
If you're passionate about developing and enhancing features that empower software development teams to excel and are excited about the prospect of contributing to open source projects, then this position is tailor-made for you. Join us in making a difference in the world of software development.

In this role you will
Develop horizontally scalable and globally distributed infrastructure that delivers mission-critical data from customer applications to Sentry
Work in the Processing team to improve and evolve our processing pipeline and the services we use to scale Sentry
Puzzle over unique challenges in the fields of distributed systems, performance optimization, high-performance data processing pipelines
Use a variety of programming languages, systems, and technologies to solve problems related to mission-critical software of Sentry (mostly Rust and Python)
Collaborate with Infrastructure and Operations teams to build solutions that scale (we process over a billion events every day)
Write unit and integration tests that ensure the correctness of your work, as well as strong documentation to help educate both peers and customers

You’ll love this job if you
Take challenges that you don't see every day, daily
Care about writing highly performant, high-quality code
Want to build a product by developers for developers
Get excited about joining a modern software development team that iterates and ships code rapidly
Want to contribute to open source full-time — our product is entirely Open Source
Enjoy working in an agile team of engineers who push themselves and others to do better

Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience
Experience in solving complex problems by developing high-quality, high-performance software
Proficiency in Python
Experience working with distributed systems and streaming / queuing platforms (e.g. Kafka, Celery)
Familiarity with databases, both relational and NoSQL, for data storage and retrieval within the pipeline
Bonus points for experience with native languages including Rust, C++, Go
Good written and spoken English communication skills
Live in the Vienna, Austria area or are willing to relocate

We are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 52,220,-- gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement (IT-KV). The salary that Sentry offers you is adjusted to the current market situation and our starting point is EUR 85,000-- gross per year. A successful candidate’s actual base salary (or hourly wage) amount will be determined by a variety of relevant factors including, without limitation, the candidate’s work location, education, work and other relevant experience, skills, and job-related knowledge. A successful candidate will be eligible to participate in Sentry’s employee benefit plans/programs applicable to the candidate’s position (including incentive compensation, equity grants, paid time off, and group health insurance coverage). See Sentry Benefits for more details about the Company’s benefit plans/programs.

Equal Opportunity at Sentry
Sentry is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to its employees and candidates for employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or other legally-protected characteristic. This commitment includes the provision of reasonable accommodations to employees and candidates for employment with physical or mental disabilities who require such accommodations in order to (a) perform the essential functions of their jobs, or (b) seek employment with Sentry. We strive to build a diverse team, with an inclusive culture where every teammate can thrive. Sentry is an open-source company because we believe that everyone, everywhere, should have the ability and tools to make great software. Software should be accessible. That starts with making our industry accessible.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recops@sentry.io.
Want to learn more about how Sentry handles applicant data? Get the details in our Applicant Privacy Policy.

WIE WIRD DEIN PLATZ AUSSEHEN?

ITSP Services is an innovative and expanding e-business company located in the beautiful town of Salzburg in Austria.
We provide services to one of the most established providers in the internet entertainment industry that serves customers from all over the world. Our success is based on a long tradition of business integrity, fun at work and customer focus. Due to the continuing growth of the company, we are looking for a


SENIOR SYSTEMS ENGINEER


ITSP operates in several datacentres across the globe and strongly believes in on-premises technology to provide its own private cloud using cutting-edge technology. This ensures maximum protection for our customers’ data and removes dependencies on large cloud providers.


You will be responsible for:

Administration, coordination and enhancement of our IT infrastructure
Installation, maintenance and administration of Windows and/or Linux server systems
Creation and implementation of internal tools and automation processes
Working on projects that contribute to improving the computer systems and the network structure of the organisation, including backup and restore, Local/Wide-area network management, installation and maintenance of new and existing applications and services
Troubleshooting and resolution of system and/or network problems
Technical assistance for and cooperation with other engineers and software developers
Configuration, management and support of both physical and virtualised server environments


Preferred knowledge and experience:

Scripting languages such as powershell, bash, python
Local and wide area network design for a medium-sized internet business, including VLAN, firewall, VPN and router configuration
Infrastructure monitoring tools such Zabbix, Solarwinds
Popular Windows services such as Exchange, IIS, SQL Server, Active Directory etc.
Popular Linux services such as Postfix, Dovecot, Apache, NGINX, MySQL
Virtualisation and containerisation technologies such as VMWare, Proxmox, Kubernetes, Docker etc.


Personal attributes:

A passion for all things related to information technology and information security
Attention to detail, patience and endurance in problem solving
Good oral and written communication skills in our work language which is English

Prospects:
Be part of a dynamic, committed but still relaxed team
Full time position with flexible working hours and home-office opportunities
Compatible with a good balance between work and family
Excellent opportunities for personal development
We offer a salary based on the Austrian collective labour agreement (Kollektivvertrag) with a minimum of 61,656 Euros gross per year. However, the agreed salary will be based on your skills and experience


If you are knowledgeable in the majority of the listed topics and are willing to learn and you would like to join our IT team in Salzburg, we look forward to receiving your application, which should include your CV and any certifications.

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

For our R&D Team in Graz or in St. Valentin (near Linz), we are looking for a Sr. Engineer Chassis Systems (m/f/d).

In this exciting and challenging position, you are responsible for leading the development of concepts, prototyping, validation and launching them into production. You work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, agile R&D engineering development environment where you are able to exercise freedom to innovate and explore new methods and solutions.

Your Tasks

Develop a chassis systems where a driver would not feel anything while riding over bumps.
Support the ideation process while identifying gaps in the current product or manufacturing technology to guide and provide future R&D efforts.
Evaluate technologies and product designs with compliance to scientific principles, engineering principles, company standards, customer requirements, and related specifications
Provide engineering support to other departments within the company as directed by the department leader.
Prepare and present project progress reports.
Demonstrate sustained innovation and creativity leading to significant project accomplishments without direct technical supervision .

Your Profile

Comprehensive understanding about automotive technology in general and chassis (mechatronics) systems and functional integration in specific, e.g.: multi-mass systems, kinematics & compliance, steering behaviour, comfort, performance, braking etc.
Good understanding of basic SW/function development, e.g.: object oriented software design, electrics etc.
Good understanding of basic engineering principles, simulation, e.g.: evaluation of dynam-ic systems (frequency, stiffness, stress) etc.
Advantageous: Matlab, Python, GiT, automotive data & application tools (Vector, ETAS)

We Offer

Unique chance to apply science on automotive industry
Possibilities for creativity and room for own ideas
Corporate culture defined by innovation, involvement, and teamwork
Long-term perspectives in an international company
Attractive framework conditions for further training
Profit participation in the company's success
Home office options and flexible working hours
Employee and Family Assistance Program (childcare, health promotion, leisure and sports activities, benefits in everyday life)

Additional Information

The minimum annual remuneration package for this position is EUR 60.000,- with corresponding qualification. The actual salary is higher and depends on your education and specific work experience.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Apply on-line to join our talented R&D team and help Magna to stay ahead of the industry.

job_title: (Senior) Software Architect (m/f/x) for Automation and Integration
job_description:
Job Description

In this role, you will shape our Automation Solution and improve product delivery in a modern environment with state-of-the-art technology.

Automation is key, for us and our customers, and a great enabler. Workflow automation, such as technical delivery or release flows, and 3rd party DevOps tooling & process integrations are critical success factors for our Dynatrace platform.

Therefore, we are looking for a Software/Product Architect with focus on Automation and Integration. You will build and improve the architectural fundament for your areas of responsibility.

Your role

Make “quality first” architectural decisions based on performance, scalability and reliability
Design integrations and edge execution use-cases
Specify technical and non-functional requirements (e.g. scalability, robustness)
Define and monitor performance KPIs
Transfer architectural know-how to our development teams
Provide guidance and support to developers, team members and other stakeholders regarding technical decisions
Take active part in development and work on technically especially challenging/complex development stories
Conduct code reviews on advanced and sensitive changeset domains

Qualifications
Several years of experience in designing and implementing complex Software Architectures
History and strong background as Senior Software Engineer, Product Architect or similar in an agile IT/Software environment
Hands-on experience with at least one of the top cloud vendors (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP) and K8s (especially in deployment, operators & workloads)
Automation experience with some of the following:
Workflows (technical delivery flows, business workflows, release flows, …)
Pipelining
Scheduling (K8S native, Batch execution)
Remote / Edge Execution (job & task execution)
Integrations (Jira, Git, Slack, …)
Orchestration (complex flow coordination)
Scripting languages
Communicative & solution-oriented personality
Hands-on mentality, Can-do attitude, Team spirit, drive and vision

Additional Information

What's in it for you?

A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all.
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side. If you need to relocate for a position you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance and support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, as well as a dedicated buddy program.

Compensation And Rewards

We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 75,000 gross per year based on full-time employment (38.5 h/week). We offer a higher salary in line with qualification and experience.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer for Credit Limit Solutions (all genders)
job_description:
Direct message the job poster from Erste Digital
Timur Teksoy
Timur Teksoy
IT Recruiting & Talent Scout at Erste Group Bank AG | Self-employed photographer
With top notch technology, we drive the realization offers the Group’s vision: To provide human banking in digital times, and to build Financial Health for over 16 million customers in the CEE region.

Our department Credit Limit Solutions (CLS) is responsible for the Group Solution RICOS. We integrate the Limit Calculation Software of an external vendor and collect all necessary Data from all Erste Group subsidiaries and from various source systems. Our system is running in online and batch and is a business-critical solution.

CLS handles the operational tasks and the ongoing further development of the Solution as well. It covers all roles and responsibilities over the whole software development chain (business analysis, technical analysis, development, test- and release management).
The team is in the transition phase towards an agile product team setup together with business.
To follow the interdisciplinary agile idea, we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer with interest to take over technical and business analyses tasks as well.


Your tasks and responsibilities will be:

to develop and document new /improve existing/ components for the credit limit system of Erste Group
to take care of the quality of developed solutions and components via proper testing (developer tests, factory acceptance tests,...).
to take part in technical analysis phase and contribute to Software Architecture tasks
to take over business and technical analysis for selected requirements
to support the Solution Management in taking care for technical production issues (3rd level support)


What should you bring with you:

wide working experience (preferably at least 10 years) in Java and Oracle / SQL development and familiarity with Unix environments in large companies
experience and interest in business analysis and requirement engineering
ability to work in complex, multicultural environment
good organizational skills, analytical skills, process and solution orientation
well developed integration and communication skills
being a team-player is a must :)
English skills - spoken and written - needed on daily basis
basic banking knowledge (beneficial)


What can we offer:

Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste
Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom
Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health center that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours.
New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time.
Employee benefits – Benefit from special conditions for financial services and insurances, supermarkets, clothing stores and many more.
Employee Referral Program – Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital
Language courses for German & English – Learning a new language unites. We support you with appropriate language courses where you participate together with your colleagues.
Visa Sponsoring – We support our employees with all the formalities associated with a relocation
Work-Life-Balance – Home office, paternity leave, sabbatical, sports courses -– we support you in balancing work, family and leisure time
The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 56.448,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!

job_title: EMBARK Program: Test Automation Engineer (part-time possible)
job_description:
Du bist eine Frau mit mehreren Jahren Berufserfahrung, die nach einer beruflichen Pause wie z.B. Mutterschutz oder einer persönlichen Auszeit wieder in das Berufsleben einsteigen möchte?

Willkommen zurück - und willkommen bei Accenture, wo eine wirklich einzigartige Gelegenheit auf Dich wartet: EMBARK, unser einzigartiges Programm, welches speziell für motivierte Frauen entwickelt wurde, die nach einer Auszeit vom Berufsleben - aus welchen Gründen auch immer - wieder einsteigen möchten.

Und so funktioniert es: Du beginnst mit einer dreimonatigen Vorbereitungs- und Entwicklungsphase, die aus hochspezialisierten Trainings und Coaching unter der persönlichen Anleitung von engagierten Accenture-Führungskräften, deinem vertrauten Mentoren besteht. Danach arbeitest Du dich in Deinen Traumjob ein, genießt glänzende berufliche Perspektiven und entfaltest dich in unserem unterstützenden, inspirierenden Umfeld, das Dir die Freiheit lässt, die Rahmenbedingungen deines Jobs nach deinen Vorstellungen zu gestalten: Wie lange und wo du arbeitest, in Teilzeit oder Vollzeit, bleibt ganz Dir überlassen.

Wenn Du außerdem von einem sicheren Job mit tollen Konditionen, netten Kolleg:innen und spannenden Digitalisierungsprojekten bei Top-Kunden träumst, findest Du dein Glück bei Accenture Technology. Unsere Kunden wollen wachsen und sich besser auf dem Markt positionieren. Dafür brauchen wir Menschen wie Dich.

Das erwartet dich


Du unterstützt unsere Softwareentwicklungsteams mit einem Fokus auf Qualitätssicherung, Testautomatisierung sowie entwicklungsnahen Tests.

Zu einer effizienten Testautomatisierung gehört für dich die Erstellung, Umsetzung sowie Optimierung von passenden bzw. bestehenden Strategien.

Die systematische und strukturierte Ermittlung, Erstellung, Automatisierung, Durchführung und Verwaltung von funktionalen und nicht-funktionalen Tests inkl. Testdatenbereitstellung ist von deinem Job nicht wegzudenken.

Die Analyse von fehlgeschlagenen Tests und Defect-Management von gefundenen Defects ist Teil deines Alltags.

Die Unterstützung durch eine enge Zusammenarbeit sowie Kommunikation mit weiteren Projektmitgliedern (Entwickler, Product Owner, Analysten etc.) bringt dich zum Erfolg

Darauf freuen wir uns


Du hast eine technische Ausbildung im IT-Bereich und/oder mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Qualitätssicherung.

Außerdem hast du praktische Erfahrung mit der Arbeit in agilen Softwareentwicklungsteams inkl. JIRA, Confluence und aktuellen Build-, Test- und Continuous Integration-Prozessen.

Du kennst dich mit der Anwendung von gängigen Testautomatisierungstools (bspw. Tricentis Tosca, Worksoft Certify, Microfocus UFT, Open-Source-Frameworks) aus.

Idealerweise bringst du Erfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung (Java, .NET) oder in Scriptsprachen (JavaScript, SQL, Python) mit.

Du hast bereits Kenntnisse von der Funktionsweise von Webservices (SOAP, REST) und Datenbanksystemen (SQL).

Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Deine Vorteile bei Accenture

Du als Mensch bist uns wichtig. Das wirst du täglich spüren und erleben, denn unsere Arbeitswelt ist auf dich ausgerichtet.

Freu dich auf:


Attraktiven Benefits eines großen, verantwortungsvollen Arbeitgebers

Viel Spaß an der Arbeit durch Aufgaben von Bedeutung für die größten Unternehmen weltweit, Verantwortung für internationale Teams und Projekten, die mit den leading-edge Technologien agieren

Wertschätzung und Anerkennung, auch finanzieller Art

Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Möglichkeit auf Arbeit im Homeoffice

Begleitung durch erfahrene Mentor:innen und Austausch innerhalb unserer EMBARK Netzwerks

Eine steile Lernkurve durch die Zusammenarbeit mit den jeweils besten Fachexpert:innen und Technologiepartnern weltweilt

Umfassende Trainingsangebote

Als Teil von Accenture, dem weltweit agieren Management- und Technologieberatungsunternehmen, haben wir Zugriff auf das Know-how und die Erfahrungswerte von über 700.000 Mitarbeitenden in mehr als 120 Ländern. Vielfältige Persönlichkeiten, die täglich Technologie mit menschlicher Kreativität verbinden und so den digitalen Wandel gestalten. Gerne mit dir!

Dein Kontakt

Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich gerne per E-Mail an magali.schalck@accenture.com.

Neben spannenden Projekten bieten wir dir ein sehr attraktives Vergütungspaket, flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein modernes Umfeld und viele weitere zusätzliche Benefits.

Das Jahresbruttogehalt für diese Position liegt, je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung, zwischen € 60.760,-- und € 77.740,--. Du hast bei uns zusätzlich die Möglichkeit, basierend auf deiner individuellen Leistung aktiv dein Jahreseinkommen positiv zu beeinflussen.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Wir sind die twinformatics. Wir machen Software und Systembetrieb für über 25.000 AnwenderInnen der Vienna Insurance Group, Wiener Städtische Versicherung AG und Donau Versicherung AG.

Millionen KundInnen können sich auf ihre Versicherung verlassen, weil wir mit state of the art Technologien und agilem Mindset dafür sorgen, dass alles läuft, wie es soll. Überzeugt? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams!

Welche Herausforderungen auf dich warten

In unserem Data Development Team haben wir als Ziel, eine einheitliche Datenbasis als Data Analytics-Plattform für interne Dashboards, Data Driven Analytics / Self-Service Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics Szenarios und als Datenfeed für Apps und Web Applikationen zu schaffen.
Unsere Time to Market Data driven Architecture Technologie ermöglicht den Fachbereichen der Versicherungsunternehmen selbstständig Zusammenhänge und Antworten über Kunden- bzw. Vertriebspartner-Verhalten zu finden und daraus Maßnahmen abzuleiten.
Wir legen den Fokus auf „Single Point of Truth“ bzw. qualitativ hochwertige Daten, saubere und transparente Anreicherung der Daten und eine performante Abfragemöglichkeit.

Welche Skills wir uns wünschen

Praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit relationalen DWH Datenbanken basierend auf Microsoft SQL Server.
Erfahrung in der ETL Programmierung, vor allem hands-on Erfahrung mit SSIS.
Erfahrung mit C#/.NET ist von Vorteil
Du hast Datenmodelierungs-Know-How
Data Vault, Stars und Snowflakes siehst du nicht nur am Himmel, SQL Performance Optimierung ist mitunter dein Hobby.
Du bist es gewohnt, deinen Quellcode in GIT oder anderen Versionierungstools für deine TeamkollegInnen nachvollziehbar abzulegen.
Deine Freunde würden dich als genau beschreiben und dir eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise zuschreiben.
Als Teamplayer freust du dich über gemeinsamen Erfolg.
Du hast sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Gestütztes Mittagessen
Gleitzeit & mobiles Arbeiten
Gesundheitsbenefits
Weiterbildung
Mitarbeitervergünstigungen
Verkehrsanbindung

You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

About Us In Austria

With about 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation. We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we want to keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values: thriving an autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for

supporting our local and international project teams with great IT solutions
supporting our existing team as a Developer to implement technical solutions suiting for our customers' needs
challenging and future oriented projects which range from basic conceptions to realizations at the clients' site globally and locally

We expect you to have

good technical skills and a consulting attitude
3+ years of Java development experience
knowledge of the common technologies like Spring
a good IT background – gathered by graduation from a technical college/university or resulting out of broad project experience
a passion for future developments in this area and the desire to learn more about great and innovative IT solutions
ability to handle discussions in German and English

As a person you are

proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change
taking ownership of your results and delivered quality and passionately drive execution to add customer value
having fun at work, love to learn new things and work within a dynamic team

We offer

an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities
active participation in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment
excellent teamwork which is part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues
benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, excellent public transport connection, food vouchers, fresh fruits, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.
a salary above the defined IT collective agreement of minimum EUR 3.455,00 per month. The amount of overpayment depends on your skills as well as your experience

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

Catharina Christian, Recruitment Specialist, Tietoevry Austria

requirements and iterating on solutions

Beschreibung des BRZ

Wir sind das Kompetenzzentrum für Digitalisierung des Public Sectors in Österreich und damit Teil der kritischen Infrastruktur. Ob Digitales Amt, FinanzOnline, Unternehmensserviceportal oder digitaler Führerschein am Smartphone: Im BRZ entwickelte Anwendungen und Services vereinfachen Millionen Menschen den Alltag, indem sie Behördenwege mit wenigen Klicks ermöglichen. Im BRZ zu arbeiten heißt, mit seinem Job Österreichs Public Sector vorwärts zu bringen, modernste Technologien und Arbeitsweisen zu nutzen, Freiraum für Innovationen zu erhalten, Teil eines diversen und kraftvollen Teams zu sein und einen verantwortungsbewussten Arbeitgeber zu haben.

Wir vergeben Topjobs mit Sinn!

Sie suchen einen spannenden Job, in dem Sie auch wirklich etwas bewirken können?

Dann bewerben Sie sich!

In der Abteilung Development werden Sie Teil eines qualifizierten Entwickler:innen-Teams, welches die österreichische Verwaltung nachhaltig verbessert und digitalisiert. Sie entwickeln Applikationen im Umfeld des Bundes aktiv weiter, um damit das Leben von Millionen Menschen positiv zu beeinflussen und zu erleichtern.

Ihre Aufgaben

Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von Java-Webanwendungen und -services
Ansprechpartner:in für interne und externe Kollegen
Wartung und Refactoring von bestehenden Applikationen
Durchführung der entwicklungsseitigen Qualitätssicherung, Testen und Dokumentation
Mitarbeit und Gestaltung innerhalb des gesamten Software-Entwicklungsprozess

Sie bringen mit

Erste einschlägige Berufserfahrung (zumindest 2 Jahre) in agiler Softwareentwicklung
Selbstständige und analytische Arbeitsweise sowie Lernbereitschaft und Engagement

erste Erfahrung mit den im Einsatz beﬁndlichen Frameworks und Tools:
Java Frameworks (Spring und idealerweise Spring Boot, Hibernate) und Frontend Technologien (JSF, HTML, CSS)
Entwicklungsumgebungen und -werkzeuge: Eclipse oder IntelliJ
Webservices: z.B. SOAP, Postman
Java Schnittstellen Technologien für XML-Webservices: JAX-WS, JAXB
Knowhow mit folgenden Tools ist von Vorteil (kein Must-have):
Java bean mapping: Mapstruct
Frameworks für Unit Tests: z.B. Mockito oder PowerMock
