Sandra Triantafillidis
Human Resources Manager @hello again - we are hiring! apply now! 🥳🚀
Wir bei hello again haben uns zur Mission gesetzt, Unternehmen dabei zu unterstützen, ihre Kund:innen langfristig durch eine einfache digitale Lösung (Loyalty-App) an sie zu binden. Unser Ziel ist es dabei, führender digitaler Loyalty-Lösungsanbieter in Europa zu werden.

Willst du uns bei diesem Ziel unterstützen?

Wir sind ein dynamisches Scale-Up im SaaS-Umfeld und auf der Suche nach einem Data Engineer / Data Analyst, der/die uns dabei unterstützt, datengesteuerte Analysen und Entscheidungen in unserem schnell wachsenden Unternehmen zu ermöglichen. In dieser Rolle bist du verantwortlich für die Entwicklung, Wartung und Optimierung unserer Dateninfrastruktur und Data Pipelines. Du trägst damit maßgeblich zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Data-Analytics-Strategie bei.

DAS WARTET AUF DICH:
gestalte ein abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet aktiv mit, bringe deine Expertise und Ideen ein und wirke bei der Entwicklung von Projekten mit.
meistere Herausforderungen und wachse in einem Umfeld, das stetigen Wandel erlebt.
arbeite in einem kreativen, dynamischen Team, welches deine Beiträge schätzt und dich unterstützt.
flexible Arbeitszeiten, die Möglichkeit, im Home Office zu arbeiten und ein modernes Büro, in dem man sich wohl fühlt.
zahlreiche Benefits wie die Mitgliedschaft in einem Fitnessstudio, die Möglichkeit zu Remote Arbeit, Balancing Days, Kaffee & Tee sowie frisches saisonales Obst, etc.

DEINE AUFGABEN:
Du hilfst beim Aufbau einer einheitlichen und skalierbaren Datenarchitektur
und betreust unseren Data Lake und das Cloud Data Warehouse.
Mit Low-Code/No-Code oder Source Code bindest du unterschiedliche Datenquellen an, bist verantwortlich für ETL-Prozesse und baust daraus stabile Data-Pipelines.
Um unsere Teams mit qualitativ hochwertigen Daten zu versorgen,
setzt du interne und externe Datamining-Techniken ein (Crawling, Scraping).
Du nutzt Tools und etablierst Prozesse, um die Qualität unserer Daten ständig zu messen und zu verbessern.
Du arbeitest mit Stakeholdern aus unterschiedlichen Teams zusammen und gestaltest die Datengrundlage zur Erreichung unserer Unternehmensziele.
Um den Erfolg unseres Unternehmens voranzutreiben, leitest du durch deine Expertise notwendige Daten und Metriken ab.

DAS BRINGST DU MIT:
Du hast ein gutes Verständnis für diesen Bereich und bringst erste Erfahrungen mit.
Du bringst Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken mit, beherrscht SQL und hast Grundkenntnisse in typischen Data Engineering Technologien (Python, R, JavaScript, REST-APIs, ...).
Idealerweise hast du Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien im Data-Bereich (z.B. Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, Snowflake, …) und kannst solche Systeme aufsetzen und betreuen.
Kenntnisse von BI-Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI sowie typischen Quell-/Ziel-Systemen im SaaS-Umfeld (z.B. Hubspot) sind von Vorteil.

Für diese Position bieten wir ein Bruttojahresgehalt von mindestens € 50.000,--. Das tatsächliche Gehalt hängt von deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung ab.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!
#dataengineering #data #python #dataanalyst

job_title: Capgemini Invent: Data Analyst Consultant (m/w/d) – Dein Einstieg in die Strategie- und Managementberatung
job_description:
Be part of our journey

Du bist auf der Suche nach spannenden Innovations-, Design- und Transformationsprojekten? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Capgemini Invent ist eine international tätige Strategieberatung der Capgemini Gruppe mit über 13.000 Mitarbeiter:innen an mehr als 36 Standorten weltweit. Gemeinsam mit dir unterstützen wir unsere Kund:innen dabei, ihre unternehmerische Zukunft zu gestalten und nachhaltige Geschäftsmodelle zu entwickeln. Du willst auch deine eigene Zukunft gestalten und dich persönlich weiterentwickeln? Dann nutze jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unserer gemeinsamen Reise!

Get the future you want

Erfolgreiche Transformationen basieren auf Daten. Wir sorgen für eine datengesteuerte Entscheidungsfindung im gesamten Unternehmen. Mit einer soliden Datenstrategie, moderner Analytik und KI sowie Einblicken in Echtzeit können unsere Kund:innen präzise planen, messen, verbessern und transformieren.

Klingt das interessant? Dann ist das Team Enterprise Data & Analytics das Richtige für dich!

What You Should Bring To Our Journey

Einen herausragenden Studienabschluss (Bachelor/ Master) aller Fachrichtungen
Erste Erfahrungen in der Datenaufbereitung und Datenmodellierung
Spaß an der Kombination von Innovation, strategischer Analyse und Umsetzungsarbeit, sowie das Talent, konzeptionell und analytisch zu denken
Hohe Zuverlässigkeit, Teamgeist und Fit für eine weltweit führende Managementberatung
Interesse und ggf. erste Erfahrungen im Präsentieren oder Moderieren von Workshops
Exzellente Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse

Your Experience At Capgemini Invent

Du arbeitest an innovativen Strategieprojekten mit digitalen Zukunftsthemen und das in internationalen Teams.

Du erfährst Zusammenarbeit mit dem Top-Management mittelständischer Unternehmen, sowie börsennotierter Konzerne jeder Industrie.

Du hast transparente Karriereperspektiven, sowie viel Raum für Eigeninitiative.

Du bekommst dein individuelles Trainingsportfolio, sowie herausragende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb eines weltweiten Expertennetzwerks.

Du genießt flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home Office Möglichkeiten.

Du profitierst von langjährig gelebter und auf Werte ausgerichteter Unternehmenskultur.

Wir freuen uns über deine vollständige Bewerbung (Motivationsschreiben, aussagekräftiger Lebenslauf, relevante Zeugnisse) ausschließlich über unser Bewerbungsportal.

Es gilt der Kollektivvertrag für Angestellte (m/w/d) in Information und Consulting. Je nach Studienabschluss bieten wir ein Mindestgehalt von 55.000 EUR brutto im Jahr. Das erscheint dir wenig? Wir legen großen Wert darauf, dass dein Gehalt in einem angemessenen Verhältnis zu deinen Fähigkeiten und deinem Wert für unser Unternehmen steht. Daher berücksichtigen wir bei der Festlegung deines Gehalts sorgfältig deine Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen, um eine marktgerechte Überzahlung zu ermöglichen.

Bei Fragen wende dich bitte an unsere Spezialistin Anna Barcichowska vom Talent Recruiting (anna.barcichowska@capgemini.com).

Der Job für Dich beim Tourismusverband Wilder Kaiser
Werde „technisches MasterMind“ als Projektmanager*in Digital (40h/Woche) im Marketingteam des Tourismusverbandes Wilder Kaiser (Dienstort Ellmau).

Willst Du mit uns die Lebens- und Erlebnisqualität am Wilden Kaiser weiterentwickeln und mit den Möglichkeiten der Digitalisierung die touristischen Prozesse Schritt für Schritt verbessern? Dann komm zu uns ins Team!

Als Projektmanager *in Digital des Tourismusverbandes Wilder Kaiser bist du verantwortlich für die weitere Digitalisierung eines der erfolgreichsten Tourismusverbände Tirols. Dabei kannst und sollst Du Deine Ideen einbringen und verwirklichen.

Dafür übernimmst Du Verantwortung
Projektmanagement für digitale Weiterentwicklungen der Region Wilder Kaiser
Umsetzung der Digitalisierungsprojekte bis Übergabe an die redaktionellen Verantwortlichen
Steuerung der externen Agenturen für unsere Websites sowie unseren eigenen TV Sender
Optimierung aller Web- und Digital Signage Auftritte der Region in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Redaktionsteam
Chance: Projektlead im Aufbau / Entwicklung einer (Web)App
Google Analytics, technisches SEO, Tracking über Google Tag Manager
Budgetverantwortung

Du bringst dafür idealerweise mit
Eine Ausbildung und Berufserfahrungen im digitalen Projektmanagement
Erfahrungen mit Web-CMS Systemen (MicadoWeb, Wordpress, etc.) sowie Google Analytics 4 und Google Tag Manager
Programmier-Grundkenntnisse von Vorteil
Eigenverantwortliche und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit einem hohen Maß an Zuverlässigkeit, Flexibilität und Verständnis für Technik
Belastbarkeit, eine gute Selbstorganisation, den Willen Verantwortung zu übernehmen und Dich weiterzuentwickeln

Das macht Deinen Arbeitstag besonders
Interessante und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben: Vielfältigste Projekte warten auf Dein Engagement!
Kreative Ideen willkommen: wir garantieren Dir, dass Deine Ideen nicht auf taube Ohren stoßen! Einbringen und verwirklichen!
Entwickle Dich weiter: Unsere Mitarbeiter*innen machen den Unterschied aus. Deshalb bieten wir stets die passenden Trainings und Workshops sowie Zeit für Weiterbildung
Sehr gutes Betriebsklima und extrem kollegiales Miteinander
Frischer Kaffee, Obst und Humor bei der Arbeit

Work Life Balance
Verlässliche Arbeitszeiten für optimale Urlaubs- und Freizeitplanung
Gleitzeit = Freizeit dann, wenn sie Dir wichtig ist
Voller Zeitausgleich für alle Überstunden
Loyaler und krisensicherer Arbeitgeber

Freizeit Goodies
SkiWelt-Skisaisonkarte zum halben Preis
Kostenlose Teilnahme am kompletten Aktivprogramm der Region (von der Gipfeltour bis Canyoning, von Langlaufschule bis Lama Trekking)
Firmenyoga
JobBike-Leasing über den Arbeitgeber
Kostenloses VVT-Ticket für ganz Tirol zum Ausleihen
Rabatte bei Sportgeschäften und -verleihen in der Region
Diverse Aktions-Gutscheine (z.B. Bergbahnfahrten Sommer, gratis Bädereintritte, Essensbons)

Das macht uns aus
Verantwortung für unser aller Zukunft spielt eine zentrale Rolle in unserer Strategie und damit in unserem täglichen (Arbeits-)Leben. Wir wollen mit Sinn agieren, damit wir alle auch morgen noch in dieser – wie wir finden schönsten – Ecke Tirols leben und wirken dürfen. Diese strategische Ausrichtung macht den TVB Wilder Kaiser immer wieder zum Vorreiter. Das bestätigt uns und treibt uns an. Dabei werden die individuellen Stärken und Interessen aller Mitarbeiter*innen ins Zentrum der jeweiligen beruflichen Ausgestaltung gerückt. Jede Stelle beinhaltet also neben den „Must Do‘s“ auch jede Menge persönliche Gestaltungsspielräume. Durch diese Philosophie können wir gemeinsam mehr erreichen als wir uns einzeln vorstellen können - dieses Miteinander ist Teil unseres Selbstverständnisses und uns immens wichtig. Wir freuen uns, wenn Du Teil davon wirst! #wirzusammen

Der Tourismusverband Wilder Kaiser unterliegt dem Kollektivvertrag für Reisebüros. Gehalt je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung zwischen € 31.000 und € 39.000 brutto/ Jahr.

Interessiert?
Dann bewirb Dich inkl. möglichem Einstiegstermin bei Teamleiterin Katharina Muck unter bewerbung@wilderkaiser.info

Storebox is the first fully digitized self-storage solution in Europe. With over 280 locations in over 130 different cities, Storebox is one of the fastest growing tech companies. Together we solve today's urbanization problems and shape the logistics of tomorrow.

Would you like to contribute with your ideas to a rapidly growing scale-up, and be part of a working environment in which you can actively help to shape it?

Be part of our success story as a

Your tasks

Continuous development and optimization of our data warehouse by taking a hands-on role in refining its functionality, ensuring its consistent maintenance, and contributing to its design and efficient implementation of ETLs
Proficient in translating data insights into actionable answers, bridging the gap between raw data analysis and meaningful business understanding.
Exploring and analyzing large amounts of data (structured/unstructured) to identify patterns, trends and insights
Close collaboration with the Product Team, to develop and implement data-driven strategies
Acting as a bridge between technical data analysis and business objectives, engaging stakeholders to identify their needs and aspirations
Conception and realization of data reports, dashboards, and data analysis projects to communicate information effectively and support company’s and department’s decision-making
Support our Data Engineer with the day-to-day operations of our Data Warehouse and mentor in regard to Data analysis

Our expectations

Completed academical education in Computer Sciences, Business Administration, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Relevant experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer or similar
Good understanding of Data Engineering (data warehousing, ETLs, sanity checks)
High proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R and SQL
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Metabase).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to ensure that the data infrastructure meets the organization's needs
Strong analytical thinking and structured way of work with a problem-solving mindset
Very good written and spoken English communication skills (German knowledge is a plus)

What you can expect from us Interested? Great! Just click that “apply now” button and send us your CV in English or German

Flexible working hours & hybrid working model

Annual dedicated training budget to promote personal and professional development

Flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes & unique teamspirit

Discounts for lunch & snacks at our e-canteen Schrankerl - sponsored by Storebox

Daily fruits, tea & coffee at our office

Monthly team events and a yearly, multi-day company event awaits you!

Modern office in central location in the 5th district

Attractive benefits package (with a focus on mobility or health) & many other perks for employees

For this position, we offer an annual gross minimum salary of EUR 45,000. We are entirely prepared to adjust our offer to your skill set and relevant experience!

Come as you are - at Storebox we live equality and diversity and welcome people from all backgrounds!

We are looking for a Researcher (f/m/d) to join our passionate team of developers, researchers, marketers, and product managers in Vienna, Austria. At Semantic Web Company (SWC) you’ll work alongside great people with a wide variety of backgrounds and talents. 

About SWC:

SWC is a  leading  provider  of  graph-based knowledge technologies. Its flagship product, the PoolParty Semantic Suite, is the most complete semantic middleware on the market comprising taxonomy, auto classification, text mining, semantic search, recommender systems, and knowledge graph solutions. SWC supports over 180 organizations, including over 50 Forbes Global 2000 companies, and has been a pioneer in the field of Semantic AI for over 15 years. 
If you are interested in technology and working in a close-knit, dynamic environment, SWC might be the right fit for you.

About the Role:
We are looking for a researcher ready to embark in method development, prototype creation and testing of new technologies, as well as to collaborate in National and European projects. The successful researcher helps the company to
Research in funded projects and collaborate in these projects.
Develop new functionalities for the company’s software.
Establish SWC in research communities and guaranteeing soundness and relatedness of results with the help of publishing and giving talks at top conferences in the field.

Req ID: 425878

At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 74,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

Could you be the full-time Data Scientist in VIENNA we’re looking for?

Your future role

Take on a new challenge and apply your data science expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Franz Santner, Services Engineering Manager, and work alongside passionate, motivated and dedicated teammates.

Within the project engineering team, you will be responsible for setup and run the "Prognostic Tool".

You’ll specifically collate & structure remote diagnostic data, system downloads and depot reports for service failures and analyse data in order to:
identify any failure trends/anomalies and inform Engineering/Reliability Teams of possible improvements
identify any minor failures that may require preventative maintenance
provide detailed reports of system performance

Day-to-day, you’ll explore data, find new relationships and patterns, create and implement new data algorithms in order to create predictive maintenance models, to improve asset life-cycle, increase vehicle availability and automate processes.

We’ll look to you for:
Building learning models (including unsupervised predictive models and simulation tools)
Assessing and enhancing data and model responses
Boosting performance and enhancing customer experience
Define standard rules to analyse vehicle diagnostic data
Support Fleet Support Center System Engineer
Raise change request to improve diagnostic information collected by the vehicles
Participate to critical taskforce dedicated to troubleshooting if necessary
To report regularly and accurately on the performance of the fleet, for internal use, and to report to the customer.
To highlight any anomalies in system performance or component failures as present in the data
To provide the System, Maintenance development and Reliability engineers with specific analyses.
To assist in providing training on the company’s data reporting tools. To look after the quality of the raw data and report on any inaccuracies or concerns and provide instructions/training on how data is to be recorded and kept
Assist the data warehouse activities related to the Fleet Support Center
Through his activities, contributes to standardization by reusing existing solutions or by implementing reusable solutions
Contribute to continuous improvement (Return of Experience, processes)

All About You

We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:
Degree or Master’s in electronics, Mechatronics or Engineering
Training in data mining/machine learning/computer science/operational research or applied mathematics
Passion for developing efficient, testable, scalable, and well-documented rules
Experience and understanding of two areas: software development/data analytics/machine learning/AI
Being detail-oriented
An analytical, solution-focused approach
Experience in Maintenance & Warranty Support
Keen interest on electronics
Good understanding of train function
Experience in data retrieval, elaboration and analysis
German and English language mandatory

Things you’ll enjoy

Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
Contribute to innovative projects
Utilise our agile environment
Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension).

Benefits:
Public transport ticket allowance
Parking spaces nearby
Company canteen with meal allowance
Employee accident insurance
Company bicycle leasing
Flexible working hours, home office and bridge day regulation
Local and international career opportunities, training & development
Corporate events, employee discounts & share purchase program
Occupational medicine and psychology
Employee Referral Scheme – bonus or donation
Company pension plan, Parental part-time, 1-month paternal leave

The minimum salary for this position is € 42.250 € gross annually for full-time employment according to the collective bargaining agreement. Overpayment depends on relevant work experience and qualifications.

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

Important to note

As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

job_title: Junior Data Scientists (m/w/d) – User Experience (UX) & Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
job_description:
Als Österreichs größte Forschungs- und Technologieorganisation für angewandte Forschung haben wir uns zum Ziel gesetzt, substanzielle Beiträge zur Lösung der großen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit, Klimawandel und Digitalisierung, zu leisten. Dabei setzen wir auf unsere spezifischen Forschungs-, Entwicklungs- und Technologiekompetenzen, die die Grundlage für unser Bekenntnis zu Exzellenz in allen Bereichen sind. Mit unserer offenen Innovationskultur und unseren motivierten, internationalen Teams arbeiten wir daran, das AIT als Österreichs führende Forschungseinrichtung auf höchstem internationalem Niveau zu positionieren und einen positiven Beitrag für Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft zu leisten.

Unser Center for Technology Experience sucht weitere Ingenious Partner für den Standort Wien. Im Center for Technology Experience untersuchen wir neueste Ansätze von User Experience für verschiedene Anwendungskontexte und zukunftsweisende Methoden und Experience Werkzeuge. Kontext von Industrie 4.0 bis hin zu Projekten im Bereich Zivilcourage und Game Development für unterschiedliche Zielgruppen.

Als Teil unseres Teams der Competence Unit "Experience Contexts and Tools", arbeiten Sie gemeinsam mit uns an dem Ziel die Erfahrung – „Experience“ – von Nutzer:innen in der Verwendung von neuen Technologien und Anwendungen zu verbessern (z.B. Extended Reality, KI-basierte Assistenzsysteme). Wir fokussieren uns darauf, moderne Data-Science Methoden mit Methoden aus Psychologie und Sozialwissenschaften so zu verbinden, dass Nutzer:inneninteraktionen optimiert werden können. Unsere Projekte sind Kooperationen mit Kund:innen aus unterschiedlichen Branchen (Industrie 5.0, Digitales Training und Kompetenzen, Active & Assisted Living).

Center For Technology Experience

Sie werden in einem interdisziplinären Team in Forschungsprojekten mitarbeiten.
Gemeinsam mit Ihren Kolleg:innen aus unterschiedlichsten Disziplinen werden Sie neue Ansätze und Lösungen in der Synergie aus Data Science und Experience Research entwickeln.
Dabei sind Sie verantwortlich für die Sammlung, Analyse und Aufbereitung der Daten.
Sie entwickeln dafür Datenerfassungsstrategien, um ein tiefes Verständnis für das Nutzer:innenverhalten und deren Präferenzen zu gewinnen.
Durch Anwendung Ihrer Fachkenntnisse in Datenanalyse, maschinellem Lernen (ML) und HCI tragen Sie zur Entwicklung intuitiver und nutzer:innenfreundlicher Schnittstellen und Systeme bei, die eine optimal User Experience ermöglichen.
Sie wenden statistische Methoden an, um Trends und potenzielle Verbesserungsbereiche zu identifizieren, etwa für die Validierung von psychometrischen Verfahren, die als sozialwissenschaftliche Messinstrumente eingesetzt werden.
Durch Ihre Begeisterung wirken Sie beim Transfer von Forschung zur Anwendung in der Industrie und ermöglichen so eine Verbesserung der „Kooperation“ von Mensch und Maschine bzw. Systemen.
Mit Ihrer Neugier und Ihrem Einsatz verschieben Sie täglich die Innovationsgrenzen und setzen neue Standards im Data Engineering im HCI-Kontext.
Sie geben Ihr Wissen aktiv an Kolleg:innen weiter und leiten auch unsere Praktikant:innen und Studierenden an.

Als Ingenious Partner Zeichnet Sie Aus

Studienabschluss in (Medien-)Informatik, Data-Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Angewandter Psychologie oder Ähnliches
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in aktuellen Technologien (Extended Reality, KI, Machine Learning, etc.) und Datenanalyseumgebungen (R, Python)
Gute Kenntnisse in der quantitativen Analyse und Modellierung empirischer Daten (Statistische Modellierung, Signifikanz- und Hypothesentests, etc.)
Gute Programmierkenntnisse (Python, R, HTML/JavaScript)
Interesse an der Verknüpfung von nutzerpsychologischen, datenwissenschaftlichen und technischen Fragestellungen
Hands-on Mentalität, Affinität zur Schaffung von nachhaltigen Lösungen und Erfahrung im wissenschaftlichen Arbeiten
Hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamfähigkeit
Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse Englisch und Deutsch in Wort & Schrift

Was Sie Erwarten Können

Das Bruttojahresgehalt gemäß Kollektivvertrag beträgt EUR 49.280,--. Das aktuelle Gehalt wird entsprechend Ihren Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen individuell festgelegt. Darüber hinaus bieten wir neben zahlreichen Benefits flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Karrieremöglichkeiten in einem hochinnovativen Umfeld.

Am AIT sind uns Diversität und Inklusion wichtig. So wollen wir auch Frauen für unser technisches Umfeld begeistern. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von Frauen, die bei gleicher Qualifikation – unter Berücksichtigung aller relevanten Fakten und Umstände aller Bewerbungen – bevorzugt aufgenommen werden.

Bitte übermitteln Sie uns Ihre ausführlichen Bewerbungsunterlagen bestehend aus Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und Zeugnissen online.

Für Nähere Informationen Kontaktieren Sie Bitte

Dr. Raimund Schatz, raimund.schatz(at)ait.ac.at

Join Smart Energy Software Company as a Senior Full Stack Engineer (Python/TypeScript)!

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey in the world of software engineering? Do you have a passion for creating innovative solutions that can make a real impact in the world? If you're someone who thrives on tackling challenging problems and is eager to learn, we have an exceptional opportunity for you!

On behalf of our client, a Vienna-based software company that is poised to revolutionize the energy landscape, we’re hiring a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join their team. Their software is set to transform the way electrical devices respond to electricity markets, reducing consumer energy costs, and ultimately contributing to the fight against climate change. Their platform controls a fleet of heat pumps, electric vehicles (EVs), batteries, and inverters, making a tangible difference.


What they value

Measurable Climate Impact: They're building the last missing software piece needed to fully decarbonize the grid.
World Class Sports Team: They're like a world-class sports team, celebrating wins and supporting each other.
Customer First: They build what their customers need to lead tomorrow's electricity markets.
Relentlessly Resourceful: Navigating complex markets, they use collective creativity to solve climate change.
Pursuit of Fulfillment: They're in constant pursuit of long-term happiness through their work.


About the Role

They search for a mission-driven, ambitious, and high-performing individual to join them on this exciting journey. Your ability to deliver exceptional work and excel in your specialized area is the main focus. They don't expect instant expertise in every task, given the intersection of multiple disciplines they work in. However, they do expect a strong desire to learn and an unwavering determination to find innovative solutions to complex problems. Startup experience will be highly valued!

What you'll be working on

Take the device for monitoring and steering services from an alpha version to a fully fledged software
Design, implement, and support an API framework for your partners to efficiently interact with the software, consumer, and device data
Build beautiful user interfaces for an easy-to-use, self-explanatory user experience
Create tooling to quickly and easily integrate new device brands into the software stack
Ensure the robustness of core services through improved error handling, logging, monitoring
Assist in the creation process of the designs, brand and online presence
Work on security protocols against cyber attacks and innocent but costly mistakes
Create CI/CD pipelines to test your software, check for vulnerabilities, and improve their developers’ experience
Set up infrastructure (with the help of their DevOps team and Head of Engineering)

Tech Stack: Python, React, TypeScript, Figma, Terraform, GitLab, GCP, C/C++/Go


Conditions & Benefits

Chance to work on cutting-edge technology
Opportunity to make a real impact on the environment and consumers' lives
Supportive and collaborative team environment
Continuous learning and growth opportunities
Employee stock options
25 days of annual leave
Hybrid work setting (4 days in the office, 1 remote day)
Snacks & coffee at the office

They’re happy to sponsor your working visa for Austria if it’s needed, together with the relocation support!

They accept applications from people with any background as they are striving to create a diverse and inclusive work environment.

Competitive salary: annual gross income of up to 80.000 EUR + company shares
Location: Vienna, Austria

Data are everywhere at ZEISS. But finding it, accessing it, making it usable and deducting value from it requires an extremely diverse skillset. Our ZEISS Data & Analytics Team transforms data into a strategic asset from which economic benefits and competitive advantages can be generated for our success. We are looking for a new colleague for our Data & Analytics Team in Vienna.

As Data Analyst (m/f/x) you …

maintain and develop our regional PowerBI Platform and optimize internal business processes.
identify and realize data-driven business potential together with the business stakeholders including requirement engineering.
provide internal and external data for the identification of new market segments and estimation of the business potential.
document and promote data-driven projects across departments and cultivate partnerships to build and expand data-related capabilities and accelerate the realization of data-driven projects.
support the establishment of a data governance structure, roles and responsibilities and the business in solving data quality issues.
evangelize the usage of the data architecture with the goal to harmonize and standardize data-driven processes and workflows.
support the development of data-related skills (“data literacy”) within the Sales & Service Company and distribute local activities in the global ZEISS environment.

You´ve come to the right place in our data team if you have …

an academic degree (or about to be accomplished) in Business and/ or IT with focus on Data Science/ Business Intelligence/ Data Management/ Finance
3 years professional experience in Consulting, Project Management or BI and working with data and getting insights from data
good understanding of data management principles and tasks (data quality, data governance, data architecture, data lineage, data modelling, metadata, …)
experience in data engineering and analyzing data (preferably in SQL, MDX, SAP BW/ERP/CRM)
experience with BI tools (preferably PowerBI, M and DAX)
programming know-how (Python)
know-how with MS Azure and MIS advantageous
action- and solution orientation
team player characteristics
good command of English
German skills or willingness to learn German

Our Offer to you

participation in a young and committed team
diversified and exciting tasks as well as cooperation with a wide variety of people and functions within ZEISS
flexible hours and homeoffice package to arrange your weekly working hours to suit your schedule
a spacious modern setting close to Vienna Hauptbahnhof
all of this supported by a special ownership structure and the long-term goal of the Carl Zeiss Foundation: to take science and society into the future

We offer you cooperation in an international and growing organization with lots of potential for data & analytics, most trainings and certifications are free of charge (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, SEO, etc.) and a gross annual salary from € 50.000, (Fulltime). However, your remuneration is based on your individual qualifications and position-relevant professional experience. Your remuneration package will include a bonus model and attractive Fringe Benefits.

Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

Group Financial Sanctions is a unit within Group Compliance Division, responsible for ensuring compliance with European and international financial sanctions regimes & embargoes, relevant legislation and best practice standards in Erste Group and its subsidiaries. Already today, group wide common IT system, data analytics and reporting for group governance and common model development are an important part of our sanctions compliance program. In order to become even more effective and efficient, the financial sanctions investigations must be supported by ongoing data driven system parameter evaluation and data analytics. In order to strengthen our team, we are searching for a Data Scientist who is highly analytical with a passion for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data and having a passion for data and algorithms.

Your Tasks
You collaborate with compliance and business units to identify and address financial sanctions patterns on the basis of data analytics you performed
You are responsible for transforming these patterns into data insights as well as AI/machine learning based detection models in the area of financial sanctions aiming at improving risk detection and efficiency
You are responsible for deploying, monitoring and recalibrating of detection models as well as driving the periodical system parameter evaluation and tuning of the financial sanction tools in production to assure a constantly high service quality
You are supporting in daily business related tasks with regard to Sanctions & Embargoes (making a decision to release or reject stopped transactions based on sanctions related indicators, handling “requests for information (RFI)" to/from correspondent banks & advising business departments on the execution of deals in case there is a sanction related tangent)
You are contributing to the further development of the sanctions & embargoes related IT systems/filters

Your Background
Educational background in quantitative disciplines and first working experience (up to 3 years) within quantitative analytics, preferentially in Big Data environments
Fluent knowledge of Python and/or SQL; other tools like R, SPARK, KNIME as well as major AI/Machine Learning languages are of advantage
Experience in data visualization using tools such as Tableau, QLIK, R Shiny and (data) story telling capabilities are of advantage
A good understanding of the banking business, ideally with concrete financial sanctions know-how are of advantage
Assertiveness, problem solving skills, negotiation skills, presentation skills, analytical and structured thinking, lateral thinking, cultural diversity
Language skills: Fluent in English, German and/or any CEE language are of advantage

Our Offer
In this role, you will be in the driving seat for building up the data analytics capability for fighting financial sanctions in Erste Group
We offer you the opportunity to work with high amounts of Erste Group wide data on a continuous basis
The opportunity to work and develop in a highly dynamic and international environment with growing relevance
The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 36.514,66 gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their working hours between working from home and the amazing office environment at Erste Campus with all its benefits
We are proud to live diversity as we see it as key to innovation and success. We offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

Methodical analysis, description, specification and economic evaluation of production areas which could be automated
Standardization of machine and machine specifications

Leading of automation projects together with local plants
Identifying of improvements of existing equipments and defining of improvement action

Our brand slogan is Connections That Work as we believe strong connections are central to successful business relationships - both external and internal. At ecosio, we hire individuals from all backgrounds and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. Job Description

solving problems in an organised structure, with the help of clean documentation and tickets.
working closely with your colleagues in Integration Engineering. Direct contact with customers is not required.

a strong team orientation and commitment.

basic programming skills to do troubleshooting.

employee events and trips
passionate team that will win your heart

QA Engineer is a member of the broader Development Team whose primary responsibility is to review the new code before it being released.
They conduct tests before product features are launched and ensure both software performance and functionalities meet clients’ requirements.

YOUR AREA OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Business:
Create and apply comprehensive and well-structured test strategies, plans, test cases and release processes for new and existing products.
Review user stories, epics, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
Provide the Development team with regression testing solutions to be integrated into their Continuous Integration process.
Obtain first-hand information on the actual state of the quality to close the gap between customer priorities and the actual checkpoints.
Deliver capacity plans for products, putting performance test outcomes in customer’s context, and projecting results into future requirements.
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts.
Tech:
Design, develop and maintain scalability scenarios to assure the performance of the system and identify possible bottlenecks.
Identify, document and follow up bugs within the existing bug tracking tools.
Design, develop and maintain automated scripts using test automation solutions.
People:
Cooperate and communicate closely with our internal teams (Development, Product, Tech Support).
Support DevOps on bug isolation by investigating the causes of non-conforming software.

YOUR PROFILE
Previous experience in the software quality assurance areas, ideally in the positions like Software Tester, Test (Automation) Engineer, Test Analyst, Software Engineer or similar.
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies and Testing processes, with a focus on Automation Testing.
Hands-on experience with test tools (e.g., Selenium, UFT, Jmeter, Ranorex, Locust, HP UFT, and Jenkins).
Solid knowledge of SQL, Python and scripting.
Experience working with Agile/Scrum development process.
Experience with testing both in Windows and Linux environments.
Tester Certificates (e. g., ISTQB) are a significant advantage.
Attention to detail.
Strong communication skills.

WHAT WE OFFER
Being a part of our lean, supportive, innovative and truly global Team.
Seeing the impact of your work through the new colleagues who are joining Emarsys thanks to your efforts.
A real opportunity to elevate your professional skillset to grow.
An attractive monthly-paid performance bonus and additional company benefits – like food vouchers, massage in the office and other health and social initiatives in the office.
An initial annual gross salary is starting from EUR 39,956.-- annually. We are paying the market salary depending on the quality of your experience and professional background.

At Emarsys, we are committed to building diverse teams with a rich variety of perspectives and experiences. If your job profile closely aligns with our essential requirements and business need, we encourage you to apply. We are dedicated to assessing your competencies, learning agility and passion and not your age, disability, familial status, sexual orientation, gender, race, ethnicity, religion or nationality.

Keeping an Apple Store thriving requires a diverse set of leadership skills, and as a Manager, you’re a master of them all. In the store’s fast-paced, dynamic environment, you exhibit composure as you learn from each new challenge. You build and inspire high-performing teams of unique individuals who deliver positive experiences for customers as they learn, shop, and get support. Most importantly, you share the Apple vision with employees and customers.


Key Qualifications

Proven ability to drive amazing customer experiences — and results — through team development.

Experience with diplomatically managing multiple commitments to customers, staff, and operations.

Ability to adapt to challenges while remaining calm in a constantly changing retail environment.


Description

As a Manager, you're responsible for inspiring your team to create ownership opportunities for customers on the sales floor. Elsewhere, you guide the talent that provides technical support and training, while working in partnership with the business team. And behind the scenes, you oversee operations such as inventory and visual merchandising. You actively build your teams - hiring, training, and developing team members in all these disciplines and more. Supporting Apple simplicity is a complex job, and you make it look easy.


Additional Requirements

• You have demonstrated leadership ability with at least five years of experience in a customer-facing sales setting.

• Cross-industry experience is welcome.

• You have a passion for learning about Apple technology and products.

• You read, write and speak English fluently. Multilingual ability is a plus.

• You are flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.


The minimum salary pursuant to the CBA amounts to €30,912 gross per year for full time employment. Actual salaries are oriented at current market salaries and take your qualifications and experience into account.

job_title: Logistics Business Analyst (m/f/d) 38,5h/w - IKEA Austria GmbH
job_description:
The Customer Order management Team is looking for Order Allocation specialist. You will be responsible for the execution of the order allocation strategy which maximizes customer fulfilment network utilization, by contributing to analyse order and range allocation performance in all customer touch points from end-to-end perspective. You will be involved in our ongoing transformation from a traditional cash & carry retailer to an Omni-channel retailing in home furnishing business area.

About you:
• You are inspired by finding improvements through data analysis
• You feel motivated by self-driven learning environment
• You have passion to be part of omnichannel retailing transformation
• You have excellent analytical and numeric skills and ability to perform accurate advanced data manipulation, data analysis, and information presentation
• You are proficient in statistical packages like Excel, and fluent in data visualization software like Qlik; knowledge of statistical programming software (Phytons, SQL) and will be a bonus point.
• You can provide structure and order to undefined problems, and uses systemic thinking in devising solution options
• You have ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed improvements
• You have working experience as business analyst or equivalent function within supply chain, economics (preferrable in omnichannel retailing sector).
• You are fluent in English, both written and verbal


• Responsible for creating an efficient and effective configuration of the order management system to support ideal order allocation in each fulfilment unit on the market; with strong cooperation with the key stakeholders to ensure that all business factors are considered to excellently fulfil the customer promise.
• Responsible for dynamic order management system including investigating and troubleshooting on system issue, provide business input to digital development.
• Responsible to review order orchestration parameters, according to business improvement need, in customer fulfilment backbone systems in collaboration with your stakeholders.
• Responsible for monitoring customer order flow throughout the order life cycle; gather and analyse order information, turn order data into information and insight, which can be used to recognizes customer order flow problems and opportunities, engages in continuous assessment and improvement to find better order fulfilment setup towards lower costs.
• Responsible for reviewing product allocation while keeping holistic view in balancing among capacity utilisation, stock, and service availability to provide seamless customer shopping experience.
• Contribute to developing local improvements in working methods, process, and tools; and take part in implementing global routines, systems solutions and ways of working with all partners on the market, in close cooperation and co-creation with the Group Customer Order Team to secure continuous improvement.

TOGETHER AS A TEAM
We’re the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. As a diverse mix of co-workers we use our supply process expertise to balance range and space capacity with forecasting and ordering to provide customers with high availability while minimizing costs. If you’ve wonder who’s responsible for finding effective and efficient ways of picking up the products for our customers, that’s us. We’re passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA!

Yulan and her Team, consisting of three great colleagues, are looking forward to meeting you!


We welcome all applications and especially applications from people with disabilities and people from different ethnic backgrounds. Please apply online and don't forget to include your motivation letter (we think that a good and interesting motivation letter often says much more about you than many degrees).

For this position we offer you a monthly gross salary starting from € 2.775,- (on fulltime base with an ALL IN contractual agreement). We are willing to pay more depending on experience and qualification. And we are happy to offer the option for job sharing.

You have the flexibility to work up to 2/3 of your time in home office. You can find out more about our benefits and development opportunities here:

As the QM System and Process Professional, you'll be at the heart of our organization's innovation and collaboration. Acting as a bridge between various departments, both within our headquarters and with our copackers and partners at Red Bull, your role becomes a vital interface to reduce our risk of quality issues.

In detail, you'll coordinate initiatives within the Red Bull Quality Organization and other units (e. g. Procurement, Planning, Logistics, IT, Data...). You’ll also support projects to continuously improve our Copacker’s process and system performance e.g., by integrating key performance indicators, managing a transparent documentation, and executing tool trainings.

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

PROJECT MANAGEMENT

To ensure excellent tools and systems for our quality organization, you’ll set up, document and drive department projects and act as a business representative in testing, releasing, and training of newly developed tools or systems.

COORDINATION

You’ll act as a central coordination point to identify and resolve potential constraints. You’ll communicate with all internal and external stakeholders complementing the existing peer to peer collaboration, coordinate different departments or experts and collect, rate, and challenge their inputs. By doing so, you’ll organize meetings, prepare presentations, and ensure transparency along the defined communication lines.

DOCUMENTATION & TRAINING

As part of this role, you’ll keep the copacker / partner handbooks up to date on a regular basis and share / train the updated versions with our copackers. Finally, you’ll work closely with the Red Bull departments to ensure optimum documentation of all copackers at all locations and escalate documentation issues as soon as possible.

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

University degree in food technology, chemistry, packaging/material sciences or a similar field
Experience in a function of an internationally operating company in the beverage, food, pharmaceutical or similar industry. Good understanding of a supply chain/production network in the mentioned industries.
Experience in and passion for driving projects from ideation into a run phase
Strong communication skills and the ability to establish trusted partnerships
Analytical skills with passion for dealing with processes and data
Open minded and pragmatism to assess comprehensive processes
Very good knowledge in MS-Office, experience in quality management systems (e. g. ISO 22000)
English fluent, German is a plus

Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2.181,00 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary.

We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

job_title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer (Singapore-based, relocation provided)
job_description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity

We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.

As part of the Data Science and Machine Learning (AI/ML) team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: dynamic pricing, predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, classifying and deep learning content and personalization signals from unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, innovating algorithm-supported promotions and products for supply partners, discovering insights from big data, and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world’s largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150TB of memory.

In This Role, You’ll Get to

Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer experience, supply side value, business outcomes, and infrastructure readiness
Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events, supplier and pricing data, and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation
Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality
Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference

What You’ll Need To Succeed

4+ years hands-on data science experience
Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks
Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala
Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment

It’s Great if You Have

PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields
Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems
Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop
Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

#sanfrancisco #newyork #seattle #boston #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #paris #london #tokyo #dhaka #vienna #edinburgh #manchester #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #singapore #ENG #IT #4

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About The Role

Team Leader Quality Operations (d/f/m), Kundl, Tyrol, Austria

100%! That is what everyone in the QA Operations team gives for our customers and patients. As Quality Team Leader QA Operations you will ensure that the quality and compliance requirements for our products are met. This is an effective way of ensuring that patients are supplied with high-quality medication.

2023 will see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz… are you ready to make a difference?

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Leadership of QA Operations Support group within QA operations Sterile Team
Building up and sustaining a successful, high performing team
Coaching and development of the investigators and aseptic experts group
Responsibilities of a Qualified Person (QP)
Responsibility for coordination and implementation of all processes around the product and release process (OOX, deviations and complaints investigations, escalations, change requests)
Support of coordination of Sandoz Transformation Projects according QA requirements
Engaging, interacting, and aligning with requirements from global and local Sandoz organization
Accountable for preparation of risk analysis and all relevant procedures and ensuring training of staff
Support continuous optimization of the microbiological control strategy maintaining consistency with cGMP and Sandoz requirements
Support the identification of risks and opportunities in relation to contamination control in the manufacturing environment and assist in follow-up initiatives for improvement in close collaboration with operators, QC, and operations management
Participation in audits performed by authorities or customers and in self-inspections
Ensuring good collaboration with relevant departments (QC, stability, registration, production, MS&T etc.) as contact person for work group
Organization/compilation of SOP’s relevant for department


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Role Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:

Essential:
Education: Successfully completed academic studies of natural sciences (e.g. pharmacy, chemistry, biology)
Qualification as Qualified Person according to 7 AMBO 2009
3 years of experience in the Quality Assurance area of a GMP-regulated pharmaceutical company
Recognized expert in the area of GMP and manufacturing of sterile products and deep understanding operational excellence to solve problems in a cross-functional environment
Excellent organizational and communication skills, independent working style and high decision quality
Strong leadership skills and ability to communicate internally and externally at higher levels
Structured, proactive and collaborative working attitude
Fluency in German and English


Why Sandoz?

Almost 500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2022 and while we’re proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.

We are at a pivotal moment in our history giving us the freedom to invest in our future so we can continue to help millions of people access affordable high-quality medicines. Together we will shape the future of Sandoz, building an organization from the ground up and in return, experience an ambitious environment with impactful, flexible-hybrid careers, where diversity is welcomed and where personal growth is encouraged!

The future is ours to shape!

Imagine what you could do here at Sandoz!

In addition to a market-competitive base salary, we offer an attractive incentive program, a modern company pension scheme, childcare facilities, learning and development options as well as worldwide career opportunities. In accordance with Austrian law, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary as stated in the collective bargaining agreement. For this position the minimum salary is €73,112.90/year (on a full time basis). The actual salary will be significantly higher, as we strive to maintain a competitive position in the market and consider your previous experience, qualifications and individual competencies.

We are open for part-time and job sharing models and support flexible and remote working where possible.

Join our Sandoz Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Sandoz and our career opportunities, join the Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/sandoztalentpool

Direct message the job poster from ComeOn Group
Ramya Kothapalli
Talent Acquisition Partner at ComeOn Group
ComeOn Group in short

Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.

Location: Graz, Austria (presence in office) + Hybrid

The Software
ComeOn’s Bookmaker NEXT software is a client-server application designed to offer betting companies a professional set of tools for managing the whole betting offer, its associated risks, liabilities, customers, marketing campaigns, etc. Build to be scalable horizontally and vertically, providing as much flexibility as possible to cover business requirements of different jurisdictions, the software has a service-oriented architecture. The basis of Bookmaker NEXT is the central server unit, consisting of database, application and web servers. We process millions of sports bets on a monthly basis across multiple operations and adopt a modern tech-stack where performance plays a central role. We are continuously looking for optimizations and improvements in our performance to ensure business can achieve its goals and offer an amazing and competitive gaming experience for our customers.

The Position
We are looking for a senior software developer to help us improve and enhance our proprietary software to build the best gaming platform in the market. You will work with the core team and be involved in all stages of the development process in a great team-oriented environment. This includes integrations with external systems, the development of internal components and subsystems, and interacting with other development teams. You as a developer will work closely together with the business side of the organization to develop and implement new features. You will be working with modern technologies such as: C# (.Net Framework 4.8 / .Net Core 6+), Kafka, MS SQL, Redis, Kafka, RabbitMQ and Kubernetes. Any other technology you would like to add to the list? Great! Let us know, we are always looking into new technologies and solutions, all initiatives and ideas count!


Responsibilities:
Proven experience with:
C# (.Net Framework 4.8 / .Net Core 6+)
gRPC

Healthcare ist eine der spannendsten Branchen überhaupt. Und eine der wichtigsten – denn Gesundheit geht alle an. Wir suchen Menschen, die nicht nur ihren Job machen, sondern sich täglich dieser besonderen Aufgabe stellen. Was wir brauchen sind engagierte Mitarbeiter mit Leidenschaft und Ausdauer, damit wir unsere Vision nicht aus den Augen verlieren.

Unsere Kolleg:innen im Analytics & Consulting Team brauchen Unterstützung! Wenn du dich bei markt- und vertriebsstrategischen Fragestellungen angesprochen fühlst und diese für den Bereich Healthcare in Österreich einordnen kannst, kannst du künftig eine zentrale Rolle in unserem Team in Österreich übernehmen. Du wirst Teil des IQVIA Netzwerks von Experten, die weltweit gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und Partnern Zukunftsstrategien für eine bessere Gesundheitsversorgung entwickeln. Suchst du einen Job mit mehr Sinn? Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei uns!

Deine Aufgaben:
Von Beginn an unterstützt Du im Team unsere Kunden operativ und strategisch bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Projekten
In den Projekten bist Du zunächst für einzelne Arbeitspakete verantwortlich und steigerst dann kontinuierlich Deine Verantwortung bis zur Teilprojektleitung und der selbstständigen Kundenkommunikation
Du arbeitest an quantitativen Fragestellungen, greifst dabei auf unsere umfangreichen Daten zurück, und ziehst interne IQVIA-Experten oder externe Quellen hinzu
Im Rahmen der Projektarbeit setzt Du bewährte Tools und Analysemethoden ein und entwickelst selbst innovative Analyseansätze
Du wirst in Abstimmung mit dem Team bei der Vorbereitung, Durchführung und Nachbereitung von Kundenpräsentationen und -workshops mitwirken
Du unterstützt neben Business Development Aktivitäten auch den Wissenstransfer
Dein Profil:
Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Psychologie, Sozialwissenschaften oder Naturwissenschaften
Mindestens 1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung für Analyst / 2-3 Jahre für Consultant sowie Grundverständnis und Interesse an der pharmazeutischen Industrie
Erste Erfahrung in der Erstellung und Gestaltung von Dashboards (z.B. QLIK, Power BI, Tableau, Shiny) sowie mit fortgeschrittenen Datenanalysen unter Verwendung statistischer Programmiersprachen/-Software (z.B. SPSS, R, Python)
Sehr sicherer Umgang mit MS Office, vor allem Excel und PowerPoint sowie gute Anwendungskenntnisse in der Datenvisualisierung
Du zeichnest Dich aus durch Deine Qualitäts-, Service- und Lösungsorientierung sowie Dein ausgezeichnetes analytisches Denkvermögen und Datenaffinität
Darüber hinaus verfügst Du über eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe und das Talent mehrere innovative Projekte gleichzeitig eigenständig zu managen
Dein aufgeschlossenes Wesen, souveränes Auftreten sowie sehr gute Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch runden Dein Profil ab
Unser Angebot
Kollegiales, anspruchsvolles und chancenreiches Beratungsumfeld
Breite Möglichkeit zur Anwendung und Vertiefung von Wissen im Bereich Healthcare/Pharma
Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung / Gleitzeit und Home-Office
Volle Arbeitsausstattung für Office und Home-Office
Ein starkes Team heißt Dich in einer außergewöhnlichen Arbeitsatmosphäre und offenen Unternehmenskultur willkommen. Dein Wissen und unsere Erfahrung, Dein Engagement und unser ausgezeichnetes Leistungspaket – sind das nicht beste Voraussetzungen für eine erfüllende Aufgabe mit großartiger Entwicklungsperspektive?

About The Role

2023 wird Sandoz potentiell zu einer eigenständigen Organisation! Als globaler Marktführer in den Bereichen Generika/Antibiotikaherstellung ist dies eine aufregende, einmalige Gelegenheit, unseren eigenen Weg als unabhängige, zielorientierte Organisation voranzutreiben. Als Gründungsmitglieder einer neuen Sandoz ist dies eine Zeit großer Chancen für uns alle, sowohl beruflich als auch persönlich!

Gemeinsam werden wir die Zukunft von Sandoz gestalten... Sind Sie bereit, mit uns etwas zu bewegen?

Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:

500.000! Das ist die Menge an Siegelstreifen, die wir täglich bei Sandoz in Kundl produzieren. Diese sind mit lebensnotwendigen Antibiotika befüllt, um die flächendeckende Versorgung mit Antibiotika in Österreich und der Welt zu gewährleisten.

Deshalb suchen wir ab sofort einen motivierten QA Operations Specialist (d/w/m), der unser Team tatkräftig unterstützt!

Ihre Aufgaben sind unter anderem:
Durchführung von mikrobiologischen Analysen (Keimzahlbestimmung, Growth Promotion Test, etc.) in einem LF
Erfüllung der allgemeinen und zugewiesenen Aufgaben im mikrobiologischen QC-Labor gemäß Vorschriften per mündlichem oder schriftlichem Auftrag
GMP-gerechte und sorgfältige Durchführung und Auswertung von mikrobiologischen Analysen gemäß Labor- und Testvorschriften
Mitarbeit in der Sicherstellung der zeitgerechten Abarbeitung von Analysen sowie Sicherstellung der Sauberkeit des Arbeitsplatzes
Selbstständige Durchführung, Auswertung und Dokumentation von Analysen


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Role Requirements

Was Sie für die Position mitbringen:
Bereitschaft zum 3-Schichtbetrieb (4 bis 12 Uhr, 12 bis 20 Uhr, 20 bis 4 Uhr)
Erfahrung im Bereich der aseptischen Arbeitsweise (gegebenfalls Arbeitserfahrung im Isolator)
Abgeschlossene Fachausbildung (z.B. HTL Chemie oder Lehre in Chemie/Chemieverfahrenstechnik, MTA, BTA, PTA, MTF oder CTA oder vergleichbar
Bereitschaft zur Weiterentwicklung
Kenntnisse in der funktionale Breite QC/QA in der Pharmaindustrie/Biotechnologie mit Umweltüberwachung & Sauberkeitszonen wünschenswert
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie Basiskenntnisse in Englisch
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im GMP Bereich


Zusatzqualifikationen
Grundkenntnisse in den Office-Anwendungen
Grundkenntnisse in SAP wünschenswert


Warum Sandoz?

Fast 500 Millionen Patienten konnten im Jahr 2022 mit Generika und Biosimilars von Sandoz erreicht werden. Wir sind stolz darauf, aber wir wissen auch, dass wir noch mehr tun können, um den Menschen auf der ganzen Welt den Zugang zu Medikamenten zu erleichtern.

Wir befinden uns in einem entscheidenden Moment unserer Geschichte, der uns die Freiheit gibt, weiterhin Millionen von Menschen den Zugang zu erschwinglichen, hochwertigen Medikamenten zu ermöglichen. Gemeinsam werden wir die Zukunft von Sandoz gestalten, indem wir von Grund auf eine Organisation aufbauen und dabei ein anspruchsvolles Umfeld mit wirkungsvollen, flexiblen und hybriden Karrieren erleben, in dem Vielfalt willkommen ist und persönliches Wachstum gefördert wird!

Gemeinsam gestalten wir die Zukunft!

Stellen Sie sich vor, was Sie bei Sandoz tun könnten!

Neben einem marktgerechten Grundgehalt bieten wir bis zu 14 Wochen bezahlte Elternzeit für Mütter und Väter, ein attraktives Bonus/Incentive Programm, eine moderne Firmenpension, Kinderbetreuungseinrichtungen, Aus- und Weiterbildungsprogramme und weltweite Karrieremöglichkeiten.

Das Grundgehalt für diese Position besteht aus dem kollektivvertraglichen Mindestgehalt in Höhe von €43,548.40/Jahr (auf Vollzeitbasis) sowie einer allfälligen Überzahlung, basierend auf Ihren bisherigen Erfahrungen, Qualifikationen und individuellen Kompetenzen. Wir sind offen für Teilzeit und Jobsharing Modelle und unterstützen wo immer möglich flexibles arbeiten und Homeoffice.

Engagement für Vielfalt und Inklusion:

Sandoz setzt sich für Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion ein. Wir sind bestrebt, vielfältige Teams zusammenzustellen, die für die Patienten und Gemeinschaften repräsentativ sind, denen wir dienen.

Treten Sie unserem Sandoz Netzwerk bei: wenn diese Position nicht zu Ihrer Erfahrung oder Ihren Karrierezielen passt, Sie aber dennoch mit uns in Kontakt bleiben möchten, um mehr über Sandoz und unsere Karrieremöglichkeiten zu erfahren, dann treten Sie hier dem Sandoz Netzwerk bei: Sandoz Talentpool (novartis.com)

Do you want to act as the central lead to formalize, manage, and project manage business requirements for the Owned Media Team while also overseeing the consumer facing implementation that drives the business forward? Then come and join our team!

In this role, you’ll join the Owned Media team in Salzburg, which drives the global strategy for Red Bull’s Owned channels, including RedBull.com and the Red Bull TV app.

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

Project Management

You’ll act as the lead to consolidate and distill requirements into a working business brief that can be formalized into actions from our supporting product and development teams, who include product managers, analytics leads, engineering teams, IT specialists, and others. You’ll also act to oversee all implementation and operationalization of product changes – ensuring all development minimizes the internal resource requirement while maximizing the user facing outcome.

Channel Operations & Processes

Beyond reactionary development, you’ll act to jointly define a shared long-term vision of success to empower product managers to develop changes that support our long-term goals – driving a proactive and innovative approach that delivers premium experiences that elevate users’ day. This role has absolute oversight over the Owned Media tool landscape that powers Red Bull.com and Red Bull TV and the application and operations of these tools at both a market and international level. This role is the guardian of resources and ensures all product and operational requirements minimize the input of local and international teams. In your day-to-day you’ll manage product briefings, check-ins, and ensure appropriate stakeholders are informed. You'll continuously update affected teams on progress and be the main POC for owned product development questions coming from any business stakeholders.

Timeline Management

In this role you’ll ensure that all projects have a clear timeline and internal deliverable dates are defined and communicated to key stakeholders impacted - specifically within the owned media, media IT, and digital products and services teams. You’ll also maintain oversight over technical deliverables and roadmaps to prioritize according to shifting business needs and external developments and you’ll ensure smooth and most efficient workflows for operations between key business teams tasked to operate owned tools and products.

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

Experience in working in a similar role, in large organizations or within cross-functional media teams
Excellent organizational and project management skills and flexibility to adapt quickly to changing priorities, tools, and environments.
Service-oriented, efficient, and inventive professional with advanced problem-solving skills, outstanding attention to detail and effective communication skills
Strong time management skills; ability to troubleshoot & balance multiple projects.
Collaborative thinker and team player who thrives in connecting people to optimize project outcomes
Fluent in English, any other language would be a plus

Due to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is € 2,208 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

Bevorzugt: abgeschlossene Matura (HAK, HTL), fachlich relevanter Bachelor, Master oder abgeschlossene Meisterausbildung in Kombination mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung

Warum Sie sich für Novartis entscheiden sollten?

799 Millionen - so viele Menschen haben wir mit unseren Produkten im Jahr 2019 erreicht. Darauf sind wir stolz. In einer Welt des digitalen und technologischen Wandels stellen wir uns die Frage: Wie können wir noch mehr Menschenleben verbessern und verlängern?

Wir sind überzeugt: neugierige und ambitionierte Menschen wie wir finden gemeinsam in einem inspirierenden Umfeld neue Antworten und treffen mutige Entscheidungen.

Wir bieten Ihnen ein marktgerechtes Grundgehalt auf Basis Ihrer Qualifikation, Berufserfahrung sowie individueller Kompetenzen. Darüber hinaus bieten wir ein attraktives Bonus/Incentive Programm, moderne Firmenpension, Kinderbetreuungseinrichtungen, Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und weltweite Karrieremöglichkeiten innerhalb der Novartis Gruppe. Das Grundgehalt besteht aus dem kollektivvertraglichen Entgelt (mindestens € 54.735/Jahr auf Vollzeitbasis) sowie einer allfälligen marktangepassten Überzahlung.

Stellen Sie sich vor, was Sie bei Novartis tun könnten!

Novartis setzt sich für Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion ein. Wir sind bestrebt, vielfältige Teams zusammenzustellen, die für die Patienten und Gemeinschaften repräsentativ sind, denen wir dienen. Wir bemühen uns um die Schaffung eines inklusiven Arbeitsplatzes, der durch Zusammenarbeit mutige Innovationen fördert und unsere Mitarbeiter in die Lage versetzt, ihr volles Potenzial zu entfalten.

Einstellungsentscheidungen basieren alleine auf der Qualifikation für die Position, unabhängig von Geschlecht, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion, sexueller Orientierung, Alter oder Behinderung.

Treten Sie unserem Novartis Netzwerk bei: wenn diese Position nicht zu Ihrer Erfahrung oder Ihren Karrierezielen passt, Sie aber dennoch mit uns in Kontakt bleiben möchten, um mehr über Novartis und unsere Karrieremöglichkeiten zu erfahren, dann treten Sie hier dem Novartis Netzwerk bei: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network
