Falkensteiner Hotels & Residences ist auf der Suche nach einem sehr erfahrenen und motivierten Senior Data Analysten für unser Data Strategy, BI & CRM Team. Der ideale Kandidat hat eine starke Erfolgsbilanz bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von datengesteuerten Lösungen innerhalb komplexer Systemumgebungen, idealerweise mit vorheriger Erfahrung in der Hotelbranche und Erfahrung mit CRS-, PMS- und CRM-Systemen. Sie verfügen außerdem über ein ausgeprägtes Verständnis für Datenbankmanagement und die Fähigkeit, sowohl mit technischen als auch mit nicht-technischen Zielgruppen effektiv zu kommunizieren.

Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)

WAS WIR DIR BIETEN:

Team Member Rate und Family & Friends Special Rates mit zusätzlichen Vergünstigungen auf F&B und Spa-Leistungen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Gleittage
Jahreskarte der Wiener Linien
Top modernes Office nähe Prater-Hauptallee
Teamevents und Teamaktivitäten (z.B.: Sportevents, gastronomische Events,….)
Karriere- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einer wachsenden Hotelgruppe
Interne Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Mitgestaltungsmöglichkeiten in einem dynamischen und offenen Arbeitsumfeld
Wöchentlicher Obstkorb, Vergünstigte Preise in umliegenden Restaurants

DEIN BEREICH:

Du bist maßgeblich daran beteiligt, die relevanten Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen wie Datenbanken, Umfragen und sozialen Medien zu identifizieren und zu unserem Kernmodell hinzuzufügen.
Du definierst und implementierst die erforderliche Datenbereinigung, Deduplizierung und Normalisierung.
Mit Hilfe von statistischen und maschinellen Lerntechniken analysierst Du Daten, identifizieren Muster und Trends und kommunizierst Deine Ergebnisse an die relevanten Stakeholder.
Darüber hinaus bist Du an der Erstellung, Optimierung und Verbreitung von Dashboards und Berichten (Power BI) im gesamten Unternehmen beteiligt.
In Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen beteiligst Du Dich an der Pflege der Dateninfrastruktur, wie Datenbanken und Data Warehouses.
Indem Du jüngere Teammitglieder sowie andere Abteilungen in BI- und Datenmanagementmethoden schulst und anleitest, trägst Du zum "Data Mindset and Awareness" des Unternehmens bei.
Du beobachtest die neuesten Datenanalysetechnologien und -trends im Gastgewerbe und tragen zu deren Integration in unser Modell bei.

DAS BRINGST DU MIT:

Master-Abschluss in Statistik, Datenwissenschaft oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse in einem multikulturellen Umfeld, idealerweise in der Hotelbranche
Ausgeprägtes Verständnis von maschinellem Lernen und statistischen Techniken
Erfahrung mit einer Vielzahl von Tools und Plattformen zur Datenspeicherung und -visualisierung, insbesondere SQL/MySQL und Power BI
Sicherer Umgang mit Python, R und Beherrschung von MSSQL, Excel
Frühere berufliche Erfahrungen mit APIs sind ein großes Plus.
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Fähigkeit, selbstständig und im Team zu arbeiten.
Problemlösungsorientiertes Denken mit der Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme anhand von Daten zu erkennen und zu lösen.
Datenethik: Es wird erwartet, dass Sie sich der ethischen Implikationen Ihrer Arbeit bewusst sind und Daten in einer verantwortungsvollen und ethischen Weise nutzen.

Für diese Vollzeitposition bieten wir ein monatliches Bruttogehalt ab € 3.000,- . Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrungen bieten wir eine marktübliche Überzahlung.

Bei Fragen stehen wir dir gerne per Mail zur Verfügung.

Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich über den „Bewerben“ Button.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Wirf einen Blick auf deinen zukünftigen Arbeitsplatz: https://www.falkensteiner.com/karriere

Irina Aleksic
Irina Aleksic
🚀 HR Consultant @ CLC Digital, Vienna
Join Our Client - An IT Company for Intelligent Software Development in Vienna!

In a world characterized by innovation-driven development, our client stands as a trailblazer in the realm of software creation.
This company consists mostly of developers - some of the best developers you‘ll find in Austria.

Our client is at the forefront of cutting-edge gaming technology, harnessing open-source technologies to drive their mission. Their Microservice operations framework streamlines everything from code development to cloud hardware provisioning, enabling developers to achieve faster and more frequent results. They have cultivated an environment that is truly the ultimate space for creating exceptional software.

For them, we are hiring an exceptional Java Software Architect!


Your Role

Being a part of their team, you'll dedicate at least 80% of your time to developing new features, with minimal meetings, bug fixes, and documentation work. Programming at its best and cloud hosting are the norm because speed and high-quality delivery are paramount. You'll be entrusted with building stuff end-to-end, from understanding requirements to production release. The release process is in your hands, done at your discretion.

Quality takes precedence over quantity, and their tech stack includes: Java, Kubernetes, AWS, NoSQL, MongoDB Atlas, Cloud Hosting, Microservices, and Open Source technologies.

Working with open-source technologies and microservices is the essence of this company. It's the ideal environment if you seek more freedom and autonomy in your development work. Trust is placed in your hands to discover and implement the best solutions. You'll collaborate with top-tier professionals who support one another.


Your Qualifications

To thrive in this unique environment, you should bring:
A solid foundation in Java development (5+ years)
A deep understanding of Kubernetes and/or AWS
A passion for technology in general, with a particular interest in cloud hosting and NoSQL databases
A genuine desire to code, without aspirations for a management career
An independent and self-driven mindset, as there are no Scrum Masters, Tech Leaders, Testing Engineers, or Sys Admins directing your work. It's your decision!
If you're comfortable with the idea of working in the real-money gaming industry (gambling) and crave autonomy, you've found your ideal match!


Your Benefits

Joining our client's team comes with a range of advantages, including:
Unparalleled autonomy - minimal managerial oversight and a flat hierarchy
Your choice of equipment - select the tools you work best with (typically the latest MacBooks)
End-to-end work, rather than dealing with a small portion of a massive system, where your contributions and ideas will be highly valued
Utilizing the most modern technologies and tools, within a culture of automation without legacy constraints
Frequent table soccer sessions
A hybrid work setting, offering two days of remote work per week
With them, you'll be part of a team characterized by an easy-going culture and flexible work hours

Location: Vienna, Austria
Salary compensation package: annual gross income of 90.000 EUR

Job description:

In unserem Bereich “Technology and Proposal” im Geschäftsfeld “Air Pollution Control” in Raaba sind wir auf der Suche nach Unterstützung und verstärken unser Team mit einem Projekt Manager Sales & Proposal (m/f/d).
 Ihre Aufgaben
Als technischer Projektleiter arbeiten Sie mit dem Commercial Sales Manager (CSM)  eng zusammen und sind gemeinsam für das Angebotsprojekt gesamtverantwortlich
In Abstimmung mit den technischen Fachabteilungen (Verfahrenstechnik, Anlagentechnik, etc…) und Serviceabteilungen (Einkauf, Logistik/Transport, etc…..) erstellen Sie gemeinsam die Angebotskalkulation und die Risikoanalyse
Sie definieren Festlegungen und Vereinbarungen mit dem Kunden, Konsortial- und Engineeringpartnern technische Grundlagen und Zielvorgaben zur Erstellung des Angebotes für das Angebotsteam (Lastenheft)
Sie erstellen einen Vorschlag für das Projektorganigramm
Sie zeichnen verantwortlich für technische Fragen und die Koordinierung der am Projekt beteiligten technischen Fachabteilungen
Erstellung von Anfragespezifikationen für Unterlieferantenanfragen
Mitwirkung an wesentlichen kaufmännischen und technischen Gesprächen mit Kunden, Know-How-Gebern, Konsortialpartnern und Unterlieferanten
Unterstützt den Einkauf bei der Erstellung eines Zukaufskonzeptes (Lokalzukauf, internationaler Zukauf, Anfragen, etc.)
Koordination und Kontrolle der Einhaltung, Sicherung und Durchsetzung der in sämtlichen Verträgen zugesicherten Rechte und auferlegten Pflichten in technischen Belangen
Sie informieren Ihre Vorgesetzten rechtzeitig und regelmäßig über alle wesentlichen Angebotsbelange, Ereignisse und Risken, die das Zustandekommen des Auftrages beeinträchtigen können, insbesondere in technischer Hinsicht, und schlägt Maßnahmen zur Sicherstellung des Auftrages vor
Sie erstellen und koordinieren die Erstellung der technischen Angebote bzw. des technischen Kundenvertrages

Wir liefern Berichtswesen auf Knopfdruck. Somit gehört die Erstellung von maßgeschneiderten Berichten für unsere Kunden zu Deinen Hauptaufgaben. Die Konfiguration des Moduls gestaltet sich für jeden Kunden neu und lebt vor allem von Deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe sowie Deinem lösungs- und prozessorientierten Denken.

Bist Du ein Ass im Umgang mit SQL und hast Du Interesse an verschiedenen BI-Tools wie z.B. MS Reporting Services oder Power-BI? Bist Du an Herausforderungen interessiert, die individuelle Lösungsansätze benötigen? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams!

Konzeption und Umsetzung aller erforderlichen Berichtsinhalte gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden
Tools und Techniken zur kreativen Lösung unterschiedlichster Problemstellungen
Vermittlung von betriebswirtschaftlichen Zusammenhängen, die tagtäglich den Fortbestand von Unternehmen sichern

Du hast eine abgeschlossene, technische Ausbildung oder einen Studienabschluss im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.Ä.

Du besitzt fortgeschrittene SQL-Kenntnisse (MS SQL Server) und bewegst dich routiniert durch relationale Datenbanken
Jemanden mit sehr gutem Verständnis für komplexe Datenstrukturen und Prozessabläufe
Du hast Erfahrung im Umgang mit Webapplikationen, Kenntnissen in Skriptsprachen (z.B. JavaScript, Powershell, …) und speziellen Datenformaten (JSON, XML)
Jemanden, der bereits mit Azure Cloud Anwendungen und der Infrastruktur gearbeitet hat - oder Interesse am Umgang und der Erlernung hat

You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

About Us In Austria

With about 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation. We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we want to keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values: thriving an autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for

supporting our local and international project teams with great IT solutions
supporting our existing team as a Developer to implement technical solutions suiting for our customers' needs
challenging and future oriented projects which range from basic conceptions to realizations at the clients' site globally and locally

We expect you to have

good technical skills and a consulting attitude
3+ years of Java development experience
knowledge of the common technologies like Spring
a good IT background – gathered by graduation from a technical college/university or resulting out of broad project experience
a passion for future developments in this area and the desire to learn more about great and innovative IT solutions
ability to handle discussions in German and English

As a person you are

proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change
taking ownership of your results and delivered quality and passionately drive execution to add customer value
having fun at work, love to learn new things and work within a dynamic team

We offer

an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities
active participation in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment
excellent teamwork which is part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues
benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, excellent public transport connection, food vouchers, fresh fruits, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.
a salary above the defined IT collective agreement of minimum EUR 3.455,00 per month. The amount of overpayment depends on your skills as well as your experience

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

Catharina Christian, Recruitment Specialist, Tietoevry Austria

In the area of Electrics and Electronics we are looking for personalities who are looking for a challenge in the area of electrification to advance the E/E specialist team Physical E/E System and EMC together with us. We are one of the fastest growing areas at AVL and are part of all safety critical products. 
We strive to provide the best solutions to our customers, especially in the new areas of electromobility, hydrogen-powered mobility as well as distributed energy supply and industrial applications for e.g. hydrogen or synthetic fuel production.
 Developing and intergating antenna systems in ongoing development and research projects

From design to validation in the areas of vehicle, hydrogen-powered mobility as well as decentralized energy supply and industrial applications for e.g. hydrogen or synthetic fuel production, including measurements, solution development, supplier coaching and trouble shooting in the project

Further development of standardized methods and processes for permanent adaptation and optimization of technical development
Active cooperation and direct communication with international customers

You are smart and fully motivated to work in a growing team and want to shape a world-class product that is a leader in the market? We believe that a better world needs software to run perfectly, so as a Product Manager at Dynatrace, you'll help take our product to new heights and extend our leadership in the Software Intelligence field.

Job Description

We are a passionate and open-minded group of software enthusiasts, and together, we are global market leader in software intelligence. By providing actionable data on how applications are performing in real-time—for example, crash reporting, server-side tracking, root-cause analysis to name a few—our full-stack monitoring platform helps our customers anticipate and resolve their software issues. We have made it our mission to ensure that millions of people worldwide have an excellent user experience, made possible through a unique combination of observability, automation, and AI—all compacted into one cloud-based software intelligence platform.

The Core Platform is the heart of Dynatrace and serves multiple product purposes such as storing and analyzing observability data as well as frameworks that are used to build the different Dynatrace modules. The entire product is built on the Platform and relies on it. Hyperscale, lightning performance and delivery are key to the aspect you will deliver

In your future role

You will work on taking the Dynatrace Platform to the next level
You own parts of functional- and use case-based aspects of the product roadmap, represent the end user’s point of view, and strive for innovative solutions by answering the WHY and understanding the end user’s pain points.
As part of a larger team, you drive the product roadmap definition and our near-term and long-term product strategy.
You work together with our agile R&D teams to deliver product capabilities that WOW customers and create value-add that sells and impacts product adoption in a measurable fashion.
You manage cross-functional product initiatives with our customer support to excel in customer support situations, prevent escalations and “smooth sailing".
You partner with product marketing to develop targeted messaging, define go-to-market strategies and tactics, and enable the sales team.

Qualifications

Product management experience in a B2B environment, with prior success in setting product (back-up) strategy and executing it based on research, data, and industry trends as well as scaling and optimizing
Good technical understanding, work experience as a developer before, would be an advantage.
Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), SaaS, shared infrastructure, mass storage databases, and Web apps
Knowledge of privacy, scaling, and access control topics
Entrepreneurial mindset to understand the business goals and needs and you’re able to translate product strategy into business impact.
You can think big, but at the same time break things down into smaller components, and build high-level roadmaps from that
Clear sense of ownership and accountability, effective communication skills towards team, peers, and stakeholders alike, as well as a bias for action
Willingness to travel (< 15%)

Additional Information

What's in it for you?
A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side.
Attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.

Compensation And Rewards
We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 60,000 gross per year based on full-time employment. We offer a higher salary in line with qualifications and experience.

Die Erste Bank Oesterreich ist eines der führenden heimischen Geldinstitute. Als Teil der international tätigen Erste Group sind wir eine attraktive Arbeitgeberin, die ihren Mitarbeiter:innen interessante Karrierechancen eröffnet.

Die Gruppe „AT Credit Risk Models“ ist für die Entwicklung und laufende Überwachung der in der Erste Bank Österreich sowie den Sparkassen verwendeten internen Kreditrisikomodelle verantwortlich. Diese werden im Rahmen der Basel- und IFRS 9-Rahmenwerke verwendet und unterstützen interne Kreditrisikomanagementprozesse wie die Kreditentscheidung und -überwachung.

Deine Tasks
Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von mathematisch-statistischen Vorhersagemodellen, unter anderem im Rahmen von Erste Group- weiten Projekten, zur Berechnung des Kreditrisikos unter Verwendung von Machine Learning-Techniken
Durchführung regelmäßiger Monitoring-Aktivitäten samt Ableitung von Handlungsanweisungen zur kontinuierlichen Aufrechterhaltung der Modellgenauigkeit und Leistungsfähigkeit
Kommunikation mit bankinternen Stakeholdern (z.B. Vertrieb, operatives Risikomanagement, IT) betreffend Methoden, Prozessen und Resultaten
Darlegung der Konformität der Modelle mit den relevanten regulatorischen Rahmenbedingungen gegenüber der Validierungsfunktion und internen Revision sowie den Wirtschaftsprüfern und Aufsichtsbehörden

Dein Background
Neugierig darauf, neue Techniken, Prozesse und Ansätze auszuprobieren und großes Interesse daran innovative Lösungen für spannende Problemstellungen zu finden
Zuverlässig und interessiert daran, in einem Team sowie bereichsübergreifend und international zusammenzuarbeiten
Fortgeschrittene Programmierkenntnisse in statistischer Software, vorzugsweise Python, R, SAS, SQL sowie abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativem Fokus, idealerweise im Bereich Mathematik, Statistik, Informatik bzw. Ökonometrie
Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung oder der Validierung statistischer Modelle, besonders von Kreditrisikomodellen sowie Praxis im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen wünschenswert

Unser Angebot
Werde Teil eines engagierten und erfolgreichen Teams mit abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeiten
Es erwartet dich ein attraktives und internationales Umfeld mit ausgezeichneter Zukunftsperspektive und vielfältigen Angeboten zur persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Entwicklung der Modelle mit Hilfe moderner Infrastruktur und Plattformen
Entdecke die zusätzlichen Benefits der Erste Bank
Das Mindestentgelt für diese Vollzeitposition (38,5h) nach dem geltenden Kollektivvertrag beträgt 44.567,00 Euro brutto pro Jahr bei vollständiger Erfüllung des Funktionsprofils. Aber das ist nur eine Formalität - über dein tatsächliches Gehalt sprechen wir gerne persönlich!
Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeiter:innen individuelle Homeoffice-Lösungen.
Die Erste Bank sieht in der Diversität ihrer Mitarbeiter:innen einen Schlüssel für Innovation und Exzellenz. Als Arbeitgeberin sind wir stolz darauf, allen die gleichen Chancen zu bieten, unabhängig von Alter, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung oder Herkunft.

You are smart and fully motivated to work in a growing team and want to shape a world-class product that is a leader in the market? We believe that a better world needs software to run perfectly, so as a Product Manager at Dynatrace, you'll help take our product to new heights and extend our leadership in the Software Intelligence field.

Job Description

We are a passionate and open-minded group of software enthusiasts, and together, we are global market leader in software intelligence. By providing actionable data on how applications are performing in real-time—for example, crash reporting, server-side tracking, root-cause analysis to name a few—our full-stack monitoring platform helps our customers anticipate and resolve their software issues. We have made it our mission to ensure that millions of people worldwide have an excellent user experience, made possible through a unique combination of observability, automation, and AI—all compacted into one cloud-based software intelligence platform.

The Core Platform is the heart of Dynatrace and serves multiple product purposes such as storing and analyzing observability data as well as frameworks that are used to build the different Dynatrace modules. The entire product is built on the Platform and relies on it. Hyperscale, lightning performance and delivery are key to the aspect you will deliver

In your future role

You will work on taking the Dynatrace Platform to the next level
You own parts of functional- and use case-based aspects of the product roadmap, represent the end user’s point of view, and strive for innovative solutions by answering the WHY and understanding the end user’s pain points.
As part of a larger team, you drive the product roadmap definition and our near-term and long-term product strategy.
You work together with our agile R&D teams to deliver product capabilities that WOW customers and create value-add that sells and impacts product adoption in a measurable fashion.
You manage cross-functional product initiatives with our customer support to excel in customer support situations, prevent escalations and “smooth sailing".
You partner with product marketing to develop targeted messaging, define go-to-market strategies and tactics, and enable the sales team.

Qualifications

Product management experience in a B2B environment, with prior success in setting product (back-up) strategy and executing it based on research, data, and industry trends as well as scaling and optimizing
Good technical understanding, work experience as a developer before, would be an advantage.
Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), SaaS, shared infrastructure, mass storage databases, and Web apps
Knowledge of privacy, scaling, and access control topics
Entrepreneurial mindset to understand the business goals and needs and you’re able to translate product strategy into business impact.
You can think big, but at the same time break things down into smaller components, and build high-level roadmaps from that
Clear sense of ownership and accountability, effective communication skills towards team, peers, and stakeholders alike, as well as a bias for action
Willingness to travel (< 15%)

Additional Information

What's in it for you?
A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side.
Attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.

Compensation And Rewards
We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 60,000 gross per year based on full-time employment. We offer a higher salary in line with qualifications and experience.

About Us In Austria

With about 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz and Zurich, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation. We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we want to keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values: thriving an autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for

exciting and complex projects in Switzerland and Western Austria. Furthermore, for

leading teams that are delivering our projects and services to our customers
helping to define technology roadmaps and solutions
taking a leading role in defining the project methods for successful project deliveries
managing the implementation of digital solutions
proactively contribute to ensure the highest quality in our deliveries
scoping and delivering technology innovation services

We are evaluating possible company sites in Western Austria at the moment. For the time being, you will mainly work remotely from home office.

You will receive ongoing support from your colleagues and manager to make your start at Tietoevry as easy and smooth as possible.

We expect you to have

experience and knowledge of Scrum or any other project management experience
min. 5 years of experience in working as project manager
experience in shaping and leading teams across multiple stages of the project delivery lifecycle
know-how in delivering complex projects with various stakeholders
experience in developing RFP responses, project estimation, staffing and other pre-sales related activities
a consulting attitude and the ability to handle discussions in German and English
the willingness to travel to provide best services to our customers

As a person you are

passionate about all tasks around project management: team building, planning, cost & budget handling, collaboration, and discussion with the customer
proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change
passionately driving execution to add customer value and take ownership of your results and delivered quality
having fun at work, passionate about customer's success and personal growth

We offer

an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities
a large customer network and an industrialized consulting solution portfolio
a great opportunity to take part in state-of-art projects to deliver the best solutions to our customers
active participation in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment
excellent teamwork which is part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues
benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, food vouchers, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.
a salary above the defined IT collective agreement of minimum EUR 4.032,00 per month. The amount of overpayment depends on your skills as well as your experience

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

Catharina Christian, Recruitment Specialist, Tietoevry Austria

job_title: Senior Process Development Manager – Product Lifecycle
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Product Lifecycle Management Consultant or Key user, within depth knowledge of PLM applications and new product introductions.

As part of the Global Data Team, based in our Headquarter in Salzburg, you'll be responsible to support our senior line managers in the development of new processes and features, and will translate business and process requirements to functional concepts as a basis for technical implementation.

In this very visible strategic role, you will manage and track projects independently, ensure a holistic end-to-end view, highlight cross functional dependencies, and align business needs and target state with multiple stakeholders. By driving digital transformation, you'll act as a key player in optimizing our “idea to BOM” process and master data structure.

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

CONCEPT DEVELOPMENT AND DOCUMENTATION

As a member of our team you'll collect, derive and challenge business requirements and align them with cross-functional stakeholders. By providing an objective and holistic perspective you avoid isolated solutions and secure end-to-end integration of all anticipated changes. By applying your conceptual strength and product lifecycle know-how you'll shape our process and system level to increase maturity levels. Securing a structured and detailed requirement documentation as well as handing it over to IT are also part of your responsibility.

PROJECT MANAGEMENT

In this role you'll manage and drive projects independently. You define and schedule work packages and set up realistic project timelines in alignment with our IT, considering resources and overall constraints. You'll track and document project progress and milestones in our project management and monitor implementation budgets. In alignment with our portfolio management team, you'll ensure reporting and escalation to our senior management.

WORKSHOPS & MEETINGS

You'll prepare and host project meetings and workshops to work efficiently on the development of new system solution designs. You also contribute to steering meetings with our senior management to get direction on open decisions and questions.

STAKEHOLDER & RESOURCE MANAGEMENT

Keeping all required stakeholders in the loop and informed about insights and status of your assigned projects will be part of your responsibility as well as to have an overview of required and available resources and highlighting potential bottlenecks.

TESTING AND HANDOVER

You'll be responsible to test all implemented solutions to ensure high quality and functional integration of all technical developments. Effort and progress of testing will be also documented and tracked by you. After successful testing you'll introduce and hand over the new process to the data quality team. Training preparation and documentation are also part of your role as well as facilitating and hosting of those trainings.

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

5+ years of professional experience in a product lifecycle management, PLM key user or consultant role
Bachelor or master’s degree in business administration, supply chain or operations management, process and/or project management or similar
Fluent in English, German beneficial but not mandatory
Depth knowledge of PLM applications and proven expertise in developing and implementing process improvements in the field of new product introduction
Highly experienced in gathering, challenging, and translating business requirements to system integration concepts
Verifiable experience in managing projects and programs
System affinity, conceptual strength and holistic view
Strong analytical skills, solution- and process oriented, structured, assertiveness, communicative and collaborative, team player, able to work under pressure and self-dependently
Strong communication and presentation skills

Das Customer Profitability Management (CPM)-Team ist verantwortlich für das Management und die Entwicklung innovativer Systemlösungen, und liefert wertvolle geschäftliche Erkenntnisse über unsere Kunden und die Rentabilität aller globalen Red Bull Organisationen.

In dieser Rolle identifizieren und implementieren Sie Systemverbesserungen, steigern die Datenqualität und erhöhen die Prozesseffizienz. Sie sind verantwortlich für die Implementierung unserer CPM-Tools in Tochtergesellschaften weltweit und stellen sicher, dass die richtigen Prozesse für die Analyse der Kundenrentabilität vorhanden sind. Darüber hinaus fungieren Sie als Ansprechpartner für lokale Key-User und unterstützen diese bei Tool-Fragen sowie Systemproblemen.

Persönliche Stärken einsetzen

Verantwortungsbereiche und Aufgaben, in denen etwas bewegt werden kann:

ENTWICKLUNGEN, VERBESSERUNGEN UND IMPLEMENTIERUNG UNSERER CPM-TOOLS

Als Project Manager Finance Systems sind Sie für verschiedene Projekte zuständig. Sie identifizieren Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten aufgrund der aktuellen Geschäfts- und Benutzeranforderungen und definieren neue Wege, um die Berichtsfunktionen und Benutzererfahrungen zu verbessern. Darüber hinaus beteiligen Sie sich an der Umstellung unserer Systeme auf S4/Hana sowie an der Entwicklung neuer Systeme in Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern. Die Implementierung von CPM-Tools in Red Bull-Tochtergesellschaften weltweit sowie die Schulung und Unterstützung für relevante Benutzer fällt auch in Ihren Aufgabenbereich. Daher ist ein Verständnis für komplexe technische Lösungen wichtig und eine allgemeine technische Affinität.

BUSINESS PARTNER FÜR LOKALE MÄRKTE UND HEADQUARTER

In dieser Rolle fungieren Sie als Partner für Tochterunternehmen bei der Etablierung und Ausschöpfung des Potenzials unserer CPM-Tools mit dem Fokus auf Geschäftsprozesse. Sie arbeiten mit Teams aus den Bereichen Sales, IT, Supply Chain und Operations zusammen, um eine gemeinsame Ausrichtung der kurz- und langfristigen Strategie zu gewährleisten.

SYSTEMUNTERSTÜTZUNG UND QUALITÄT

Sie sind die globale Ansprechperson für CPM-Tools und für alle Key User bei prozess- oder systembezogenen Problemen und Fragen. Dabei stellen Sie sicher, dass das System ordnungsgemäß funktioniert und identifizieren Optimierungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb des CPM Systems. Sie erstellen ein automatisiertes Dashboard zur Verfolgung und Überprüfung der Daten von Tochtergesellschaften und Prozessqualität, um mögliche Warnzeichen zu identifizieren, die mit den relevanten Stakeholdern im HQ und den lokalen Märkten geteilt werden können.

TRAINING UND SCHULUNG

Eine weitere Aufgabe ist die Konzeption und Erstellung von Schulungen und Workshops sowie die Vorbereitung der dazugehörigen Materialen und Dokumentationen. Sie halten Vorort- und Onlineschulungen für die System User unserer Tochtergesellschaften, um eine ordnungsgemäße Systemhandhabung sicherzustellen und die Verbindung zu Key Usern zu stärken.

Hier zählen Erfahrung und bisher erbrachte Leistungen

Für die Rolle relevant:

Mindestens 4 Jahre relevante Erfahrung im Bereich Projektmanagement, IT, Finanzen und/oder Controlling
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaft, Controlling oder Finanzwesen
Fließende Englischkenntnisse, Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil
Hohe IT-Kompetenz und technisch versiert, Vertrautheit mit ERP-Systemen oder einem beliebigen integrierten Business-Analyse-Tool von Vorteil (SAP - CRM, ERP (SD, FI, COPA), S4/HANA, SAC, BI oder Essbase, Hyperion usw.)
Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und der Erstellung von Reporting-Lösungen
Verständnis für komplexe technische Lösungen und generelle technische Affinität
Erfahrung in der FMCG-Branche und/oder Schwerpunkt Vertriebscontrolling von Vorteil
Fähigkeit, komplexe Prozesse zu verstehen, Risiken zu erkennen und Lösungen zu finden
Ergebnisorientierter Teamplayer mit starken Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten

Aus gesetzlichen Gründen sind wir verpflichtet darauf hinzuweisen, dass das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt für diese Position bei monatlich EUR 2.181 brutto liegt. Unsere attraktiven Gehaltspakete orientieren sich jedoch an aktuellen Marktgehältern und liegen daher deutlich über dem angegebenen Mindestgehalt.

Als Arbeitgeber schätzen wir Diversität und unterstützen Menschen ihre Potenziale und Stärken zu entfalten, ihre Ideen zu verwirklichen und Chancen zu ergreifen. Passioniert glauben wir daran, dass Diversität unter Kollegen ein zentrales Element unseres Erfolgs ist. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen aller Menschen gleichermaßen, unabhängig von Alter, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung oder Herkunft.

We are mission critical

Beyond Gravity, headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, is the first startup to combine agility, speed and innovation with decades of experience and proven quality. Around 1600 employees at 12 locations in six countries (Switzerland, Sweden, Austria, Germany, USA and Finland) develop and manufacture products for satellites and launch vehicles with the goal of advancing humankind and enabling the exploration of the world and beyond. Beyond Gravity is the preferred supplier of structures for all types of launch vehicles and a leader in selected satellite products and for constellations in the New Space sector. Beyond Gravity also uses its space knowledge for applications outside of space technology: The high-precision products have already been used in the semiconductor industry for more than 20 years.

Your mission

In this exciting and challenging position at our site in Vienna, you will be responsible for the management and coordination of technical tasks as technical responsible in development projects of thermal and mechanical products for satellites and rockets.

The Systems Engineer:

Analyses technical and programmatic customer requirements, develops and evaluates system concepts, technical definition and technical documentation.
Defines and delegates tasks to technical project team members, estimates staffing requirements and turnaround times of technical tasks, prepares effort and cost estimates for developed designs, work packages and proposals.
Supervises or carries out own research and development activities on new or existing products
Is the technical interface with customers, project partners, subcontractors and suppliers as well as in-house testing, manufacturing and assembly teams

Your horizon

Higher technical education (university degree, MSc, or university of applied sciences degree) in aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, mechanics, materials engineering or physics
Several years of professional experience in the aerospace sector of mechanical or thermal systems
Analytical, solution-oriented thinking coupled with a practical personality with strong implementation skills
Language skills: German and English business fluent

Our spectrum

Exciting job in a leading high-tech company in Austria
Flexitime model with the possibility of home office
Subsidised company canteen

Gross monthly salary: Negotiable annual salary: EUR 4.240.- gross, depending on qualifications and professional experience.

We look forward to receiving your online application in English!

Your contact

Did we spark your interest in this exciting position? Then we look forward to receiving your online application.

We are looking for talented Site Project Manager (f/m/d) for high voltage direct current (HVDC) power transmission construction sites to join our team at Siemens Energy to support the transition to a more sustainable and energized world!

A Snapshot of Your Day

As Site Project Manager your working day starts at an industrial construction site. You will plan and organize the daily site activities together with your team. You will be the primary contact for customer, authorities, contractors, partners at construction site. You will align and work closely together with the project management and project team in the back office.

The Site Project Manager will work for his/her first assignment at construction sites within Germany and is flexible to take new assignment at other worldwide industrial site locations as well.

German language knowledge is required as he/she will be dealing with the local authorities on a regular basis.

How You’ll Make An Impact

Overall responsibility for all onsite works within the responsibility of Siemens Project Entity, Erection & Commissioning team (SE PE EC)
Is legally responsible for the project site and all site staff.
Ensures compliance with the requirements, regulations and procedures governing occupational environmental health and safety (EHS) and promotes and leads the Zero Harm Culture for the scope within his/ her responsibility.
Represents the interests of Project Management on site to the customer, authorities, contractors, partners, and consultants.
Responsible for the on-site order implementation, financial results, time schedule and quality
results related to the Siemens Energy scope of work by using standardized tools.
Manages and documents deviations (non-conformances) from erection procedures and instructions, specifications, time schedules etc. and directs contract and claim activities as required.
Escalates as necessary issues that have the potential to impact scope, budget, and/ or
schedule
Coordination and controlling of the discipline’s corrective measure scenarios, cost evaluated risk mitigation and opportunity schemes.
Review of discipline’s concurrent cost accounting, including cost to complete estimation
Regular review of the project time schedule in respect to erection activities
Ensure experience and information feedback, update List of Open Points (supported by SE PE tool landscape)
Provide support for project site-specific reporting (e.g. daily, weekly reports)
Ensure that all open technical project changes are closed before the respective mile stones (e.g. erection system completion)

What You Bring

Extensive experience in construction of complex industrial projects (preferable for High voltage direct current (HVDC) power transmission projects) - EPC and/or Consortium projects
Willingness to work in and outside of Austria at construction sites
At least 5 years onsite experience in a leading position (E/Civil site lead) on major construction sites; Knowledge of Construction/ Commissioning processes and methodologies
In depth knowledge and competence in EHS policies, practices, regulations, and plans for onsite works for complex construction projects.
Proven experience in leading multinational teams in a quick changing environment and excellent communication and leadership skills
Higher education degree in an electrical or civil engineering discipline
PM Certification is a plus (e.g. IPMA)
Language competencies:
German: Advanced - reading and writing
English: Advanced - reading and writing
Spanish: would be a plus


Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character - no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits

The opportunity to engage in an exciting environment on challenging projects.
Strong professional support and working with colleagues around the world.
Professional development opportunities within the company.
To be part of a growing function with a dynamic, informal, and inspiring working environment in a position that entails a large responsibility.
Flexible working times.
Home office opportunity.
Canteen or meal contributions.
Pension fund.
And more!

We energize society. Let’s make tomorrow different today! Apply online and join Siemens Energy!

At Siemens Energy we offer competitive compensation and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. Due to the Austrian legal regulations, we are obliged to state the minimum salary for this position. Please note that there is a clear willingness for a higher compensation considering your individual expectations, expertise and skills. The minimum salary for this position in the collective agreement for the electrical and electronics industry is in the amount of 50.000 € gross/year for a full-time position (38,5 h/week).

myWarm ist ein GreenTech-Unternehmen mit Sitz in Wien (Zentrale), Berlin und Bozen. Seit 2010 steht die Steigerung der Energieeffizienz von Heizungsanlagen im Mittelpunkt des Schaffens unseres 37-köpfigen Teams. Wir sind digitaler Vorreiter für einen automatisierten hydraulischen Abgleich, der in Wohn- und Nichtwohngebäuden zum Einsatz kommt. Darunter so namhafte Objekte wie der Friedrichstadtpalast Berlin, das Planetarium Hamburg oder die Wiener Hofburg. Unsere Kunden sind Wohnungsunternehmen, Städte, Gemeinden, Gesundheitseinrichtungen und Unternehmen jeder Art (B2B).

Derzeit sind wir mit unserer Dienstleistung stark am Wachsen und bringen gleichzeitig die nächste Produktgeneration zur Marktreife. Unser Ziel: Heizsysteme in die digitale Zukunft führen. Dafür suchen wir neue Lieblingskolleginnen und -kollegen! Du schätzt eine familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre und hast Lust, in eine der derzeit gefragtesten Branchen mit besten Zukunftsaussichten anzupacken und mit uns gemeinsam die Energiewende vorantreiben? Dann gleich bewerben!

Für unsere Zentrale in Wien suchen wir eine Allroundkraft im Bereich Officemanagement und Einkauf. Neben den alltäglichen Office-Aufgaben im Wiener Büro bist du für den Bereich Einkauf und Beschaffung inklusive technischer Geräte- und Materialverwaltung zuständig. Wenn du ein breit gefächertes und vielfältiges Aufgabenfeld schätzt, dann komm an Bord als

Office-Manager:in mit Schwerpunkt Einkauf / Geräteinstandhaltung
Wien– Unbefristete Festanstellung, Stundenausmaß 20 – 30 Stunden

Büro-, Termin- und Reiseorganisation für GF und Management
Erste Ansprechperson (telefonisch, persönlich) für Kunden, Lieferanten und Mitarbeitende
Organisation von Versand, Fracht, Botengängen sowie Fuhrparkverwaltung
Gesamte Einkaufsabwicklung sämtlicher Ersatzteile, Geräte und Büroutensilien
Durchführung der jährlichen Inventur und Optimierung des Lagerbestands
Abwicklung und Betreuung der Mess-Geräteinstandhaltungen und -reparaturen

Take your next career step at B&R – a member of the ABB Group – with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations.

Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Join the automation team at B&R- a member of the ABB Group.

Take your next career step at B&R with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At B&R, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

The BI team is responsible for the further development, standardization and operation of BI processes and tools. As part of the team, you will design and implement a BI and data governance framework. This makes you one of the key players in the strategic, enterprise-wide BI initiative.

Interested? Then we look forward to receiving your informative application (including at least: cover letter, CV, certificate of enrolment, current transcript of grades) through our online careers tool.

Your responsibilities
Development of an enterprise-wide data governance strategy
Further development of business intelligence processes and tools
Design and development of templates, policies and presentations related to BI and reporting
Key stakeholder management and communication
Change management and go-live support
Content creation for internal communication formats (Confluence, Intranet)
Collaboration in IS projects
Your background
Business management and/or information technology education
Expertise in the area Reporting, Data warehousing, Datalake systems
Experience with Snowflake, SAP BW, Power BI and other related technologies is a plus
Strong analytical skills and a goal-oriented approach to work
High level of commitment and initiative
Enjoy developing high-quality IT and BI solutions
Programming or database knowledge an advantage, but not a prerequisite
Very good English language skills, German language skills are an advantage
More about us

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, you can expect an exciting and challenging job with an individually tailored introductory training. You will work in agile teams where you have the opportunity to actively contribute and drive ideas forward. Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life balance.

Our unique B&R spirit is characterized by appreciation, communication at eye level and an informal work culture. We offer you customized training and development programs as well as exciting development opportunities within the company. Numerous other B&R benefits (Parental Leave Program, Employee Assistance Program and many more) round off our offer.

In order to comply with legal regulations, we refer to the minimum salary of the collective agreement of the electrical and electronics industry of € 2 238,66 gross/month. There is a clear willingness to overpay, depending on qualifications and experience.

ABB's Machine Automation Division, also known to our customers as B&R, is an innovative automation company headquartered in Austria with additional offices around the world. B&R became part of ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division in 2017 and, together with the ABB Robotics division, employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries.

As a leading global provider of automation solutions, B&R develops, produces and sells industrial electronics, software solutions and mechatronic solutions as well as technologies for machine and factory automation. Since 2020, B&R's automation portfolio has also included Codian brand delta robots. With its innovative solutions, B&R sets new standards and consistently exceeds its customers' expectations.

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

job_title: Data Analytics Lead for Security Research (m/f/x)
job_description:
Job Description

You’re smart, curious, and love working with a team to help making software run secure? We want your expertise to provide comprehensive security intelligence, tailored to Dynatrace’s needs. Join us now and contribute to the Dynatrace security offering that protects many of the largest organizations in the world.

There is a lot of security intel data out there. Your job is to make it available within Dynatrace.
Identify, combine, and enrich data from multiple sources to close coverage gaps and enable quicker mitigation.
Develop new methods improving our data analysis capabilities & advise on limitations and opportunities.
Lead a team of security data analysts and engage in hiring and organizational topics.
Drive tooling development to automate analysis procedures.
Work with the world-wide R&D team to deliver the security data the product needs.
Assure quick response to emerging threats by providing high-quality data updates.
Stay up-to-date with the latest security trends, emerging threats, and cutting-edge security technologies.

Qualifications

You have 7+ years of experience as security data analyst or similar. Applying data science/analysis to the security domain.
You live and breathe security: long before the latest vulnerability hits the news, you already dissected the technical details.
Theory-talk is not what drives you, you want to get your hands dirty. Be it Python or any other tooling you use, you can & want to dig into data yourself.
You think big and what you do is built to scale: the data feed updates that always caused so much manual work? You automated the analysis!
You love working with a large multidisciplinary team of product managers, developers and architects & you’re not scared of tech talk.
Kubernetes and container security is no stranger to you? Great, knowing the Cloud-native world is a plus!
You’re an experienced leader who can motivate people to work towards a shared vision.
Agile software development principles with high quality standards are at your heart. The tooling you and your team build works reliably, and incremental improvements are delivered at a steady rate.

Additional Information

A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all.
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side. If you need to relocate for a position you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance and support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, as well as a dedicated buddy program.

Compensation and rewards:

We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 85,000 gross per year based on full-time employment (38.5 h/week). We offer a higher salary in line with qualification and experience.

Discover more perks & benefits

Growth opportunities - find out how Dynatrace supports your career development and personal growth journey: https://careers.dynatrace.com/grow-with-us/career-development/

Flexible working - our flexible and trusting work environment fits your current life situation: https://careers.dynatrace.com/ways-of-work/

Relocation Support - discover how we can support you if you wish to join us at one of our global locations: https://careers.dynatrace.com/relocation/
Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

Methodische Unterstützung der Fachbereiche im Bereich der Datenanalyse und Visualisierung (z.B. in Form der Bereitstellung von Schulungen, Workshops)

Zusammenarbeit mit Data Ownern und Data Architects beim Aufbau eines abteilungs- und systemübergreifenden Inventars an KPIs, Datasets und Reports
Analyse, Optimierung und Zentralisierung bestehender Datenanalyseprozesse

Weiterentwicklung unserer Datenanalyse-Plattformen und Services

Was zeichnet dich aus?


Kenntnisse der statistischen Datenanalyse und Visualisierung
Kenntnisse in Datenbank- und Programmiersprachen wie SQL, Python, Scala oder R
Von Vorteil: Erfahrung mit Power BI oder Microstrategy
Von Vorteil: Erfahrung mit Azure Databricks
Von Vorteil: Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche
Verhandlungsgeschick für Gespräche mit unterschiedlichen internen Stakeholdern
Hands-On-Mentalität und Motivation zur Mitgestaltung
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Warum ist es großartig bei Zurich zu arbeiten?


Büro mit Wohlfühl-Ambiente - für jede Tätigkeit das richtige Umfeld
Home-Office und flexibles Arbeiten – Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit
Perspektive für eigene Entwicklung – Zurich Academy, LinkedIn Learning
Angebote für Ihre Gesundheit – Fitnesscenter, Events, Kantine mit Vital-Menü
Attraktive Konditionen für Versicherungsprodukte
Gelebte Diversity und soziales Engagement – PrideZ-Initiative, Eltern-Buddy-Netzwerk, Sozialprojekte
Mitgestalten unserer Zukunft – digital, innovativ und nachhaltig
…und das ist nicht alles!

Das Bruttogehalt für diese Funktion beträgt mindestens EUR 44.340,24 pro Jahr (38,5 Stunden/Woche). Abhängig von deiner Erfahrung und Ausbildung machen wir dir ein passendes Angebot. Dabei orientieren wir uns an aktuellen Marktgehältern.

Was macht Zurich besonders?

„Versicherungen sind langweilig, altmodisch und kompliziert.“ Kommt dir das bekannt vor? Bei uns ist es definitiv anders! Wir sind mitreißend, unkompliziert und treffsicher – einfach mutiger. Unsere 1.300 Kolleginnen und Kollegen arbeiten gemeinsam und nachhaltig am besten Kundenerlebnis. Mit Erfolg, denn unsere Produkte und Services sind mehrfach ausgezeichnet. So gehören wir zu den Top Ten der heimischen Versicherungen

Wir sind die twinformatics. Wir machen Software und Systembetrieb für über 25.000 AnwenderInnen der Vienna Insurance Group, Wiener Städtische Versicherung AG und Donau Versicherung AG.

Millionen KundInnen können sich auf ihre Versicherung verlassen, weil wir mit state of the art Technologien und agilem Mindset dafür sorgen, dass alles läuft, wie es soll. Überzeugt? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams!

Welche Herausforderungen auf dich warten

In unserem Data Development Team haben wir als Ziel, eine einheitliche Datenbasis als Data Analytics-Plattform für interne Dashboards, Data Driven Analytics / Self-Service Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics Szenarios und als Datenfeed für Apps und Web Applikationen zu schaffen.
Unsere Time to Market Data driven Architecture Technologie ermöglicht den Fachbereichen der Versicherungsunternehmen selbstständig Zusammenhänge und Antworten über Kunden- bzw. Vertriebspartner-Verhalten zu finden und daraus Maßnahmen abzuleiten.
Wir legen den Fokus auf „Single Point of Truth“ bzw. qualitativ hochwertige Daten, saubere und transparente Anreicherung der Daten und eine performante Abfragemöglichkeit.

Welche Skills wir uns wünschen

Praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit relationalen DWH Datenbanken basierend auf Microsoft SQL Server.
Erfahrung in der ETL Programmierung, vor allem hands-on Erfahrung mit SSIS.
Erfahrung mit C#/.NET ist von Vorteil
Du hast Datenmodelierungs-Know-How
Data Vault, Stars und Snowflakes siehst du nicht nur am Himmel, SQL Performance Optimierung ist mitunter dein Hobby.
Du bist es gewohnt, deinen Quellcode in GIT oder anderen Versionierungstools für deine TeamkollegInnen nachvollziehbar abzulegen.
Deine Freunde würden dich als genau beschreiben und dir eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise zuschreiben.
Als Teamplayer freust du dich über gemeinsamen Erfolg.
Du hast sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Deine Benefits

Gestütztes Mittagessen
Gleitzeit & mobiles Arbeiten
Gesundheitsbenefits
Weiterbildung
Mitarbeitervergünstigungen
Verkehrsanbindung

Jetzt fehlt nur noch eines: Deine Bewerbung!

Das jährliche Bruttogehalt (Vollzeit) für die Position beträgt mindestens

€ 50.000,-. Du bringst bereits viel Erfahrung und Know-how mit? Dann sind wir selbstverständlich bereit, dies mit einer Überzahlung zu würdigen.

Wenn dich vielfältige Aufgaben in einem dynamischen und expansiven Umfeld ansprechen und du auch im Homeoffice arbeiten möchtest, nutz deine Chance und schreib uns. Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennen zu lernen!

Deine Bewerbung wird selbstverständlich vertraulich behandelt.

You are smart and fully motivated to work in a growing team and want to shape a world-class product that is a leader in the market? We believe that a better world needs software to run perfectly, so as a Product Manager at Dynatrace, you'll help take our product to new heights and extend our leadership in the Software Intelligence field.

Job Description

We are a passionate and open-minded group of software enthusiasts, and together, we are global market leader in software intelligence. By providing actionable data on how applications are performing in real-time—for example, crash reporting, server-side tracking, root-cause analysis to name a few—our full-stack monitoring platform helps our customers anticipate and resolve their software issues. We have made it our mission to ensure that millions of people worldwide have an excellent user experience, made possible through a unique combination of observability, automation, and AI—all compacted into one cloud-based software intelligence platform.

The Core Platform is the heart of Dynatrace and serves multiple product purposes such as storing and analyzing observability data as well as frameworks that are used to build the different Dynatrace modules. The entire product is built on the Platform and relies on it. Hyperscale, lightning performance and delivery are key to the aspect you will deliver

In your future role

You will work on taking the Dynatrace Platform to the next level
You own parts of functional- and use case-based aspects of the product roadmap, represent the end user’s point of view, and strive for innovative solutions by answering the WHY and understanding the end user’s pain points.
As part of a larger team, you drive the product roadmap definition and our near-term and long-term product strategy.
You work together with our agile R&D teams to deliver product capabilities that WOW customers and create value-add that sells and impacts product adoption in a measurable fashion.
You manage cross-functional product initiatives with our customer support to excel in customer support situations, prevent escalations and “smooth sailing".
You partner with product marketing to develop targeted messaging, define go-to-market strategies and tactics, and enable the sales team.

Qualifications

Product management experience in a B2B environment, with prior success in setting product (back-up) strategy and executing it based on research, data, and industry trends as well as scaling and optimizing
Good technical understanding, work experience as a developer before, would be an advantage.
Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), SaaS, shared infrastructure, mass storage databases, and Web apps
Knowledge of privacy, scaling, and access control topics
Entrepreneurial mindset to understand the business goals and needs and you’re able to translate product strategy into business impact.
You can think big, but at the same time break things down into smaller components, and build high-level roadmaps from that
Clear sense of ownership and accountability, effective communication skills towards team, peers, and stakeholders alike, as well as a bias for action
Willingness to travel (< 15%)

Additional Information

What's in it for you?
A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side.
Attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.

Compensation And Rewards
We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 60,000 gross per year based on full-time employment. We offer a higher salary in line with qualifications and experience.

job_title: Software Architect Automotive DevOps and Virtual Validation f/m/d
job_description:
Job description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and customer value driven Software Architect with expertise in DevOps methodologies to join our team in the field of Virtual Validation. As a Software Architect, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing cutting-edge software solutions that enable virtual validation processes. You will be responsible for applying a business-driven architecture approach for our offering of DevOps infrastructure, toolchains, and processes, ensuring customer efficient software development, deployment, and continuous integration/delivery (CI/CD) for our virtual validation platforms. 
 Join our team and contribute to revolutionizing the virtual validation process by leveraging your expertise in DevOps and software architecture. Apply now and be part of an innovative and dynamic environment where your skills will have a significant impact on the development of cutting-edge virtual validation solutions.
  DevOps architecture design and development 
Support harmonization and standardization of DevOps components and products in business segment
Collaboration and coordination of cross-functional teams with focus on Software Defined Vehicle
Infrastructure management including cloud, virtualization and simulation environments
Security and compliance including vulnerability assessments and secure coding practices
Performance optimization for virtual validation platforms
Technical leadership to promote best practices, code quality and innovation in architecture and design
Research and evaluation of industry trends, technologies and tools in this field
 

Profile description:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field
At least three years of experience as a software architect:in or similar
Strong knowledge of DevOps practices, tools, and methodologies
Solid understanding of software development lifecycles, agile methodologies, and CI/CD pipelines, ideally from the embedded software world
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and related services
Proficiency with virtualization technologies and simulation environments
Familiarity with cybersecurity best practices and secure coding principles
Experience in virtual validation or related areas (e.g., simulation, testing) is a plus
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills and quick grasp of complex, technical concepts
Strong communication skills, very good integration with potential customers and cross-functional cooperation 
Willingness to travel (max. 20%)
Good command of English


We offer:

Homeoffice
Flexitime Regulation
Canteen
Award-winning Training Programs
Health Management
Parental Leave Management (Maternity/Paternity Protection & Educational Leave)
    Annual Remuneration: Due to the Austrian Equal Treatment Act we are obligated to state the annual gross remuneration (full-time) for this position as a basis for negotiation: €65,000.00. The Employee will be classified according to the Collective Agreement for Employees of Industry (Collective Bargaining Agreement of the Automotive Industry). We will, in any case, offer market-conforming payment taking qualifications and professional experience into account.
  Interested?
If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL!
  At AVL, we foster and celebrate diversity: We recognize that diverse ways of thinking are required to achieve our vision of a greener, safer, and better world of mobility. Different backgrounds, attitudes, interests, and experiences make us successful. As Equal Opportunity Employer we consider all qualified applicants without regard to ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation or disability status.

Consider Functional Safety Architectural Aspects
Ensures energy efficient design of the EE Architecture
Optimize cost, weight modularity and scalability

Strong previous experience with defining E/E Architecture for automotive software develop-ment projects
Expertise in control units from µC to SoCs

Understanding of automotive communication protocols

Understanding of Cyber Security incl. Impact on Components and Architecture
Understanding of automotive industry standards
Open minded for emerging and advanced technologies

Job Description

Automation Engineer (m/w/d) Assembly & Packaging, Schaftenau/Tirol, Österreich

Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:

Ihre Aufgaben sind unter anderem:
Abwicklung von technischen Erweiterungs- und Optimierungsprojekten an Automatisierungssystemen (Prozessleitsysteme sowie Package-Anlagen mit Steuerungen)
Technischer Experte bei übergeordneten Automatisierungssystemen wie Servern inkl. Virtueller Umgebungen und Applikationen, SCADA Systemem sowie den dazuhehörigen Datenbanken
Durchführung von technischen Klärungen bezüglich Reparaturen und Anlagenverbesserungen bei Spritzenmontagen & Verpackungslinien
Durchführung von Störungsbehebungen sowie Wartungs- und Reparaturarbeiten im Bereich Automation mit Fokus auf Verpackungsbereich
Anlagenoptimierung hinsichtlich Verfügbarkeit unter Berücksichtigung der Kosten
Schulung, Unterstützung und Unterweisung von Produktions- und externen Mitarbeitern
Erstellen und Umsetzen von Arbeitsaufträgen sowie Optimierung des LifeCycle der Systeme
GMP gerechte Dokumentation der Arbeiten und Unterstützung bei Behördeninspektionen, Audits sowie bei der CAPA Bearbeitung


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

Was Sie für die Position mitbringen:
Abgeschlossene Ausbildung (HTL, Meister, Dipl.-Ing. / M. Sc. / B. Sc.)
2-3 Jahre technische Erfahrung mit Automatisierungssystemen sowie exzellentes Projektmanagement und herausragendes technisches Wissen mit nachweislicher Fähigkeit, sichere, effektive und vollständig konforme Projekte / Lösungen zu liefern
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Erfahrung mit MS Office, SAP, einer Programmiersprache (z.B. C, C++, C#, Python, FBS, KOP, AWL) und mit der Konfiguration mindestens eines Prozessleitystems (z.B. Siemens PCS7, Emerson DeltaV, Allen-Bradley)


Warum Novartis?

236 Millionen - so viele Menschen haben wir mit unseren Produkten im Jahr 2022 erreicht. Darauf sind wir stolz. In einer Welt des digitalen und technologischen Wandels stellen wir uns die Frage: Wie können wir noch mehr Menschenleben verbessern und verlängern?

Wir sind überzeugt: neugierige und ambitionierte Menschen wie wir finden gemeinsam in einem inspirierenden Umfeld neue Antworten und treffen mutige Entscheidungen.

Stellen Sie sich vor, was Sie bei Novartis tun könnten!

Neben einem marktgerechten Grundgehalt bieten wir ein attraktives Bonus/Incentive Programm, eine moderne Firmenpension, Kinderbetreuungseinrichtungen, Aus- und Weiterbildungsprogramme und weltweite Karrieremöglichkeiten innerhalb der Novartis Gruppe. Das Grundgehalt für diese Position besteht aus dem kollektivvertraglichen Mindestgehalt in Höhe von € 54.735,38/Jahr (auf Vollzeitbasis) sowie einer allfälligen Überzahlung, basierend auf Ihren bisherigen Erfahrungen, Qualifikationen und individuellen Kompetenzen. Wir sind offen für Teilzeit und Jobsharing Modelle und unterstützen wo immer möglich flexibles arbeiten und Homeoffice

Engagement für Vielfalt und Inklusion:

Novartis setzt sich für Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion ein. Wir sind bestrebt, vielfältige Teams zusammenzustellen, die für die Patienten und Gemeinschaften repräsentativ sind, denen wir dienen. Wir bemühen uns um die Schaffung eines inklusiven Arbeitsplatzes, der durch Zusammenarbeit mutige Innovationen fördert und unsere Mitarbeiter in die Lage versetzt, ihr volles Potenzial zu entfalten.

Unsere Einstellungsentscheidungen basieren auf Chancengleichheit und der besten Qualifikation, ungeachtet von Geschlecht, Religion, Alter, Hautfarbe, Rasse, sexueller Orientierung, Nationalität oder Behinderung.

Unterstützungen für BewerberInnen mit Behinderungen:

Wenn Sie aufgrund einer Erkrankung, einer körperlichen Behinderung oder eines neurodiversen Zustandes eine Unterstützung bei unterschiedlichen Teilen des Rekrutierungsprozesses benötigen, wenden Sie sich bitte an disabilities.austria@novartis.com und teilen Sie uns die Art Ihrer Anfrage sowie Ihre Kontaktinformationen mit. Unsere Unterstützung umfasst die Beratung zu geeigneten Positionen sowie die Begleitung bei allen Phasen des Bewerbungsprozesses. Das österreichische Gesetz sieht die Möglichkeit vor, die örtliche Behindertenvertrauensperson (BVP) in das Bewerbungsverfahren einzubeziehen. Wenn Sie dies wünschen, teilen Sie uns dies bitte vorab als Vermerk in Ihrem Lebenslauf mit.

Treten Sie unserem Novartis Netzwerk bei:

wenn diese Position nicht zu Ihrer Erfahrung oder Ihren Karrierezielen passt, Sie aber dennoch mit uns in Kontakt bleiben möchten, um mehr über Novartis und unsere Karrieremöglichkeiten zu erfahren, dann treten Sie hier dem Novartis Netzwerk bei: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Über Atos

Atos ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter für die digitale Transformation mit 107.000 Mitarbeitern und einem Jahresumsatz von über 11 Milliarden Euro. Als europäischer Marktführer für Cybersecurity sowie Cloud und High Performance Computing bietet die Atos Gruppe maßgeschneiderte, ganzheitliche Lösungen für sämtliche Branchen in 71 Ländern. Als Pionier im Bereich nachhaltiger Dienstleistungen und Produkte arbeitet Atos für seine Kunden an sicheren, dekarbonisierten Digitaltechnologien. Atos ist eine SE (Societas Europaea) und an der internationalen Börse Euronext Paris sowie in den Aktienindizes CAC 40 ESG und CAC Next 20 notiert.

Das Ziel von Atos ist es, die Zukunft der Informationstechnologie mitzugestalten. Fachwissen und Services von Atos fördern Wissensentwicklung, Bildung sowie Forschung in einer multikulturellen Welt und tragen zu wissenschaftlicher und technologischer Exzellenz bei. Weltweit ermöglicht die Atos Gruppe ihren Kunden und Mitarbeitern sowie der Gesellschaft insgesamt, in einem sicheren Informationsraum nachhaltig zu leben, zu arbeiten und sich zu entwickeln.

Ihre Aufgaben

Unterstützung des Vertiebs bei Kundenterminen im Umfeld Daten-Plattformen im öffentlichen Umfeld – Smart Cities
Entwicklung open-source basierter Daten-Plattformen unter Nutzung von FIWARE Komponenten
Verantwortung für die Ausarbeitung neuer Lösungen und ihre Implementierung und Integration in die bestehende IT Architektur
Aufnahme, Analyse und Optimierung der vorhandenen Architekturen inklusive der implementierten Schnittstellen sowohl aus fachlicher als auch technischer Sicht
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Beratern, Projektmanagern und mit Ansprechpartnern im Vertrieb aus den verschiedensten Ländern

REST und JSON Entwicklung

Container und Cluster Technologien basierend auf Docker
Nice to have OpenStack, Orchestration via Kubernetes, Scrum/Agile Vorgehensmodelle, IoT Protokolle, NoSQL (MongoDB)
