job_title: Spezialist:in für KI, Machine Learning und Algorithmen
job_description:
myWarm ist ein GreenTech-Unternehmen mit Sitz in Wien (Zentrale), Berlin und Bozen. Seit 2010 steigern wir mit unserem 37-köpfigen Team die Energieeffizienz von Heizungsanlagen in Wohn- und Nichtwohngebäuden. Wir sind digitaler Vorreiter für einen automatisierten, temperaturbasierten hydraulischen Abgleich bis zu jeder Heizfläche. Unsere Kunden und das Klima freut’s, denn beiden sparen wir damit bis zu 35% Energie und Emissionen. In unseren Kundenkreis fallen zahlreiche namhafte Objekte wie der Friedrichstadtpalast Berlin, das Planetarium Hamburg oder die Wiener Hofburg.


Die Inhouse-Entwicklung der intelligenten myWarm-Hard- und Software zählt zu unseren Kernkompetenzen und ist einer der Gründe für unsere Technologieführerschaft. Mit der Erfahrung und dem Datenschatz aus hunderten optimierten Heizungsanlagen geht es nun darum, im Rahmen eines mehrjährigen, von der österreichischen Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft FFG geförderten Projekts die nächste Produktgeneration als Systemlösung zu entwickeln.


Du willst mithelfen, Heizsysteme in die digitale Zukunft zu führen? Du willst neue Maßstäbe in einer gefragten Branche mit besten Zukunftsaussichten setzen? Für unser Forschungs- und Entwicklungs-Team in Wien suchen wir ab sofort Unterstützung.



Spezialist:in für KI, Machine Learning und Algorithmen ab 30 h
Wien – Unbefristete Festanstellung, Vollzeit oder Teilzeit ab 30 Stunden



Deine Aufgaben
Verantwortliche Mitarbeit im FFG-Projekt für den Bereich KI, ML und Algorithmen
Mitarbeit in anderen nationalen und internationalen Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekten
Datamining und Aufbereitung nutzbarer Daten aus vergangenen und laufenden Optimierungen von Heizungsanlagen
Entwicklung von Verbesserungsvorschlägen und neuen Ansätzen für unsere Algorithmen, Analysepfade und Prozesse
Begleitung der Software-Entwicklung inklusive Anwendungs-Testing und Qualitätssicherung


Was du mitbringst
Fundierte technische oder naturwissenschaftliche Ausbildung (HTL, FH, Uni) und/oder nachweisliche Erfahrung im Bereich AI
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Artificial Intelligence (AI) bzw. Künstliche Intelligenz (KI), Machine Learning (ML) und Algorithmen
Hohes Systemverständnis von komplexen Anlagen und gute Analysefähigkeit
Erfahrung mit Python und MATLAB
Selbstständige, eigenverantwortliche und teamorientierte Arbeitsweise
Spaß daran, neue Wege zu beschreiten und Pionierarbeit zu leisten

Wünschenswert, aber kein Muss:
Erfahrung beim Erstellen von Pseudocodes
Affinität zu den gängigen Script-Sprachen
Praktische Erfahrung im Bereich Gebäudeleittechnik, Gebäudedigitalisierung oder HKL (z.B. hydraulische Anlagen)
Erfahrung im Bereich Gebäudeenergie und technischer Planung


Was wir bieten
Arbeiten beim Technologieführer für den hydraulischen Abgleich
Großzügige Gleitzeitregelungen
80% Remote Working möglich (Idealszenario: immer montags treffen wir uns im Büro)
Umfassende, individuelle Einarbeitung
Kontinuierliche interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Freie Wahl zwischen einem Apple Macbook oder einem Lenovo ThinkPad
Entwicklung in agilen Prozessen (Scrum)
Wertschätzendes Miteinander und angenehmes Arbeitsklima
Ein leistungsstarkes Spezialisten-Team voller Begeisterungsfähigkeit und Visionskraft
Ein klares Ja! zu einer offenen Fehlerkultur und Raum für Innovation
Flache Hierarchien und das „Du“ auf allen Ebenen
Ein Job mit Sinn in einer zukunftssicheren Branche
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Gratisticket der Wiener Linien oder Zuzahlung zum Klimaticket
Zentrale Lage am Naschmarkt mit bester öffentlicher Anbindung (U4)
Kostenfreie Getränke und Obst
Gemeinsame Events und Feste
KV-Mindestgehalt ab EUR 4.400,- brutto/Monat (Vollzeit), Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung, abhängig von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung

Die Wiener Stadtwerke sind mit über 16.000 Mitarbeiter*innen der bedeutendste Infrastrukturdienstleister für den Großraum Wien. Mit Innovationskraft und Erfahrung halten wir die Stadt am Laufen und machen sie klimafit für die Zukunft.

Unterstützung bei der Konzeption und Planung der Datenapplikationslandschaft der Wiener Stadtwerke Gruppe
Mitwirkung beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung der Wiener Stadtwerke Datenarchitektur
Erarbeitung von Strategie, Governance und Prinzipien für das Datenmanagement, Big Data und künstlicher Intelligenz
Mitarbeit in strategischen Projekten und schrittweise Übernahme von Pilotprojekten im Datenumfeld
Mithilfe beim Aufbau einer Enterprise Architektur, Gestaltung von Architekturprinzipien und Rahmenbedingungen im Datenkontext
Strukturierte Beobachtung von Veränderungen und Potenzialen relevanter technologischer Entwicklungen im Datenbereich

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit technischem Schwerpunkt (IT, Mathematik o.Ä.)
Mindestens 1 Jahr Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenarchitektur, Datenanalyse, Business Intelligence oder Data Engineering; erste Erfahrung im IT-Beratungsumfeld von Vorteil, aber kein Muss
Ausgeprägtes Interesse und Leidenschaft für neue Technologien
Strukturierte, analytische und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Sicheres Auftreten und Kommunikationsstärke auf unterschiedlichen Hierarchieebenen
Den Wunsch, gemeinsam mit der Wiener Stadtwerke Gruppe, Wien klimafit für die Zukunft zu machen

Wir setzen uns für Vielfalt, Inklusion und Chancengleichheit ein und suchen Menschen, die so vielfältig sind wie unsere Stadt! Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderungen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht. Des Weiteren streben wir eine Erhöhung des Frauenanteils in Leitungspositionen und in technischen Bereichen an und freuen uns besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen.

Das bieten wir Ihnen

Gehalt

Für diese Position bieten wir ein Mindestgehalt von EUR 3.912,23 brutto pro Monat, abhängig von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung, sowie die Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung.

Arbeitsmittel und Umfeld : Topmodernes Büro mit guter öffentlicher Anbindung, Duschen und Fahrradraum für Sportliche inklusive. State-of-the-art IT-Ausstattung und frei wählbares Firmenhandy.
Events und Aktivitäten : Von Sommerfest bis Punschstand – unterschiedlichste Gelegenheiten fürs Vernetzen und gemeinsam Feiern. Teilnahme am Wien Energie Business Run kostenlos.
Gesundheit und Vorsorge : Von gratis Vorsorgeuntersuchung und Mundhygiene bis Impf- und Blutspendeaktionen. Arbeitspsychologische Beratung und günstige private Gruppenkrankenversicherung - auch für die Familie.
Onboarding und Entwicklung : Ein Willkommenstag bringt die Wiener Stadtwerke-Gruppe und interessante Persönlichkeiten näher. Das Pat*innen-Programm erleichtert den Einstieg, Jobbörse und Förderangebote für die Karriere sowie Mentoringprogramme für Frauen.
Sonstiges : Ein Job mit Mehrwert - im Dienst einer großartigen Stadt und ihrer Menschen. Gemeinsam halten wir Wien am Laufen und machen die Stadt klimafit für die Zukunft.
Speisen und Getränke : Kantine „Kuchl“ sorgt wochentags für kulinarische Abwechslung zu gestützten, günstigen Preisen. Dazu gibt es Kaffee, Tee und Obstkorb – gratis.
Vergünstigungen : Unter wstw.corplife.at wöchentlich neue und vielfältige Freizeitangebote, günstige Konditionen in Partnergeschäften, Zuschüsse für Freizeit-, Sport- und Gesundheitsangebote.
Work-Life Balance : 37,5 h Normalarbeitszeit, Gleitzeitvereinbarung und Home-Office, Einarbeitungstage und Sonderurlaube – hier lassen sich Arbeit und Privatleben gut miteinander verbinden.

job_title: Praktikum Brand Marketing Red Bull Österreich
job_description:
Als Unterstützung unseres Brand Marketing Teams suchen wir dich für einen Zeitraum von 6 Monaten (Februar - Juli 2024).

Entsprechend unserer Company Mission “Giving Wiiings to People and Ideas” ist es unser Ziel, Menschen für die Marke Red Bull zu begeistern, den Mehrwert unseres Produktes aufzuzeigen und Konsumenten in persönlich relevanten Situationen Flüüügel zu verleihen.

Persönliche Stärken einsetzen

Verantwortungsbereiche und Aufgaben, in denen etwas bewegt werden kann:

STRATEGISCHE KAMPAGNENPLANUNG

Während deines Praktikums wirst du in der strategischen Planung und Ausführung diverser Brand Kampagnen für den Red Bull Energy Drink sowie die ORGANICS by Red Bull mitwirken. Dabei handelt es sich sowohl um Launch-Kampagnen für neue Produkte als auch um Kampagnen für bestehende Produkte, um die Funktionalität dieser in verschiedenen, für Konsumenten relevanten Situationen zu kommunizieren.

KAMPAGNEN AUSWERTUNG

Darüber hinaus wirst du bei der Kampagnen Auswertung und dem Verfassen von Reportings unterstützen. Zusätzlich bist du bei der Gewinnabwicklung nach Abschluss von Kampagnen (Organisation von Red Bull Experiences und Incentive Versendungen) involviert.

KOOPERATIONEN STARTUP UND INNOVATION

Als Praktikant im Brand Marketing Team wirst du einen Teil der Kooperationen mit Partnern aus dem Startup und Innovation Bereich koordinieren und den Auftritt der Marke Red Bull auf entsprechenden Events maßgeblich mitgestalten. Dies umfasst auch die Abwicklung vor Ort, wodurch du die Möglichkeit hast verschiedene Startup und Innnovation Festivals innerhalb Österreichs zu besuchen.

Hier zählen Erfahrung und bisher erbrachte Leistungen

Für die Rolle relevant:

Laufendes oder abgeschlossenes Studium an einer Universität/FH im Bereich Marketing, Medien, Kommunikation (mindestens im 2. Semester).
Sehr gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift).
Sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse.
Grundlegende Marketing und Kommunikationskenntnisse.
Erste Erfahrungen in der Kampagnen Planung, im Bereich Digital Advertising, Social Media Nutzung, und im Projektmanagement von Vorteil.
Persönlichkeit: organisiert, verlässlich, eigenständig, strukturiert und proaktiv.
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Sozialkompetenz.

Als Arbeitgeber schätzen wir Diversität und unterstützen Menschen ihre Potenziale und Stärken zu entfalten, ihre Ideen zu verwirklichen und Chancen zu ergreifen. Passioniert glauben wir daran, dass Diversität unter Kollegen ein zentrales Element unseres Erfolgs ist. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen aller Menschen gleichermaßen, unabhängig von Alter, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung oder Herkunft.

Aus gesetzlichen Gründen sind wir verpflichtet darauf hinzuweisen, dass das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt für diese Position bei monatlich € 1.930 brutto liegt.

Job Description

Principal Automation Engineer (f/m/d), Novartis, Schaftenau, Austria

300 Million. This is the number of people worldwide who are suffering from autoimmune diseases and who would benefit from less expensive medication. As member of the BioFuture Program Team you are working within a network of innovative Pilot and Manufacturing Plants in order to manufacture complex biological molecules in a faster, more flexible and more cost-efficient manner

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Elaborate the strategy for further expanding, optimizing and integrating the manufacturing execution system (MES) as part of the overall BioFuture program.
Manage project teams to implement modifications to the MES according to program/strategy in collaboration with automation team from manufacturing plant and development partners in a complex production environment. Provide direct input as automation subject matter expert to guide implementation, qualification and testing of software.
Manage the development of interfaces to other site systems, e.g. SAP, distributed control system (DCS) and Laboratory Systems.
Define and improve business processes within program/network and their integration with GMP manufacturing site operations. Lead future improvement initiatives.
Support automation knowledge exchanges across network, system governance meetings and manage issues, work-around and fixes identified.
Contribute to further establish the program team, with special focus on automation branches, within the Drug Substance manufacturing network. Ensure a future-oriented and highly automated new production concept by supporting solid transitions from project statuses to stable Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) operations


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:

Essential:
Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
5+ years of relevant working experience in MES development (design), configuration and implementation. Experience with DCS is beneficial
Experience in a food, drug or medical devices regulated industry required
Experience with GMP, equipment qualification and knowledge in computerized system validation (CSV) are beneficial
Experience in implementation and qualification of a MES, preferably in the context of a large-scale biotechnology project is beneficial.
Specific knowledge in Syncade, DeltaV, SQL and Visual Basic are beneficial
Languages: Fluent English, German skills beneficial
Team player with good leadership skills and a positive attitude and ability to motivate others.
Results driven, flexible to achieve the desired outcome.
Technical writing skills


Why Novartis?

769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.

We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!

In addition to a market-competitive base salary, we offer an attractive incentive program, a modern company pension scheme, childcare facilities, learning and development options as well as worldwide career opportunities within the Novartis group. In accordance with Austrian law, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary as stated in the collective bargaining agreement. For this position the minimum salary is € 73.112/year (on a full time basis). The actual salary will be significantly higher, as we strive to maintain a competitive position in the market and consider your previous experience, qualifications and individual competencies.

We are open for part-time and job sharing models and support flexible and remote working where possible.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse team’s representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Our recruitment decisions are based on selecting the best person for the job, regardless of gender, religion, age, colour, race, sexual orientation, nationality or disability.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

job_title: Technical Analyst with IT Architecture Skills (all genders)
job_description:
Direct message the job poster from Erste Digital
Timur Teksoy
IT Recruiting & Talent Scout at Erste Group Bank AG | Self-employed photographer
With top notch technology, we drive the realization offers the Group’s vision: To provide human banking in digital times, and to build Financial Health for over 16 million customers in the CEE region. We aim to attract and develop the best talent and aspire to be an IT employer beyond compare.

We are Erste Digital. We are #digitaltotheheart

Erste Digitals department "Rating & Loan Decisions" (RLD) is responsible for IT solutions covering customer ratings and loan decisions for the entire Erste Group. The department manages the whole project lifecycle (requirement analysis, technical analysis and solution design, development, factory and customer testing) and handles as well operational tasks related to the solutions in its area of competence.
To be prepared for the upcoming projects in Risk Management environment, RLD is looking for a Technical Analyst to strengthen the existing product team.


What to do:

Modernize one of our main IT solutions, contributing a good understanding in technology trends and concepts to design flexible, dynamic, and efficient solutions for our business partners
Redesign solution components and be the sparring partner for our developers
Define software requirement specifications and attend review meetings with colleagues in Risk Management from various entities
Review functional designs regarding solution architecture, future business needs and expectations
Cover operational tasks, analyze functional defects in the systems and find solutions for bug fixing


You check these boxes:

Think integrated and strategically and develop comprehensive, detailed specifications
Are familiar with REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, CSV APIs, design notifications like UML and have a structured approach to analysis and documentation
Ideally understand technical requirements for container platform and cloud hosting

Direct message the job poster from Sentry (sentry.io)
Brandon Baca
Brandon Baca
{head hunter searching for developers to join the fight against bad software} 👾
About Sentry
Bad software is everywhere, and we’re tired of it. Sentry is on a mission to help developers write better software faster, so we can get back to enjoying technology.
With more than $217 million in funding and 85,000 organizations that believe we’re on to something, we're building performance and error monitoring tools that help companies like Disney, Microsoft, and Atlassian spend less time fixing bugs and more time building products. If you like to selfishly build things that make your digital life better, come help us build the next generation of software monitoring tools.

About the role
As a Senior Software Engineer in the Processing team at Sentry, you will play a pivotal role in a cross-functional team dedicated to ensuring the smooth operation of Sentry's client-facing systems. Your primary responsibility will be designing, enhancing, and maintaining our event processing pipeline.

In this role, you'll have the exciting opportunity to influence the design and improvement of both our external and internal services, while also contributing to the creation of essential software that drives Sentry's mission.
If you're passionate about developing and enhancing features that empower software development teams to excel and are excited about the prospect of contributing to open source projects, then this position is tailor-made for you. Join us in making a difference in the world of software development.

In this role you will
Develop horizontally scalable and globally distributed infrastructure that delivers mission-critical data from customer applications to Sentry
Work in the Processing team to improve and evolve our processing pipeline and the services we use to scale Sentry
Puzzle over unique challenges in the fields of distributed systems, performance optimization, high-performance data processing pipelines
Use a variety of programming languages, systems, and technologies to solve problems related to mission-critical software of Sentry (mostly Rust and Python)
Collaborate with Infrastructure and Operations teams to build solutions that scale (we process over a billion events every day)
Write unit and integration tests that ensure the correctness of your work, as well as strong documentation to help educate both peers and customers

You’ll love this job if you
Take challenges that you don't see every day, daily
Care about writing highly performant, high-quality code
Want to build a product by developers for developers
Get excited about joining a modern software development team that iterates and ships code rapidly
Want to contribute to open source full-time — our product is entirely Open Source
Enjoy working in an agile team of engineers who push themselves and others to do better

Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience
Experience in solving complex problems by developing high-quality, high-performance software
Proficiency in Python
Experience working with distributed systems and streaming / queuing platforms (e.g. Kafka, Celery)
Familiarity with databases, both relational and NoSQL, for data storage and retrieval within the pipeline
Bonus points for experience with native languages including Rust, C++, Go
Good written and spoken English communication skills
Live in the Vienna, Austria area or are willing to relocate

We are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 52,220,-- gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement (IT-KV). The salary that Sentry offers you is adjusted to the current market situation and our starting point is EUR 85,000-- gross per year. A successful candidate’s actual base salary (or hourly wage) amount will be determined by a variety of relevant factors including, without limitation, the candidate’s work location, education, work and other relevant experience, skills, and job-related knowledge. A successful candidate will be eligible to participate in Sentry’s employee benefit plans/programs applicable to the candidate’s position (including incentive compensation, equity grants, paid time off, and group health insurance coverage). See Sentry Benefits for more details about the Company’s benefit plans/programs.

Equal Opportunity at Sentry
Sentry is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to its employees and candidates for employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or other legally-protected characteristic. This commitment includes the provision of reasonable accommodations to employees and candidates for employment with physical or mental disabilities who require such accommodations in order to (a) perform the essential functions of their jobs, or (b) seek employment with Sentry. We strive to build a diverse team, with an inclusive culture where every teammate can thrive. Sentry is an open-source company because we believe that everyone, everywhere, should have the ability and tools to make great software. Software should be accessible. That starts with making our industry accessible.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recops@sentry.io.

Arbeiten bei COSMO CONSULT ist anders.

Entdecke unser Universum und lasse Dich von der positiven Energie der COSMOnaut*innen anstecken.

Gestalte die Zukunft von und mit Menschen und wachse mit uns gemeinsam.

Erlebe echte Wertschätzung in einem sicheren Umfeld voll Leidenschaft und Innovation - ganz unabhängig davon, wann und von wo aus Du arbeiten möchtest.

Werde Teil des Teams und gehöre zu einem der weltweit führenden Microsoft-Partner für Unternehmenstransformation und Digitalisierung.

Lebe Deinen Job anders - bewirb Dich bei uns als

Project Manager (w|m|d)

Das macht Dich anders.

Wir sind auf einer Wellenlänge, wenn Du:


smarte Entscheidungen triffst. Du musst nicht immer die richtigen Entscheidungen treffen, aber immer mit bestem Gewissen gegenüber unseren Kunden, Kolleg*innen und COSMO entscheiden.
den Menschen bei all Deinen Überlegungen in den Mittelpunkt stellst. Du achtest auf die Bedürfnisse aller Menschen und agierst mit Empathie und Mitgefühl.
Verantwortung übernimmst. Du bist achtsam gegenüber Dir und Deinen Mitmenschen. Auf Dich kann man sich auch über Deinen Aufgabenbereich hinaus verlassen.
uns dabei unterstützt, großartige Teams zu bilden. Alle für Dich und Du für alle - gemeinsam stärker sein. Du machst den Unterschied in Deinem Team.
immer Dein Bestes gibst. Du musst nicht der oder die Beste sein, aber aus tiefstem Respekt gegenüber Dir und Deinem Umfeld immer das Bestmögliche geben.
den Mut hast zu wachsen. Du denkst nicht in Herausforderungen, sondern in Möglichkeiten. Du liebst es, Dich weiter zu entwickeln, suchst nach neuen Ideen und bringst diese aktiv ein.
Dinge mit Leidenschaft tust. Du weißt, was Dich antreibt und begeistert, lebst Deine Leidenschaft, inspirierst dadurch Dein Umfeld, hast mehr Spaß an Deiner Arbeit und bist erfolgreicher.

Deine Persönlichkeit und Motivation ist das, was Dich ausmacht.

Daher nehmen wir uns die Zeit und schauen alle Bewerbungen individuell durch.

Lebe Deine Aufgaben anders*.

*spannend. Du planst und steuerst abwechslungsreiche Projekte, um die Arbeitswelten von Menschen zu verbessern und Unternehmen zu digitalen Gewinnern zu machen.
*erfahren. Du überzeugst mit Deiner umfangreichen Erfahrung in dieser oder verwandten Rolle aus erfolgreich eingeführten sowie komplexen Business Software/APP Projekten, wie ERP oder CRM (z.B. Microsoft Dynamics 365 FSCM, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Infor, proAlpha, Salesforce, SAP/HANA, o.ä.).
*kreativ. Du setzt agile Projektmethoden ein und entwickelst Deine Vorgehensweise je nach Situation weiter. Hierbei nutzt Du Kundenfeedback und schlägst auch neue Wege ein.
*inspirierend. Du inspirierst unsere Partner mit überzeugender und verhandlungssicherer Moderation, Methodenkenntniss, Präsentation und Produktkenntnis.
*engagiert. Du kümmerst Dich darum, dass am Ende des Tages Qualität, Kosten und zeitlicher Ablauf stimmen und alle begeistert sind.
*verantwortungsvoll. Als Aufgaben-, Change Request- und Risikomanager*in organisierst Du den Projektverlauf und hast das Ruder - auch bei Wellengang - fest in der Hand.
*transparent. Mit den von Dir erstellten Dokumentationen und Statusberichten sorgst Du für eine nachhaltige Kommunikation.
*international. Du hast sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und Spaß daran, Dich in englischer Sprache mit internationalen Kollegen auszutauschen und auch mal einen Workshop auf Englisch zu leiten.

Wir können auch anders.

Das macht uns aus:

Bei uns sind alle Teil des Teams - Deine Stimme ist gefragt, selbst wenn es um unsere eigene Unternehmensentwicklung geht.
Uns ist wichtig, dass Du Dich wertgeschätzt und unterstützt fühlst.
Ortsunabhängiges und flexibles Arbeiten ist für uns selbstverständlich.
Internationale Zusammenarbeit ist bei uns daily business - entdecke andere Kulturen und neue Welten.
Ein sicheres und positives Arbeitsumfeld hat für uns oberste Priorität.
Wir haben Transformation im Blut - wir bleiben nicht stehen.
Deine Weiterentwicklung gemeinsam mit Dir zu gestalten liegt uns am Herzen.
Bei uns sind vielfältige und ungewöhnliche Karrieren möglich.
Wir nehmen unsere Verantwortung gegenüber Mensch und Umwelt ernst.

Wir freuen uns darauf Dich kennenzulernen!

PS: Benefits wie Gesundheitsmanagement, Unfallversicherung, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, JobTicket und COSMO Events sind nur einige Beispiele aus unserem Mitarbeiter*innenangebot.

Aus gesetzlichen Gründen weisen wir darauf hin, dass das kollektivvertragliche, monatliche Mindestgehalt für diese Position € 3.610,- brutto (Vollzeit) beträgt. Unsere tatsächlichen Gehaltspakete orientieren sich an aktuellen Marktgehältern und berücksichtigen selbstverständlich Deine Qualifikation und Erfahrung.

Du möchtest Teil des Teams werden?

Dann bewirb Dich mit Deinen aussagefähigen Bewerbungsunterlagen und Deinem frühestmöglichen Eintrittsdatum direkt online.

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

For our R&D Team in Sankt Valentin (near Linz), we are looking for a Sr. Research Engineer - ADAS Perception (m/f/d).

As a key member of the Advanced Autonomy team, you are responsible for perception and sensing for autonomous driving applications. You focus on developing algorithms that cover the SENSE part of an ADAS system using classic and AI based models (perception, behavior, environment, ...) utilizing real world data and simulation generated data.

In addition, you support the R&D team with technical evaluation of technologies being considered by Magna.

Your Tasks

Evaluation of technologies and product designs with compliance to scientific principles, engineer-ing principles, company standards, customer requirements and related specifications
Support the development of innovative components and modules from the initial concept phase through the complete development process including design engineering, validation, proto-typing, testing, and evaluation of the proposed production capable process and business case
Design and conduct research programs; applying theory and principles of mechanics, thermody-namics, hydraulics, electronics, heat transfer and materials
Support the ideation process while identifying gaps in the current product or manufacturing technology to guide and provide future R&D efforts
Analyze engineering results and propose product changes to determine feasibility, improve-ment of components and systems and functional/performance specifications
Correlate experimental data to simulation data
Maintain innovation project schedule by monitoring project progress, co-coordinate activities, calculating time requirements, sequencing project elements and resolving problems
Specify requests and coordinate all sub-contracted work (i.e. S/W development, prototyping, validation, testing) and assures timely completion

Your Profile

Strong experience in embedded software development in a technology area related to ADAS or Autonomous Driving, Robotics, or similar combination of education/experience.
Previous background from research, Automotive OEM, Tier-1 or autonomous driving companies.
Proficient in programming in C/C++, Matlab/Simulink, etc.
Proficient in programming python, opencv, scientific packages.
Proficient in machine vision (classic an AI driven)
Proficient in handling training and validation data, segmentation, and annotation process
Proficient in sensor fusion and statistics

We offer

Unique chance to apply science on automotive industry
Possibilities for creativity and room for own ideas
Corporate culture defined by innovation, involvement, and teamwork
Long-term perspectives in an international company
Attractive framework conditions for further training
Profit participation in the company's success
Home office options and flexible working hours
Employee and Family Assistance Program (childcare, health promotion, leisure and sports activities, benefits in everyday life)

The minimum annual remuneration package for this position is EUR 60.000,- with corresponding qualification. The actual salary is higher and depends on your education and specific work experience.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Apply on-line to join our talented R&D team and help Magna to stay ahead of the industry.

job_title: Project Manager, Central AME, Next Drive EU
job_description:
Gruppenbeschreibung

Fortschritt in der Mobilität ist für uns nicht nur ein Schlagwort. Wir bei Magna Powertrain arbeiten täglich an Technologien, Systemen und Konzepten, die Fahrzeuge sicherer, sauberer, komfortabler machen und gleichzeitig für Fahrvergnügen stehen. Als ein führender Anbieter in der globalen Automobilindustrie bieten wir Lösungen für konventionelle, hybride und rein elektrische Fahrzeuge. Unser Name steht für Qualität, Umweltbewusstsein und Sicherheit. Unser Herz schlägt für eine neue Welt der Mobilität. Passt das zu dir? Dann komm zu Magna Powertrain, um mit uns die Grenzen deiner Vorstellungskraft zu erweitern und gemeinsam die Zukunft der Mobilität zu gestalten.

Das erwartet dich

Als Project Manager im Bereich Central Advanced Manufacturing bist du für die Industrialisierungsplanung von elektrischen Antriebssystemen verantwortlich. Du leitest in der Aquisitions- und Serienentwicklungsphase ein globales Team aus Fertigungsingenieuren-, Montage-, Logistik-, Infrastruktur-, Layout- und Gebinde-Planern und übergibst das Projekt in der Realisierungsphase an das lokale Launch Management. Unter anderem fallen folgende Aufgaben in deinen Tätigkeitsbereich:

Planung und Koordination der Produktions- und Montageumfänge von der Kundenanfrage bis zum Serienanlauf nach konzerninternen Standards und Qualitätsrichtlinien
Optimale Gestaltung der Produktkosten für E-Drive Systeme in der Akquisitions- und Konzeptphase (Design to Cost)
Durchführung von Herstellbarkeitsstudien zur Prüfung der Machbarkeit (Design for Manufacturing and Assembly)
Festlegung der Eigenfertigungsumfänge auf Basis von Strategie, Kosten und technologischen Aspekten
Ermittlung von produktspezifischen Kalkulationsdaten (Herstellkosten, Werkzeugkosten, Investitionskosten, Planungs- und Anlaufkosten, Terminpläne) zur wettbewerbsfähigen Preisbildung neuer und laufender Projekte
Kapazitätsplanung für Equipment und Infrastruktur in Abstimmung mit den globalen Produktionswerken
Einbindung neuer Fertigungstechnologien und Begleitung bis zu Serienreife

Das bringst du mit

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung an einer TU/FH (Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen o.ä.) oder HTL mit mehrjähriger einschlägiger Berufserfahrung
Idealerweise decken deine Interessen oder Erfahrungen sowohl mechanisches als auch elektrotechnisches Know-How ab
Erfahrung in der Planung und Industrialisierung von herkömmlichen und/oder Elektro-Antrieben von Vorteil
Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse von Produktionstechniken
Projektleitungserfahrung wünschenswert
Erfahrung in der Montageplanung sowie Mechatronik-Kenntnisse von Vorteil
Teamplayer, Kommunikations- und Organisationsgeschick, Belastbarkeit, Termintreue, hohe Ziel- und Lösungsorientierung
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Globale Reisebereitschaft

Das bieten wir

Bei uns wird die DU-Kultur sowie flache Hierarchien gelebt. Nach Beginn eines umfangreichen und strukturierten Onboarding-Systems, wo dir ein Pate zur Seite steht, bist du direkt an der Entwicklung, dem Design und der Fertigung der weltweit fortschrittlichsten (Elektro-) Mobilitätstechnologien beteiligt. Es erwarten dich spannende Aufgaben und neue Herausforderungen in einem dynamischen und motivierten Team.

Darüber hinaus bieten wir dir nachstehende Benefits:

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Mobile Work
Gesundheitsprogramme, Sport- und Teamevents
Ein umfangreiches Weiterbildungsprogramm und spannende, interne Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Kantine oder Essensgutscheine
Magna-Mitarbeiter-Gewinnbeteiligungen
Diverse Vergünstigungen über den Betriebsrat

Einsatz und Qualifikation zahlen sich bei uns aus: durch überkollektivvertragliche Bezahlung ab € 60.000 brutto pro Jahr (Basis: 38,5 Wochenstunden) und vor allem durch das unglaublich gute Gefühl, bei Magna Powertrain durch dein Talent und deiner Persönlichkeit Großes zu schaffen.

Zusatzinformationen

Stundenausmaß: Vollzeit

Standort: Jede Magna Powertrain Location in Österreich oder Deutschland wäre möglich

Bewerbungsfrist: keine (der Beste Zeitpunkt ist jetzt)

Start: ehestmöglich

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams! Wir freuen uns auf deine Online-Bewerbung.

Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich online über unser Magna Karriereportal. Aufgrund der Datenschutzgrundverordnung und um deine Daten ausreichend zu schützen, können wir keine Bewerbungen per Email entgegennehmen. Zusätzlich können wir dir auf diese Weise schneller antworten oder dich zu einem Gespräch einladen.

Direct message the job poster from REWE International AG
Zuzana Minarčíková
Technical and IT Sourcer Expert @ REWE International AG
As a Solution Architect, you are co-responsible for the overall technical architecture of our software stack.
You create the architectural frame for the ongoing modernization of our systems. In particular, you consider the definition and further development of non-functional requirements.
You collaborate closely with the product owners and the agile, cross-functional development teams.
You advise the implementation teams on technology, design standards, tools and documentation and together you develop future-proof solutions.
You introduce new technologies into our solution stack.
In coordination with the central enterprise architecture, you support the development and optimization of development guidelines including architecture specifications, quality assurance and documentation specifications.
You support the creation of cost and effort estimates.
You are the first technical contact person and resolve technical dependencies to other teams.
You support the teams in recruiting new developers and related roles.

Qualifications

You have many years of professional experience as a solution software, enterprise architect or in a comparable function.

Location: Vienna, Austria

Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.

In Austria customers in rail transportation, air traffic, cybersecurity and defence missions rely on Thales. Additionally, our expertise in signalling gives people and goods in Central and Eastern European markets, like Hungary, Bulgaria, Slovakia, the Czech Republic, Slovenia, Macedonia, Croatia, Serbia and Albania, the connected journey they deserve. No matter how challenging the project, our 400 employees in Vienna stay by our customer’s side until the job is done – whatever it takes.

DevOps Engineer (f/m/x)

As part of an international platform team inside the product development team for route control you are responsible for providing state-of-the-art development and deployment environments, supporting application design and modernization towards cloud ready and reusable components, integrating CI/CD best practices in project tool chains and coordinating DevOps methods used in different products in order to allow efficient execution of engineering projects. If you want to have an impact on the future of green railway transportation, then join Thales in Austria!

Your CHALLENGE

Feature development for generic cloud-native platform stack
Support application development teams in platform stack integration and application deployments
Support development teams in build, test, release and deployment automation (CI/CD)
Support operational teams in site reliability engineering issues
Working in a world-wide international team and in cooperation with other business line units
Collaboration in a distributed agile team

Your PROFILE

Completed technical education (HTL, FH, Uni) in computer science, software engineering or similar
At least 3 years experiences in modern software development frameworks (e.g. Spring Boot, Quarkus) and very good understanding of state-of-the-art software engineering practices like “12 factor apps”.
Experience in public and/or private cloud environments (AWS, Azure, OpenStack) and container technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift
Experiences with LINUX system administration
Experience with state-of-the art CI/CD pipelines and principles highly welcome
Knowledge of cybersecurity standards are highly welcome
Experience with working in an international context (multi-unit/multi-site) and agile methodology is beneficial
Fluency in English and a good level of German
Innovative, adaptable and customer-oriented team player

We OFFER

The salary for this position ranges from € 58.000 to € 70.000 gross p.a. Actual compensation is based on experience and qualification and can exceed the mentioned range.
Challenging, innovative, long-term projects in a worldwide acting group offering various internal development opportunities
Great accessibility by public transport and various benefits like flexible working time with generous home office policy, on-site canteen with company subsidy and Wiener Linien Yearly Ticket.
Support for further education and development

Who we are

Together, we are shaping the world around us to build the future – here and now! Our experts’ competences and cultural backgrounds are unique in their diversity. Passion for innovations and cutting-edge technologies is our motivation. With 83,000 employees in 68 countries we create tomorrow’s key technologies today.

In the railway area, Thales experts architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. 72,000 kms of route and 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems.

As part of a global technology leader, Thales in Austria delivers key technologies in rail transportation, air traffic, digital identity & security and defence missions tailored to local needs with 400 people based in Vienna. With its unique combination of technology leadership, creativity and employee engagement, Thales in Austria has a key role to play in the digital transformation of its customers.

Whatever your role will be at Thales, your work will make a difference.

Thales in Austria is committed to equality and diversity.

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

job_title: IT Business Intelligence Solution Consultant BI/DWH/Datalake
job_description:
Take your next career step at B&R – a member of the ABB Group – with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations.

Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Join the automation team at B&R- a member of the ABB Group.

Do you have experience with the design and implementation of BI solutions? You are familiar with Power BI, SAP Data Warehouse or Snowflake? You understand the requirements from the business and want to actively design and continuously optimize IT tools and processes?

Sounds exactly like your dream job? JOIN THE AUTOMATION TEAM - and start your career in our IT team now!

Your responsibilities
Design, setup, and further development of our BI systems (Power BI, SAP BW, Snowflake)
Design of ETL processes and modeling of data warehouse scenarios
Provide guidance for key users from business
Requirement analysis and design of state-of-the-art IT solutions
Customizing and implementation of the designed architectures
Coordination of external partners and developers
Maintenance, support (2nd level) and ongoing optimization of our IT applications
Collaboration in projects
Your background
Business management and/or information technology education
Professional experience in the area Reporting, Datawarehouse- or Datalike systems
Strong analytical skills and a goal-oriented approach to work
High level of commitment and initiative
Enjoy developing high-quality IT solutions
Programming or database knowledge (SQL/OLAP) an advantage, but not a prerequisite
Very good English language skills, German language skills are an advantage
More about us

At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, you can expect an exciting and challenging job with an individually tailored introductory training. You will work in agile teams where you have the opportunity to actively contribute and drive ideas forward. Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life balance.

Our unique B&R spirit is characterized by appreciation, communication at eye level and an informal work culture. We offer you customized training and development programs as well as exciting development opportunities within the company. Numerous other B&R benefits (Parental Leave Program, Employee Assistance Program and many more) round off our offer.

In order to comply with legal regulations, we refer to the minimum salary of the collective agreement of the electrical and electronics industry of € 3 409,59 gross/month. There is a clear willingness to overpay, depending on qualifications and experience.

ABB's Machine Automation Division, also known to our customers as B&R, is an innovative automation company headquartered in Austria with additional offices around the world. B&R became part of ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division in 2017 and, together with the ABB Robotics division, employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries.

As a leading global provider of automation solutions, B&R develops, produces and sells industrial electronics, software solutions and mechatronic solutions as well as technologies for machine and factory automation. Since 2020, B&R's automation portfolio has also included Codian brand delta robots. With its innovative solutions, B&R sets new standards and consistently exceeds its customers' expectations.

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Job Description

Administer and manage SaaS applications.
Leverage the Dynatrace platform to analyze infrastructure issues, identify root causes, and implement best practices to prevent recurrence.
Use your insights into production to translate manual tasks into automated processes.
Work with software architects and developers to design and implement cloud solutions.
Maintain appropriate controls and documentation to support compliance initiatives.
Drive innovation through the ongoing evaluation, design, and implementation of new technology.

Qualifications

Hands-on experience in SRE practices, building, managing, and operating distributed systems
2+ years of experience with at least one Hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.

Als Full Stack Entwickler*in verantwortest Du die Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Web-Applikationen in C#/.NET und/oder Java sowie modernen Frontend-Frameworks basierend auf JavaScript bzw. TypeScript.
Du besprichst die Anforderungen und Zielsetzungen mit dem Produktmanagement (Product Owner und Business Analyst*innen) und tauschst Dich mit Deinen Teammitgliedern und/oder internen Stakeholdern aus.

Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt IT (HTL, FH, TU) oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen.

Routiniert im Umgang mit Versionskontrollsystemen (Git).

Affinität zum Schreiben von wartbarem, testbarem und sauberem Code.
Selbstorganisierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Langfristige, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit bei einem verlässlichen Arbeitgeber in einem kollegialen Team

Job Description

Scientist MS&T (m/w/d), Kundl, Tyrol, Austria

About the Role:

40! That is the number of years of experience that Novartis has in Biotech production, offering a growing product portfolio and exploiting new future key technologies such as mRNA and pDNA manufacturing. Now we want to continue our success story and become one of the leading CDMO business partners worldwide. Please be invited to join the Manufacturing Science and Technology team in Kundl as Scientist MS&T (m/f/d) with a strong background in up-stream process development and take the opportunity to broaden your professional excellence while contributing to a better world for patients worldwide.

Key Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Independently plan, organize, perform, and document scientific experiments for the development, implementation, optimization, and transfer of up-stream processes development under minimal supervision
Take over responsibility for and utilize special tools/equipment or specialized facilities as an expert; schedule and perform maintenance and qualification of instruments/equipment
Proactively identify conflict situations and contribute with empathy to solutions
Work according to appropriate standards for quality, ethics, health, safety, environment protection, and information security; lead initiatives to ensure continuous improvement
Documentation of raw data, evaluation, and interpretation of results; propose and actively support the design of next experiments
Review and verify raw data generated by others (e.g. DI checks)
Write protocols, scientific reports or laboratory procedures based on templates or SOPs under minimal supervision
Recognize, communicate, address and solve problems (e.g. deviations and unexpected results from experiments) within own and broader area of responsibility; actively transfer know-how to other departments or external contractors, including troubleshooting and on-site training


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum Requirements

Essential Requirements:
Master of Science with 1 year of relevant experience or Bachelor of Science with 3 years relevant experience or Apprenticeship in industry (or equivalent technical education) with 6 years relevant experience
Awareness for safe handling of chemicals, potentially dangerous materials, and equipment
Good theoretical and scientific knowledge in the relevant area of expertise
Proficient with laboratory and/or technical equipment
Good knowledge of software and computer tools
Good documentation and presentation skills
Basic scientific/technical writing skills


Why Novartis?

Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

You’ll receive:

You can find everything you need to know about our benefits and rewards in the Novartis Life Handbook. https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

In addition to a market-competitive base salary, we offer an attractive incentive program, a modern company pension scheme, childcare facilities, learning and development opportunities as well as worldwide career possibilities within the Novartis group. In accordance with Austrian law, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary as stated in the collective bargaining agreement. For this position the minimum salary is €54,735.38 per year (on a full-time basis). We also offer a potential market oriented excess payment in line with your experience and qualifications

Adjustments for Applicants with Disabilities:

If because of a medical condition, physical disability or a neurodiverse condition you require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please reach out to disabilities.austria@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request as well as your contact information. The support which we can provide will include advice on suitable positions as well as guidance at all stages of the application process. Austrian law provides candidates the opportunity to involve the local disability representative, Behindertenvertrauensperson (BVP), in the application process. If you would like to request this, please let us know in advance as a note on your CV.

Join our Novartis Network:

If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

About Us In Austria

With about 300 Tietoevry experts and offices in Vienna, Linz and Graz, Tietoevry Austria is committed to develop enterprises and society through IT by realizing new opportunities in customer’s business transformation. We believe in professional development and results by supporting our customers on their journey into a meaningful digital world.

Our development and consulting portfolio ranges from Cloud and Data Driven Solutions to Design & Experience to SAP services and Digital Advisory.

Due to our positive business development, we want to keep growing in Austria and are therefore looking for colleagues who share our values: thriving an autonomous style of work, understanding learning as a lifestyle and seeking to make real, sustainable differences through digitalization for our customers in business and society.

With us you will be responsible for

supporting our local and international project teams with great IT solutions
supporting our existing team as a Developer to implement technical solutions suiting for our customers' needs
challenging and future oriented projects which range from basic conceptions to realizations at the clients' site globally and locally

We expect you to have

good technical skills and a consulting attitude
3+ years of Java development experience
knowledge of the common technologies like Spring
a good IT background – gathered by graduation from a technical college/university or resulting out of broad project experience
a passion for future developments in this area and the desire to learn more about great and innovative IT solutions
ability to handle discussions in German and English

As a person you are

proactive and act with open mind by challenging the status quo and drive actions for change
taking ownership of your results and delivered quality and passionately drive execution to add customer value
having fun at work, love to learn new things and work within a dynamic team

We offer

an exciting career path with a wide variety of personal and professional development opportunities
active participation in the development of our company together with talented colleagues and inspiring international environment
excellent teamwork which is part of our values and the possibility to share your competences with your colleagues
benefits like flexible working hours, home office, laptop and smartphone also for private use, health programs, team events, excellent public transport connection, food vouchers, fresh fruits, the perfect environment to prosper professionally etc.
a salary above the defined IT collective agreement of minimum EUR 3.455,00 per month. The amount of overpayment depends on your skills as well as your experience

Further information

If you are interested to work for a highly customer focused company together with an ambitious team you are warmly welcome to send in your application.

job_title: Web Full Stack Developer - Intranet Platform & Inhouse Apps (w/m/x)
job_description:
Direct message the job poster from REWE International AG
Zuzana Minarčíková
Zuzana Minarčíková
Technical and IT Sourcer Expert @ REWE International AG
Als Full Stack Entwickler*in verantwortest Du die Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Web-Applikationen in C#/.NET und/oder Java sowie modernen Frontend-Frameworks basierend auf JavaScript bzw. TypeScript.
Du besprichst die Anforderungen und Zielsetzungen mit dem Produktmanagement (Product Owner und Business Analyst*innen) und tauschst Dich mit Deinen Teammitgliedern und/oder internen Stakeholdern aus.
Als Schnittstelle zwischen Front- und Backend stellst Du sicher, dass alle Teile der Web-Applikationen gut miteinander verbunden sind und übernimmst die Entwicklungen in den jeweiligen Bereichen.
Durch regelmäßiges Code-Review und Refactoring stellst Du die Softwarequalität dauerhaft sicher.
Mit (automatisierten) Tests überprüfst Du die zugesicherte Funktionalität der Web-Applikationen.
Das Monitoring und die technische Dokumentation gehört ebenfalls zu Deinen Aufgaben.

Qualifikationen

Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt IT (HTL, FH, TU) oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen.
Erfahrungen in der Web-Entwicklung (REST-Services, JavaScript, HTML/CSS).
Routiniert im Umgang mit Versionskontrollsystemen (Git).
Erste Erfahrungen in agilen Softwareentwicklungsprozessen (Scrum, Kanban).
Vertrautheit mit relationalen Datenbanktechnologien (SQL, PL/SQL - Oracle).
Erfahrungen mit DevOps-Tätigkeiten (Windows Server, IIS) von Vorteil.
Erste Berührungspunkte mit Containerisierung, Cloud Services, CI/CD.
Affinität zum Schreiben von wartbarem, testbarem und sauberem Code.
Selbstorganisierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Zusätzliche Informationen

Langfristige, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit bei einem verlässlichen Arbeitgeber in einem kollegialen Team
Familienfreundliche Unternehmenskultur mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice unter Berücksichtigung Deiner individuellen Bedürfnisse
Mitarbeiter:innen-Rabatte bei Einkauf und Reisen
Zahlreiche Ausbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Konzern (5% der Arbeitszeit für selbstorganisierte Weiterbildung)

Be part of an engaged and open-minded team developing the future of mobile virtual network operators

job_title: Senior Full Stack Developer with enthusiasm about Security (m/f/x)
job_description:
Job Description

Design and implementation of features for data analysis in the area of security in Java, Angular, React, Node.js, Git, Eclipse/IntelliJ, Python
Research in the area of Cloud Application Security
Bring in know how about application security
Full-Stack development or Server-Backend focus, depending on your preference
Intensive collaboration with local and international development teams

Qualifications

Technical study in Computer Science or similar field
A minimum of 5 years of experience in Software Engineering
Excellent Java skills and ideally experience with Node.js, React or Angular
Interest in security and Big Data Analysis
Team player with proactive approach and high sensibility for quality

Additional Information

What's in it for you?

A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all.
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side. If you need to relocate for a position you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance and support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, as well as a dedicated buddy program.

Compensation And Rewards

We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 56,000 gross per year based on full-time employment (38.5 h/week). We offer a higher salary in line with qualification and experience.

Discover more perks & benefits

Growth opportunities - find out how Dynatrace supports your career development and personal growth journey: https://careers.dynatrace.com/grow-with-us/career-development/

Flexible working - our flexible and trusting work environment fits your current life situation: https://careers.dynatrace.com/ways-of-work/

Relocation Support - discover how we can support you if you wish to join us at one of our global locations: https://careers.dynatrace.com/relocation/
Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

Monika Graßmann
Bereichsleiterin Personal bei Zürcher Kantonalbank Österreich A
m/w/d | 80 – 100% | Salzburg oder Wien | Professional

Wir sind eine erfolgreiche, stark wachsende Privatbank mit Schweizer Wurzeln. Uns freut, dass vieles bei uns schon gut läuft, wissen aber, dass da noch mehr geht. Wir suchen Menschen, die mit uns impulsgebend und leidenschaftlich die Zukunft gestalten und dabei Verantwortung übernehmen wollen. Für unser Team IT-Infrastruktur suchen wir ein neues Teammitglied, welches die Digitalisierung mitgestaltet, den Grundstein für innovative Lösungen legt und die Weiterentwicklung in Richtung Cloud vorantreibt.

Mehr bekommen – Was wir dir bieten
Einen abwechslungsreichen, verantwortungsvollen Aufgabenbereich mit Gestaltungsmöglichkeit
Legeres Arbeitsklima und eine wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur
Individuell auf Deinen persönlichen Karriereplan abgestimmte Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Modern ausgestatteter IT-Arbeitsplatz und aktuelles Smartphone, auch zur Privatnutzung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Homeoffice-Möglichkeit
Attraktive Sozialleistungen wie Essensgutscheine, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Zuzahlung zur Krankenzusatzversicherung sowie Team-Events
Attraktives Onboarding-Paket
Ein attraktives Jahresbruttogehalt von mindestens € 60.000,- bei Vollzeitanstellung (KV-Gehalt und eine von Qualifikation und Erfahrung abhängige, marktkonforme Überzahlung)

Mehr gestalten – Was dich erwartet
Mitgestaltung unserer Cloud-Architektur inkl. Verantwortung für das Design sowie die Etablierung und Weiterentwicklung einer stabilen und effizienten Cloud-Lösung
Projektleitung für die Konzepterstellung und Implementierung einer Microsoft Cloud-Lösung (M365, Azure)
Integration von Cloud Services in die bestehende Infrastruktur
Stetige Weiterentwicklung der Cloud-Umgebung und Analyse weiterer möglicher Use Cases
Unterstützung der Kolleg:Innen bei der Wartung und Administrierung der On-Premise-Serverlandschaft sowie im Rechenzentrumsbetrieb

Mehr einbringen – Was du mitbringst
Abgeschlossene IT-Ausbildung (Studium, HTL, Lehre) und mind. 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Position
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Betrieb und der Administration von Azure und M365 Cloud-Lösungen
Erfahrung im Betrieb und der Administration von Windows Server-Umgebungen
Eigenverantwortliche, strukturierte und genaue Arbeitsweise sowie hohe Lernbereitschaft
Ausgeprägtes analytisches und vernetztes Denken sowie die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich darzustellen und zu vermitteln
Erfahrung in der Leitung komplexer IT-Projekte

Aufgabe

Als SoftwareentwicklerIn im Gesundheitsbereich unterstützt Du in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem bestehenden Team unsere Kunden bei der Einführung und Erweiterung des SAP basierten Krankenhausinformationssystem i.s.h.med.

Zu Deinen Aufgaben gehört unter anderem:
Erstellung von Softwareprodukten für Krankenhäuser
Entwicklungen in den SAP basierten Modulen IS-H und i.s.h.med
Erfassung, Abbildung und Optimierung von klinischen Prozessen
Aktive Mitwirkung bei Kundenprojekten im medizinischen Umfeld
Erarbeitung von technischen Lösungskonzepten in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Fachabteilungen und Kunden


Profil
Abschluss einer einschlägigen Ausbildung (HTL/FH/Universität) mit Informatikschwerpunkt oder vergleichbare Ausbildung/Berufserfahrung
Programmierkenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Sprache
Analytisches, lösungsorientiertes Denkvermögen
Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein und ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung
Von Vorteil, jedoch nicht Voraussetzung:
Kenntnisse in der SAP eigenen Programmiersprache ABAP

Leoben, AT

15935

Be part of our team!

AT&S, a world leading high-tech PCB & IC substrates company, industrialises leading-edge technologies for automotive, aerospace, industrial, medical, consumer electronics and communication networks. We are looking for talent eager to shape the future of our interconnected world. With plants in Austria, China, India, Korea, Malaysia and sales offices around the globe, we offer excellent career opportunities for creators, innovators and enablers with the drive to make a difference.

To enhance our successful Corporate R&D Team at the Headquarters in Leoben, Austria, we are looking for a passionate

R&D Project Leader (f/m/d) - IC Substrate Focused

who is seasoned in technology development acting as a matual project leader to manage projects and project teams, ensuring success in terms of reputation, profitability across a multi-disciplinary environment.

Your Responsibilities:
Leading Project(s) and project teams, assure execution of the Work Packages according to plans, and within allocated Budgets to reduce development risk for AT&S.
Representation of AT&S vis-à-vis internal and external parties in all project related aspects (customers, suppliers, partners, Business Units, funding agencies etc.).
Protection of IP out of above mentioned development projects.
Keeping an overview on all technological developments in and outside of AT&S in the greater area of the project and the main area of expertise.

Your Profile:
Graduate degree in physics, chemistry, mechatronics or electronics, telecommunication, or medical engineering or equivalent professional experience.
Decent Knowledge in at least one of the following areas: PCB, IC-substrate and Semiconductor Packaging technologies, Semiconductors and related markets.
5+ years of experience in/as project leader in Development or Manufacturing of technology, or an expert in electronics Industry.
Customer orientation and entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Open-minded, "out-of-the-box thinker", constantly learn and evolve.
Proficiency in spoken and written English.
Willingness to travel abroad and for short-term assignments in Asia.

Our Offer
Personal and professional growth opportunities in a multinational, dynamic company
Chance to actively contribute to AT&S´ success and to create value
A secure position with long-term career perspective in an internationally expanding environment
A wide range of tasks in an innovative and performance-oriented environment
Attractive and competitive compensation package

Ready for a new challenge to advance your career? It´s just a click to apply online. We look forward to your application and your detailed resume. Your AT&S Team!

AT&S is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are dedicated to empowering people to reach their potential by fostering their unique talents and strengths. Our compensation packages are competitive and take individual qualifications and experience into consideration. In accordance with the Austrian collective labor agreement, we advise that the minimum gross annual salary for this role is 54.898,- Euro. We will, in any case, offer market-conforming payment taking qualifications and professional experience into account.

Regional Project Manager - FTTH / Fiber

I'm currently on the lookout for an experienced FTTH Project Manager for a well established, global telecommunications company.

With close to over 60,000 employees globally, this global giant are a leader in connectivity solutions and their products have won international awards.

In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the FTTH (Fiber to the home) projects across the region. You will be responsible for looking after sub contractors that are doing the construction work for the fiber lines across the region. You will work closely with the customer, responsible for communication, project deadlines, defining project plans and project fulfillment for time, cost and the scope. You will also be defining the monthly KPI's for the fiber deployment milestones. Some travel will be involved, perhaps once a week in order to visit the customer and also build sites.

There is a strong preference for on-site in Vienna but they may be open to discsuss 1 day per week remote, depending on personal circumstance. This is due to company policies in place.

This is a full-time, permanent position and will pay between €70,000-€100,000 fixed salary, depending on experience level. The ideal salary is around €85,000 but there is room. There may also be a bonus on top, depending on project performance, however, this is not in the contract.

For this FTTH Regional Project Manager position, I'm interested in speaking to people with the following:

- 3+ years experience in FTTH / Fiber Project Management or similar role within FTTH
- German and English speaker

I welcome your application if you'd like to find out more and if you know someone it would suit, we offer a fantastic referral scheme which I would be happy to discuss.

Telecommunications / FTTH / Project Manager / Fixed Network / FTTX / Fiber

We are the leading insurance group in Central and Eastern Europe. We are characterized by commitment, competence and service orientation, and we stand for diversity and respect. With around 29,000 employees in more than 50 insurance companies and pension funds in 30 countries, we are a diverse team with different talents and exciting fields of work in an inclusive environment. We stand for reliability, based on our values, tradition and stability
We offer a pleasant working environment with a strong emphasis on teamwork

Based on the legal requirements, we inform about the monthly minimum salary of EUR 2 300 gross on the basis of full-time employment (38.5 hours / week). Join The Team Redefining How The World Experiences Design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where And How You Can Work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney, Australia but Austria is home to part of our European operations. And with that you will have choice in how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if you're nearby), at home or a bit of both, it's up to you.

Fun fact - our Austrian team actually started out as Kaleido before being acquired by us in 2021. Kaleido's product team develops visual AI products, that make complex things simple for users. Now, together we deliver visual AI features within Canva to help reimagine how artificial intelligence can be used in design. We think it's a perfect match.

What You’d Be Doing In This Role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

In this role, you'll collaborate closely with our Frontend and Machine Learning Teams to solve complex system engineering problems and deliver a delightful experience to our users.

Your tasks

Help us maintain and evolve our standalone product designify.com and its integration in Canva Product Photos. Additionally to that, you will also build backend services that will power our ML-based content generation features in Canva.
Contribute to the evolving backend tech stack as part of a highly functional and passionate team.
Work in close collaboration with the AI/ML and Frontend teams in Australia and Austria to deliver cutting-edge features in the domain of content generation.
Write and test high-quality, reliable code in Java.
Lead and deliver medium-sized projects in an autonomous way.

Requirements

Firmly grounded computer science and engineering fundamentals including concurrency, multithreading, data structures, solution design, architecture, and design patterns.
Commercial experience developing complex web applications in Java.
Familiarity with AWS Cloud Infrastructure and services such as EC2, ECS, and Terraform. Additional experience with other cloud providers would be a plus e.g. GCP/Azure
Experience in designing and working with distributed systems that need to scale and be robust to sustain heavy traffic.
Know-How of tooling and concepts behind CI/CD.

Benefits

Work in one of the fastest-growing visual AI startups in Austria surrounded by like-minded people. Our visual AI products are industry-leading solutions that are easing the life of more than 25 million people globally every month.
Be a part of the Canva family . Our collaboration with teams around the globe supercharges our work to empower the world to design. Canva’s success story is unique - and you benefit from it by participating in the company stock option program.
Join an international team in Vienna (more than 65 people from 25 nationalities) and collaborate with lots of smart, like-minded people who love to ship quickly and you get to know the space of visual AI. Watch this video to learn more about our engineering organization - a tech talk given by your future coach/manager at Kaleido.
You will have a flexible work schedule of 38.5h/week and a no-all-in contract. Work remotely, from our office located in Vienna's 3rd district, or mix-and-match. We can easily find an option that works best for you and Kaleido.
We care about our employees and we believe mental health should be a priority, just like taking care of our bodies and staying in shape. We provide mental health support through an online platform specialized in professional counseling.
Your lunch and your commute with Wiener Linien are on us. You can also find unlimited snacks, coffee, and beverages in our office.
You receive a yearly allowance for professional education & personal well-being as well as additional leave days for volunteering.
We organize regular (international) events at the company & team levels to foster team bonding.

We are required by law to state the minimum salary for this position, which is at least EUR 55,000 gross per year. We pay competitive salaries - depending on your qualifications and experience - and you also get to participate in the company’s stock option program.

What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a Taste Of What's On Offer

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other Stuff To Know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.
